review_body: this hotel is one of the best hotel one can book. i have no qualms just pure satisfaction. The location was good. i was happy to be given room on top floor where the view of the city at night was to die for. The food was just yummy, ate to my hearts content.

Stayed in the Corner King room with view of Tokyo tower and it was worth every penny. The views were incredible, including Mount Fuji on clear days. Bed was huge and room was spotless. The hotel itself is very stylish and the staff were extremely polite and helpful. The location is very good. The hotel is just above Shiodome St. which is very convenient for getting to Odaiba in particular. For access to the JR lines, Shimbashi St. is only a few minutes walk. The area directly around the hotel is quiet, but if you're looking for more eateries, bars etc., there's plenty around Shimbashi St. Will definitely stay in this hotel again and highly recommend.

A modern, spacious and good value hotel conveniently located near two subway lines. We pain a little more for the Tokyo tower view and it was most definitely worth it. Woke up on the first morning to a spectacular view of Mt Fuji as a backdrop. Will be using this hotel again.

We booked this hotel as a central spot to be able to tour Tokyo for a couple of days before boarding a cruise at the Yokohama terminal. We really liked the convenience of the train stations beneath the hotel. The location is in a non-touristy area so it was really neat to see the regular activity of Tokyo. The hotel had a nice breakfast - we paid for it only once though as it was a bit pricey. We couldn't pass up the convenience of the restaurant in the hotel at night though - after a long day of touring we really appreciated the good food. The bed was comfortable. The view from the room was nice - really cool to see the city buzzing down below. We could hear the trains go by - but it wasn't too disturbing. The room was perfect for what we needed. The staff was amazing - they were ready to help with any requests (extra towel, question on the area). We would stay here again if we get back to Tokyo!

Excellent location, staff were welcoming, helpful and very polite. Printed off a Google map for a Cafe I wanted to visit. Good variety of food at breakfast. Complementary voucher for a cocktail in the bar. Would recommend this hotel for short stays, say 3 to 5 days.

We booked this hotel after viewing the artist rooms online and we weren't disappointed. Although they do not assign rooms ahead of time we gave them a list of preferable rooms (if they were available) and got the geisha goldfish, which was incredible. The view of the Tokyo Tower made it even better.Staff was polite and helpful. They booked a few restaurant reservations we asked about beforehand and even gave us a map for how to locate them. The only slight downside is at one of the high end steak restaurants (Satou) they required you to book ahead of time certain meals, which we weren't aware of, so my husband was unable to get his meal of choice. On the English speaking websites we didn't see anything about this and can't blame the concierge, but just a note in the future would be helpful for the concierge to follow up with the restaurant if any additional reservations are required.All in all would recommend! Great location (close to subways) and was the perfect choice for our honeymoon and fit within our budget. The front desk was even kind enough to give us champagne and there were decorations as well in our room. Thank you for making our four days in Tokyo for our honeymoon a wonderful time. If you are interested in additional photos/review of Park Hotel Tokyo, please see the link in my profile.
user_name:
blissfrombalance
New York City, New York

review_body: We stayed 3 nights and really liked this hotel. Staff were absolutely lovely, so friendly and helpful and they spoke excellent English. The lobby is on 25th floor and on a clear day you can see mount Fuji. The whole place is adorned with artwork. Our room was very nice, with a good bathroom and had a view of the river. They do a very nice buffet breakfast. We also ate in their Japanese restaurant one night (where they made some vegetarian ramen for me) and in their main restaurant with a more European flavour and it was all really good. It is very easy to get around with Shiadome and Shimbashi stations accessible from the subway if you take the lift down to the basement. Hamarikyu gardens are just across the road and its possible to take a cruise back from Asakusa and get off there, which is very pleasant.

Great hotel in an awesome location. The hotel is between Shimbashi station & Shidome station which will get you everywhere. Rooms are comfortable, good bed & shower, with fridge, tea & coffee. Staff are superb, very friendly & helpful. Very close to many places to eat around Shimbashi station & a Family Mart in the building

A very individualistic hotel dedicated to art. Very unique indeed. Had its own galleries on several floors and worth an hour or two just to look at all this within the hotel. Our regular room , albeit a bit small and with a very standard hotel interior, nonetheless had a great view of Tokyo Tower and this was especially breathtaking at night. There were some rooms decorated and painted by individual artists and each was unique and a work of art in itself literally, but we did not stay in one of these special rooms but took a regular one which was decent enough. All in all, this was quite a lovely stay during a sunny winter’s day in Tokyo and I would highly recommend this charming hotel to anyone who wants to try a hotel that is just a little different from the usual norm. Especially recommended for those artsy and creative types.....

Perfect for our 4-night stay in Tokyo - the staff was super helpful and spoke great English. The Hotel is located in the Ginza area of Tokyo so it is very easy to walk to beautiful shops and great restaurants. There is posh shopping and anything you would like to eat. The hotel is also VERY accessible from the subway and train which is walkable to the hotel. The rate was very affordable and the rooms were much larger than I anticipated, plus the view was amazing! Personally, we did not eat breakfast but there is an option for breakfast in the hotel + a hotel bar.
Great hotel in an excellent situation staff were very welcoming Breakfast good easy to get a cab right outsideView from reception looked out over the city and could see bullet trains go by frequently

What’s not to like about waking up to a postcard view of Mount Fuji from your bed! Pay the extra and get the corner rooms. Ask for a room that faces west. Great having the hotel commence on the 25th floor as all rooms have views. International professional staff are excellent. Great position. One major (minor for some I assume) Is only one bedside light. Unless you’re a single this is an issue. Easily fixed but hard to fathom why it hasn’t been, as if you’re on the wrong side of the bed it’s dark.

Located in the business district, very comfortable room. Breakfast options for all tastes. Lovely view from the high floors, hotel is floor 25-35 in the building. Convenient access to the JR and other train/subway lines.

Two of us spent 4 days here in September 2019. The lobby of the hotel is on the 26th floor of the Shiodome Media Tower in Tokyo. The staff were very attentive & friendly. We were upgraded to "The Castle Room" a couple of floors above our original room. The basement opens to the underground, where you can travel to all parts of the city by train. This hotel has a good restaurant & is close to many attractions. A good base to branch ot from as a tourist. Very nice.

We spent 3 nights here before our cruise. We caught a bus from the airport right to the door.having to travel to the 25th floor for reception felt odd but staff welcoming and helpful when there. King corner room was spacious and gave wonderful views. The food was good in the lobby restaurant. Good location for trains and walking. They also have a guest laundry which was helpful . The staff arranged a car for us to travel to Yokohama. Late check out was useful. We would stay there again.

This was the 3rd time my wife and I stayed at the Park Hotel Tokyo. It is a wonderful hotel with an extremely helpful staff. The hotel itself has one of the nicest lobbies, with views of the Tokyo tower and Mt Fuji (on a clear day). It’s a 15 min walk from the heart of Ginza, it has the Shiodome station right next door and Shimbashi station is about a 5 min walk away. This allows you to get around on the subway system easily. The rooms are clean and a good size for a Tokyo hotel. There is a fitness center as well, albeit quite small it still gets the job done for those looking to stay on top of workouts while on vacation.Their concierge service is great at helping with booking restaurants that would otherwise be difficult to do on your own.We’ve stayed at the Park Hotel now 3 years in a row and love it. Highly recommend.
user_name:
tonygw87
New York City, New York

review_body: The hotel is very conveniently located above the Shiidome metro station and only a short walk to the Shimbashi JR Station. So all of Tokyo is within easy striking distance from there and it’s an easy walk to Ginza, Tukji fish markets and the beautiful Hamarikyu gardens. The hotel staff were all very helpful and attentive. We had a wonderful dinner in the restaurant and the hotel rooms are nicely designed with different artistic works in each room. Great views from the hotel tower, you will probably see Mt Fuji in a clear day from the hotel lobby. All in all a very comfortable and happy stay for my family.

Stylish, reasonably sized room with a big window and wonderful view of the city. Reminded me of the hotel room in Lost in Translation. Tiny bathroom but maybe that's normal for Tokyo. Located near a train station. Lots of art pieces in the lobby; some pretty and endearing, some deeply weird. There are three restaurants in the hotel, and while the food wasn't bad, the menus were limited and had very little vegetarian food. This hotel is not cheap but it is a really nice place to stay

Conveniently located above Shiodome station, and about 7 minutes walk from Shimbashi station which is an interchange between Japan Rail lines (for our JR pass) and metro lines (for our Pasmo pass). The lobby is on the 25th floor, in a large atrium where breakfast is served. Our room was modest in size, but adequate, and had decent views on surrounding skyscrapers and part of Tokyo Bay. Although the TV had BBC World News, this was frustratingly dubbed in Japanese at times. The toilet was of the warm-seat variety, offering various functionalities. There was a safe in the room and a hair drier, but no iron.

Really nice hotel with amazing views and art everywhere. The lobby is on the 25th floor and guest rooms higher than that. Did I mention the views? Train stations to everywhere just below the hotel too.

We had a really good 3 night stay at the Park Hotel Tokyo. While part of a business tower, the hotel has a stylish aesthetic and stunning views. Our room had a fantastic view of the bay. The bed was ultra comfortable. While the bathroom felt a bit dated, the room was otherwise modern and well appointed. We really liked the hotel location. It’s very close to Ginza, which is an excellent neighborhood for great bars (eg Star Bar), restaurants, cafes (eg cafe de l’ambre) and shopping. Once we got oriented, we usually took the Park Hotel elevator to the subway level and walked through the underground from Shiodome station area to Shimbashi station to exit for our Ginza outings. Shimbashi station is also notable because of the Yamonote line. Since we had a JR pass, we could ride that line with our pass so it was convenient for getting around to key areas of the city like Shibuya and Shinjuku. The staff at the hotel were all incredibly friendly and helpful, especially as we had to receive a package to the hotel. The fitness centre is very tiny and can only be used by reservation. If you’re a fitness enthusiast, this might be a drawback. I never had issues with the booking system, though I didn’t always get my first choice. Considering a lot of hotels in Tokyo don’t have fitness centres at all or charge for them, I was satisfied with what this hotel offered. This was our second hotel in Tokyo. For the comfort, style, service, reasonable cost and proximity to Ginza, we’d stay here again in a heartbeat.

The hotel location is good. Near to Shimbashi & Shidome station. Artistic decorated rooms. Staff are very helpful and polite. Excellent service. Should improve in breakfast selection. Stayes for a week, everyday same selection. Nice view of Tokyo tower from hotel room level 31

This hotel was quirky. We got the washi-en room. It was interesting. The only annoying part was that the intro video would play each time we entered the room. #sighLocation was good, but it probably would have been better to pick something in Shinjuku. Not a bad location. Service could have been slightly better. Still gave 5 stars. Would stay here again.

The concierge refusing to make a dinner reservation in a different restaurant on the day of my check-out. (See picture attached)Never experienced something like this before and in my opinion they spend more time typing this letter instead of calling the restaurant.

Yes the hotel is located close to subway exit, however it was a bit tricky to find its entrance, because you have to go up what looks like a commercial building and then to its lobby. You got to change lifts in order to arrive at your room. The area is quite business kind of feel, so it's not a typical tourist area. Headed to Shinbashi station late night searching for food, there are many office workers around who seem to have had drinks after work. Once I understand more about walking around, it is still convenient to get to transportation. So overall had mixed feeling to its location. Enjoyed a room with Tokyo Tower view, which is great. Since the traffic is busy down the streets, so even though my room is on 30th floor, I am able to hear the traffic noise in my sleep, which is weird. Service from front and housekeeping is very nice as well. When I had a request, they tried their best to understand my needs, although at the end they did not have what I needed, they offered an alternative and tried their best to help. Thank you!

Let me get the bad out of the way.in a country that prides itself on tea making,the tea at breakfast was the worst we have come across.havingsaid the breakfast was extensive allbeit the hot stuff could have been hotter.The television was all in japanese,including the bbc world news dubbed over,very annoying.Having had my gripe everything else was very good,sorry you can hear the trains from34 floors up,it is a very nice hotel.we would stay again!

As others have mentioned this is quite a corporate style hotel. We booked an art room for a bit extra, not completely convinced it was worth it but the rooms themselves were clean and functional, albeit a bit airless. Great views from the 31st floor, good breakfast, very helpful and polite staff. Also, great location for Shimbashi station to explore the rest of Tokyo

We loved staying here. Friendly, helpfull and full of good advice. The breakfasts are very very good. The rooms really nice. The fact that it is an Art Hotel and it takes its art very seriously means that there is always a lot of interest on the walls with various exhibitions and permanent works. Being in the Shiodome means that the hotel is very central and close to many many restaurants as well as local stations. We found it a really good place to stay from the point of view of getting around and going out for meals. There is an underground area joining various buildings, restaurants and a station. Beautifully done, very clean and makes getting around the immediate area easy as you don't have to deal with traffic and any rain.First class hotel. If we ever went back to Tokyo this is where we would want to stay.

I stayed here for just under a week and was impressed. My room was comfortable and quiet. The restaurant choice was good - I can still recall with pleasure the venison I ate a week ago in the French restaurant. The location at Shiodome is fine - yes, following the signs to and from the Shiodome station to the hotel is a challenge till you get used to it. Look out for gates 7/8 and you should find the hotel again, via the lift to the 25th floor.Staff were very helpful. I’d happily return when/if I’m in Tokyo again.

THe art aspect of the hotel lent interest to what is otherwise a fairly corporate place centrally located for Ginza and the surrounding shops. The staff are polite and helpful and the rooms comfortable. Being on the top 9/10 floors of a 30+ story building made access less than easy.

When we reach there we don’t like, latter we feel this the best Service of the staff was the best Most of the train station was connected with the hotel Food was also good Not costly Reception was excellent

A great base to explore Tokyo, it’s near a tube station, yet fairly quiet. Very clean with very friendly and helpful staff. Breakfasts excellent. Ticks most of the boxes, although it is a slightly impersonal corporate hotel

Sunday 10 November 2019 -Tuesday 12 November 2019Price = Slightly higher to compared to other hotels nearby (4 out of 5)Cleanliness/Rooms = We had two rooms for our group of five. We had to change both rooms because it was not cleaned correctly. Dirty stains around the toilet, dust/balls (accumulation of not being cleaned for a long time) on coffee/drinks machine, marks on walls and carpet, plasters and other items left by previous hotel guest were not cleaned/removed before we entered. The 'upgraded' rooms was cleaner but smaller. (1 out 5)Service = The service was quick and efficient. (5 out of 5)Food/Restaurant = There is only one restaurant that serves all the days meals. We only had breakfast which was limited but what they served tasted fresh and well made. (5 out of 5)Overall Experience = The overall experience was ruined by the lack of cleaning, especially as we spend more time in our rooms and not in the reception/communal areas (even though that was nice). If this was a '2 or 3 star' hotel I would given this a top score (5 out of 5). But since this is a '4 star' hotel I was let down so it just gets a '3 out of 5' but only just.The staff/person who helped us during our stay were very helpful and the lower rating is no reflection on them.

Thoroughly enjoyable three night stay at the Park.From the warm welcome on arrival, an easy check in process things were off to a good start.My Tokyo Tower City View was ideal, not huge, but good amenities, comfortable bed. Best of all on day 2 being treated to a stunning view of Mt Fuji from my bedroom on a clear Tokyo day.Buffet Breakfast is substantial, with both Western and Japanese offerings. Location wise can't be better - only two stops from Tokyo Station on the Yamanote line, easy access to Odaiba and also other key sights in the city.There are several train lines within easy walking distance, and for those heading to Tokyo station with a large amount of luggage, taxis are an affordable and quick way to get there.The hotel has pre printed cards to assist your taxi driver to get you to where you need to go easily.The area itself is more a Business area, however there are still a good arrange of dining options around.

This was the first stop of our two week trip in Japan. The Park Hotel is immaculate and the entire staff is very gracious and helpful. The public areas are modern and attractive and have a stunning collection of paintings and other artwork. We were not expecting a big room but ours was brown and dreary and we were literally tripping on our suitcases, plus the a/c was broken. We complained in the morning, and within an hour, we were switched to a better room. As a rule we do not eat in hotel restaurants but one night we were so exhausted that we tried the lounge restaurant and it was delicious. We were not crazy about the location. The Shiodome area is pretty dead at night, and not ideal for a first-time tourist. Ginza and Tokyo Station areas are better.

The hotel is nicely situated on the top floors of a high rise in the Shiodome area. It is easy to get in and out of and you have so many options to get to the airports. The hotel is clean as you would expect and the staff is very helpful. Internet is good and there is a small desk area in the room to work from. The big windows overlooking the city are great! The hotel does not have much personality but is not necessarily meant to. It is meant to be an excellent option for business and tour travel. You are walking distance to a more working class neighborhood by the Shimbashi station so if you want a quick bite to eat or a drink with a local feel it works well. Don't expect much from the food options at the hotel.

This hotel is amazing in all respects. The rooms are comfortable, the staff is amazing-so helpful and accommodating. One of the staff (Ketty) took me downstairs to be sure I got a taxi to my proper destination. Good restaurants. Be sure to say hi to Kenji In the Whiskey Bar. He knows his beer, scotch and whiskey!

The hotel is in a great location, is immaculately clean, well maintained and the staff were incredibly helpful. We stayed on the Tokyo Tower side and had immense views of Tokyo and Mt. Fuji in the distance! The only (tiny) thing we didn’t love was the pillows were a bit odd (they had a hard layer on the underside which felt a bit like small pieces of wood). And the super comfortable bed was so massive it could have done with 2 extra pillows... but this is being uber picky!!

On the 17th floor of the media building, even the "ground floor" view is breathtaking. I wound up taking time-lapse videos from our room. I can't say enough great things about this hotel - the service is impeccable and the make you feel at home regardless of your native language. We stayed here on our first time to a country where we didn't speak the language and they're so helpful and welcoming! They're also great to double check any questions regarding some basic phrases and manners (no tipping & finish your ramen! haha)

We stayed for 3 nights and were impressed with the high standard and good service. Ask to have breakfast in the side dining room for spectacular views.Really well situated for exploring Tokyo as it’s a 5 minute stroll to a railway and subway station.Highly recommended

To access the hotel you need to catch a lift to Floor 25 of the Media Tower Building. As a result, the views were superb, especially as we were located on the 29th floor. Our room, booked through Trailfinders, had great views of the nearby Hamarikyu Gardens and the Sumida River. The room itself, by Tokyo standards, was of a decent size and well equipped. The hotel has an excellent location, close to both underground and main line stations. It's an easy walk into the Ginza area.Breakfast has a mixture of Asian and European dishes, both hot and cold.

I booked 3 nights stay directly on the hotel website which gave a 15% discount. I joined their loyalty program as immediately I could enjoy a bottle of water each day among other benefits. The hotel promotes art and in fact I witnessed a local artist at work in the lobby. The hotel is almost like an art gallery - even some rooms were painted with visuals by different artists and enjoy their own theme. Tried the breakfast but limited variety compared with some other hotels. Overall, housekeeping was good and the stay was quite pleasant.

This hotel was perfect! I would absolutely stay here again. It was very clean and each staff member that I interacted with was helpful, friendly and polite. We took a train from Narita to Tokyo station and then another train to Shimbashi station. Very easy walk from there to the hotel. Our room (a deluxe twin) was very spacious. More than enough room for the two of us and our luggage. The location is great, the views are great, the food was great. I have nothing bad to say about this hotel. Highly recommend staying here

Selected this hotel for location because it’s attached to Shimbashi station underground. Hotel provides a map, it’s easy to find if you follow the map! We chose the artist floor and the rooms have excellent personality. Good size too. Very pleasantly surprised with amazing view of Tokyo Tower from the Mt. Fuji room. Breakfast buffet a great spread with western and Asian fare. The lobby lounge restaurant served tasty simple food, good for when you are arrive late. Staff friendly, competent, and speak English well.

I selected the hotel off the internet so I was not sure what we would get. We were so happy to find the hotel. Great service, nice rooms and once you get your bearing an easy place to travel the subway system to and from.The room was very clean with great amenities. We had a room on the 31st floor which was an artist room. Great unique artwork in the room and a little "lounge" on the floor with baked goods and coffee in the morning and wine in the evening (great view).A couple very little things that were challenging. We are finding Tokyo hard to navigate (English speaking with no Japanese) and getting to the hotel from the airport was tough. Google maps led us astray a few times and because the hotel is on the 25 floor it is not obvious (signage is small and discreet). We took the train from the airport and came above ground to find it. We realized later that from the subway it is much easier underground to get there but had to learn after a few failed attempts. We figured all this out on day 2 so not a big deal for us.All in all great choice for a hotel in Tokyo!

This is the second time I have stayed at this hotel, the first being two years ago before taking a cruise. I have to admit, I love its location, I love the atmosphere, the breakfast is good and the reception is welcoming and efficient. However, on entering my room I remembered why I was not too pleased with the hotel first time around.....and why I should have booked elsewhere. The room itself was nice enough if a little small, clean and comfortable, but the smell as soon as you entered was of dampness or more like "sweaty bodies". This was exactly the same when I was there 2 years ago. Every time I entered the room, the lingering smell was pervasive. This is not typical of hotels in Japan, as during my visit this time for the rugby World Cup I stayed in both Kakegawa and Yokohama. In both places the rooms were prefect. As an aside, my son and his wife stayed at the neighbouring Park Prince Hotel and their room was also smell free. All in all a great hotel in a great location but they do need to sort out this issue. Would I stay here again ??? yes but only if the problem was rectified !

Leading up to this booking, I struggled a bit to find a 5-star hotel that was not ridiculously overpriced because of the Rugby World Cup. After combing through endless reviews, I decided on the Park Hotel Tokyo, and was pleasantly surprised. The location was great, there were two train stations within walking distance, and also the Ginza Corridor was nearby which had a ton of restaurants for you to choose from. The decor of the hotel was modern and stylish. We stayed in an "artist room." The room itself was small but well decorated. We had a great view of the Tokyo Tower. As we were on the artist floor. we had access to a lounge that provided free pre-dinner drinks. Sadly, when we went there our first night, there were just empty bottles left. When i relayed this to the staff, they immediately apologized, and sent me and my husband a bottle of champagne. They also made sure that someone who make sure the lounge was adequately stocked & erviced the following evening. Breakfast was great, there was enough variety for most palettes, and I especially appreciated the lovely early-morning breakfast the staff set up for us for our early departure. If I had any criticism it would be that coffee came out of a simple automated machine, hopefully they consider making fresh-brewed coffee in the future. The staff were all lovely, which absolutely helps to set the tone at any hotel you are staying at. The Park Hotel left quite a good impression on us, we will certainly be back!

We stayed here for 3 nights when we were in Tokyo for the Rugby World Cup. It’s in a great location about 6 minutes walk from Shimbashi station with and even closer to Shiodome station and the area has loads of restaurants and bars. The hotel starts on floor 25 where there is a pleasant open reception and atrium dining room and lounge. The staff are welcoming and speak good English. The bedrooms are small but very comfortable, the small ensuite are immaculate and effective tho as first timers in Japan we found the sizeable and complex WCs really extraordinary. The choice and quality of food at breakfast was really good and the coffee excellent. All in all a good hotel worth its 4 star rating.

The artist rooms here are very special - we loved the castle room! Not sure I would bother with the non-artist rooms since I felt like the room was a bit outdated underneath the (impressive and beautiful) artwork. Great views of the city as it is located in a high-rise. The staff is very welcoming and well-equipped to serve international visitors to Tokyo.A bit of a trek from Shimbashi Station with luggage, although during bad weather it is nice that you can get from the station to the hotel using underground passages. Shimbashi/Shiodome wouldn't be my top neighborhood recommendation for a first time visitor to the city, but there are very convenient transit connections available so you could certainly do worse! Overall I think this can be a very good value for those seeking a nice mid-range option and I would definitely stay here again at some point in the future!

The lobby is on 25. The rooms are well outfitted, newish, the bathrooms spacious, great views from every room. Good breakfast choices. Fairly central, can walk to Ginza in 20 minutes, Tsujiki fish market 15 minutes, and other attractions and sites. Near Shimbashi station. Family Mart in the subway downstairs if you’re cheap like me and want to buy your own beer or wine . Not overly pricey.

Booked through Trail finders very efficient for the whole trip but this hotel has fantastic views good sized bedrooms and includes breakfast I would thoroughly recommend it but it is not de luxe. Has all the amenities you want including free wi fi all toiletries and a Japanese loo which has buttons all over it and talks to you. The staff are remarkable extraordinarily friendly and all speak English. Position is perfect by Shimbashi station and we walked to Tsukiji market and the Ginza today easily

Convenient location with trains and subway lines. A modern neighborhood which is clean and efficient but offers little in terms of shops or dining places. Not a big problem easy connections for everywhere. The hotel starting floor 25 and above offers beautiful views unobstructed. Very pleasant lobby with many art products from modern Japanese artists. Rooms are Lear clean and well equipped. Rather small rooms as is customary in Japan. Service is friendly and omnipresent. Prices very reasonable for what is offered

We were on the top floor #34 for super typhoon Hagibis. Great service and only some slight shaking in the storm. Hotel has fantastic views and a convenient spot near Ginza, well recommended. Smoking room much appreciated by smokers

It's not located in the middle of the busies spot but yet very accessible and convenient. Glad that there were few mainland guests and public spaces were quiet and decent. Good service helping us a lot in arranging transport to the airport. A lot of eateries in the commercial buildings and metro stations nearby.

We booked this hotel and the amazing view We stayed at the 29th floor corner room and we had the most amazing sunrise and sunsets not to mention the night view. As for the hotel it is located in the business district. Location not bad, we managed to find our way though we were lost couple of times. We didn’t enjoy the breakfast ( not really international). Helpful staffBig room and comfy bed

We stayed for 2 nights as a group of 9 as part of a touring trip. The staff were very helpful, pleasant and obliging. The rooms were fine, just very small and basic. A bit of a business hotel feel to it.

We have stayed numerous times at the Park Hotel Tokyo over the years. I have no hesitation giving a five star rating. I’ve stayed at some hotels who lose their lustre over time, standards slip, costs and services are cut. But not at The Park Hotel Tokyo. It’s on the 25-34th Floor of a modern tower in Shiodome. Actually connected to an off street level walkway that takes you to the next door Yuriakome metro station and elsewhere. Staff are welcoming and helpful. The hotel boasts not only one of the best Japanese restaurants in Tokyo (according to a very discerning Japanese friend of mine and we ate there with him one night endorsing this rating). There is also a branch of the Scotch Whisky Society (equally good and bad news for me since I spent a lot of money in there during our stay). Also a French style restaurant we did not try. The central lobby bar and breakfast area is also really good and one of the best caipirinhas in Tokyo is available there. Our 34th floor room was modestly sized, well equipped and had a fantastic view over Shimbashi and the surrounding area. This 34th floor vantage also vibrated, shuddered and swayed when a category 3 typhoon (actually one of the strongest to hit the Tokyo area in recent times) hit on the second night of our stay. Lashing rain and driving winds pummelled the building and it was disconcerting. The only thing I would say is staff should have put a notice round saying the building is built to withstand severe earthquakes and will sway slightly and judder as a number of guests were quite alarmed. Other than that possible oversight, we enjoyed our stay and will not hesitate to return to Park Hotel Tokyo in future Tokyo trips, and now we have our Park Hotel card that offers some discounts to frequent stayers

Prior to my arrival, I emailed the concierge for some advice and they replied instantly. So I had an idea the service would be good.We arrived very early and used their facilities to wash and change as the rooms were not ready. On our return from sightseeing, the bags were in the room with certain items hung up. The room had a good view and was large enough. The bathroom had a bath and shower with a superb toilet and toiletries. Front desk staff could not have been more helpful. They really gave good advice about things to do, how to get around and local dining. The location of the hotel is superb close to everything, Ginza, restaurants etc. Breakfast was excellent a wide variety and well cookedOverall a wonderful stay and would go back again

This is a very nice hotel in terms of services and kindness.We stayed three nights full of enjoyment. It is very close to monorail in Tokyo and the view from floor 33 is fantastic.Staff are very kind and the breakfast is satisfactory.

Excellent staff. Very friendly and helpful. The rooms are a nice size, breakfast is very good and there is something for everyone. The hotel is also above one of the stations of the underground. Amazing views from the rooms too!

We stayed at Park Hotel for 4 nights and it was our favourite hotel we stayed in during our 2 weeks in Japan. We stayed in quite a large room with a view overlooking Tokyo Tower and the City which was a fantastic view and well worth the extra cost. The staff at the hotel were very welcoming and helpful. The hotel was well located for Shimbashi JR line station and even closer to a subway stop (although we only used the JR lines as we had the JR rail pass) and in a quieter area of the City. The hotel buffet breakfast was excellent, very tasty and had a wide range of western and Japanese foods. We arrived close to breakfast finishing time one morning as we had been out for an early morning tour and the staff were more than happy to still seat us and there was no rush to leave the dining area even when the breakfast buffet had closed. I would highly recommend staying at this hotel.

The Park Hotel has a number of positives. It is very convenient for transport with the station just a few minutes walk away, offering easy connections to the airport and other parts of the city. The reception area is very pleasant and the breakfast buffet really quite decent - even if the coffee machine is not the best. I should also mention service, the staff are friendly and helpful and I was enormously grateful for them arranging a number of restaurant bookings in advance of our arrival.The downside here, it seems, are the rooms. Some are no doubt larger but I am currently typing with the back of my chair against one wall with my calves resting on the queen size bed. On the far side of the bed is a gap as wide as my foot is long. The wardrobe is tiny and the bathroom about as small as I can remember seeing.My son reasoned that this is a 4* hotel because the lobby is 5* and the rooms 3*.

justified the good reviews from other travellers and the proximity to the subway station is definitely a big plus. Travelling to and from the airport through SUBWAYs is a breeze as well, since elevators are available .will definitely consider this in our next visit to tokyo

Booked 2 artist rooms. Excellent views. Breakfast was substantial and had Japanese and continental options. Beautiful art all over.Train station and restaurants in basement along with family mart.Shinbashi station and Ginza were around 10 minutes away with even more options.

We got a king corner Tokyo Tower view. Pros: beautiful lobby, great view in room at night (pictures are accurate), large, bed comfy, shower and bathroom good (including excellent amenities). Cons: poorly cleaned and maintained, needs major refurbishing.

Perfectly located for visiting the decent restaurants in the Ginza area and also close to the subway. Breakfast choice was very good and also the bar area was a good size with plenty of views. Only negative was the so-called gym. Very small!

One night stay at the end of our Japan adventure.Big, modern hotel located in a reasonably central spot- two subway stops away from main Tokyo Station.Rooms large enough by Tokyo standards, beds comfortable and bathroom adequate.Reception is on 25th floor so rooms above are high up. If on the correct side and a clear day, you can make out Mt Fuji in the distance.Sadly, we were on the wrong side but still got good skyline views of the city.Can be a little confusing to find it from train/subway station.
user_name:
R1der
Kingston upon Thames, United Kingdom

review_body: Won this amazing trip to Tokyo Japan on the Price Is Right . 6 nights breakfast included!!!! Very nice!!! Stayed at the Park Hotel on the 31st floor. Where u will find the the executive lounge free Danish and juice in the morning and wine and beer in the evening. Just steps away from the train station. The staff was on point everyday of my stay. They work was a time. Way to go staff!! And by the way my room was amazing with the view of the City love the art work on the wall.

We stayed here for 4 days before our cruise. The hotel location makes it very easy to get to from either airport using Airport Limousine bus since they drop you off directly at the hotel. There are many ways but it’s the easiest if you have large suitcases.We choose an artist room 3101 with south facing view with the hopes of seeing Mt Fuji...unfortunately it was cloudy all four days. I also choose an artist room since it gave us the privilege of their special room offering juices, pastry and hot beverages in morning and during evening red & wine. This was a very nice perk since after a long day of playing tourist you could enjoy a glass of wine. We found the hotel staff extremely accommodating and always smiling. I used the laundry facilities once b/c it was so humid and we change clothes frequently. I appreciate the hotel having this facility since many do not and you are stuck with paying hotel laundry prices. The only issue I had was that these two washers are washer & dryer combo. So wash and dry for a small load was $4-5 but they provided detergent. They washed and dried but they didn’t wring out enough liquid so the clothes was still wet. So if you are thinking of using washer plan to pay another 400 yen (30 mins per 100 yen) to dry.We also paid extra ~$25 pp for breakfast. Hubby thought price was steep but I thought it was the going rate for Asian breakfast in Tokyo. Since we were staying on the artist floor we could have had pastries, juices & coffee and tea complimentary but l like larger breakfast to start the day so I choose to pay. I would stay here again for location and convenience to the transportation center above ground walkways as well as below for subways and trains. A great hotel stay.

This hotel's strongest point is its extremely helpful staff. They instructed us about how to navigate the train system, recommended places to eat and also places to visit. The hotel is on the 25th floor and the views are great. We had a corner room and it was reasonably spacious. The air con took a while to kick in and my one gripe would be that there was no bedside cabinet or light on one side of the bed, plus hardly any room to get in or out of the bed. (Hence the 4, not 5 stars). It's clean, has good quality toiletries, white and fluffy (if a tad small) bath towels, bath robes and slippers. The bed was comfortable too. In terms of location - it's near to the overground and underground stations, and within walking of the Ginza shopping district.

We stay in 2 double bed rooms ( 2 big beds) for 2 nights. Room is quite function but very small. We have 3 big luggages so we have to ask hotel staff to take 2 chairs out. By the way, we still have limit area anyway. Bed are comfy. Toilet is small. Onsen is good. Breakfast is 1500 Yen you can choose to Japanese Restaurant which you can choose 1 main dish of out 3 and the rest is buffet (side dish and drink) or Western Restuarant which has some Japansese food as well.No place for hang towel in Bathroom. SInc area is tiny. Location is the best Lawson is under Hotel. Bus to Daziafu is 200 metres and Subway, JR and mall is around the corner.At the lobby, there is free Cha and Lemon tea also.

Location is good close to the subway walking only 3 min you are there. Great views and unique type of Decor. The staff is friendly and with great disposition to help. I found strange that the hotel did not have a bar. Most hotels I have ever stayed in that are in this category have a bar. The breakfast is good buffet style, nothing out of this world just good. It is not as expensive as other hotels of the class in the area.

Position position position Not to be confused with Royal Park HotelHotel lift takes you straight downstairs to access to the train station Small but adequate rooms Great breakfast Very friendly staffEnglish speaking

Traveled here with my S/O and got the Bamboo artist room.The check-in and service was great and everything went smoothly. The room itself was smaller than I anticipated (but probably standard for Japan) and takes a LONG time to get there. The location of the hotel is actually not that great as it's a good 5-10 min walk to a train stop (and normally it's < 5 mins at other hotels) plus the entrance is INSIDE another building so you're going up TWO elevators to get to your room.The room itself was clean but not too big and has all the basics. It's definitely "boutique" though since there's a lounge on our floor that offers free breakfast (opens very late at 8am I think) and free drinks! Great to-go and especially looking for bottled water to-go for the day. I loved the view outside the breakfast lounge. Everyone's english was top notch! Loved how all the staff always asked if we needed help (we didn't but thanks!). The concierge was very knowledgeable though.We stayed here for 3 nights and I thought it was decent; given the price and location. I probably won't be coming back as the walk to the train was a pain but the local streets and food were a good experience. We even walked to the Tsukiji market one morning and that was very beautiful (and we were jetlagged). I would recommend if you're into "boutique" hotels with nice touches; otherwise, probably get somewhere closer to Shibuya or Shinjuku next time.

Hotel is literally joined into a tube stop so super handy for getting around. It is lovely and luxurious and service was excellent. It was our first hotel in our trip around Japan and one of the best hotels. Used the luggage forwarding system and worked well. Tried breakfast one morning there and it was great. Not cheap but worth it for us. We had two rooms for our family and they had out us next to each other as we had requested.
user_name:
Maura W
Milton Keynes, United Kingdom

review_body: I chose this hotel for a quick family holiday mostly due to the strategic location and charming view of Tokyo tower. All guestrooms are located above the 25th floor with breathtaking views of the Minato-ku area and the hotel location is very strategic within 3 minutes walking distance access to the Oeado Line (Shinjuku, Roppongi, Aoyama) and 10/15 minutes from Shimbashi Station (Ginza Line, Yamanote Line, Tokaido Line...).Additonally the Shiodome area offers several family friendly restaurants inside many office building for a budget lunch/dinner.We tried the hotel buffet breakfast once, reasonably priced (for a 5 stars hotel) and very very good quality. The atmosphere in the lounge is also very chill and sophisticated, still our 5 years old was perfectly at ease (and was not charged!).Hotel staff is international and speak several languages. Every Japanese native speaking staff was also very fluent in English and were extremely kind and friendly with our kid.The guestrooms are small, very small...as you expect in a central Tokyo location and would benefit of a little restyling as they contrast with the very sophisticated and artsy vibes of the common areas.Fitness center is very small, personal and has to be booked. I decided to not use it and trained outside at a local park.

If you are looking for a mid range hotel in Tokyo this is a great choice. Stayed for 3 nights and cost approximately £150 per night in a corner king room Tokyo Tower side. It was worth paying the little extra for this room, our children were in a standard room and it felt considerably smaller and view not as good. The BEST thing about this hotel was we arrived on an early morning flight and arrived at hotel at 9am and were able to check in to our room immediately. This is very unusual for Japan, we stayed in another 6 hotels and even though rooms were clearly ready they waited until 3 pm then had a mass of people queuing up at the same time, ridiculous, so to Park Hotel.Location is also excellent with multiple transport connections that will take you anywhere in the city, took 30 minutes to travel with no changes from Haneda Airport. Staff were very polite and helpful, large airy reception foyer and quick lifts. Rooms were not posh, hence the 4 stars instead of 5, but nice, spotlessly clean and functional.

I give a rating of 5 on this hotel, anything less than that would not be representative of our experience (family of 2 adults and a teenager).The hotel is clean (from what I have seen so far in Japan, everything is clean), the location is convenient and safe (Japan feels very safe too), the room are spacious enough for downtown and the view was amazing (all rooms are above 25th floor) and we recieved great service from the staff.Location: Right downtown, connected to 3 subway lines (Ginza, Asakusa, and Oedo lines) that can take you everywhere. The area is safe, with lots of restaurants near by, I suggest to go to the Shiodome where you can find nice restaurants, we had diner Bacio di Guilietta, an Italian Trattoria for a descent price. Hotel is also at a walking distance (about 15 min) from the old fish market (Tsuki-ji) which is a must do when you are in Tokyo.Hotel: Lobby at the 25th floor with a nice view on Tokyo Tower. The hotel has nice restaurants. We had diner at the hotel one night and the food was delicious. The service is really good with people speaking English to help you. The concierge service helped us understand how to move around Tokyo.Room: a little old fashion but other than that, very clean and you will find everything you need. Somewhat spacious for a downtown area, coffee machine, HDTV (if you don't mind watching Japanese channels), air conditioning, a little bar with liquor and soft drinks. I found the bed a little hard as well as the pillows, I am not sure if this ti s a Japanese standard or just the hotel as this was our first hotel in Japan.Breakfast: We had breakfast included with our room. The hotel gives you vouchers that you exchange. The breakfast is served on the 25th floor in the lobby and has everything you can expect and more (local Japanese food). Everything is tasteful and fresh. Price: A little expensive but you are in Tokyo. I still find the price quality to be good value Verdict: We had a great experience and we would return to Park Hotel Tokyo.Advise: Tokyo has a very developed subway network, if you plan to visit the city and have more than 4 tickets in a day, you should buy the 24 hour pass which is 800 Yens. A single ticket is minimum 170 Yens.

Chosen by (in order of importance): price, reviews, looks, location; we now consider it was a good choice. Most reviewers have put clear and detailed explanations on what to expect. Even though we enjoyed our stay, I’m not giving it a five because: a) our standard rooms were a bit small and in need of some refreshing (walls), and b) I would have preferred a more lively location (Shiodome is an office building complex, very quiet during the weekends, and with relatively fewer/harder to find restaurants). Disclosure: Ginza is a 10-15’ walk away and with a wider range of options. Be aware the building across the street from the main entrance is the very similarly named Royal Park Hotel. You can get confused while choosing stop for the Limousine Bus from the airport and, it happened to us, that one tour driver went there to pick us up.

This hotel had a convenient location near train stations, great restaurants nearby, awesome breakfast, spacious room, and everything looked good. However, our room had a dank musty smell (like a sweaty armpit?) and was dusty. Literally dusty, like I could write on the window blinds dusty. It detracted from all the other great things about this hotel for me.

This was our first hotel on our trip to Japan and while the hotel is lovely and was filled with tourists arriving just like us, we felt like it was lacking in amenities that are appreciated when arriving in a foreign country. Most everyone arriving had some type of jet lag and sadly there was no 24 hour room service, no 24 hour coffee/tea service in the lobby and only a small coffee maker in the room. I did not want to wake my spouse and so I sat in the lobby with several other guests, all of us wanting coffee. It wouldn't take much to offer this to guests, especially since it is primarily used by tourists. Otherwise, service was great, hotel was clean and the breakfast was good.

Great hotel that’s centrally located within Tokyo for ease of tourism. Stayed at the Park Hotel for three nights during my Tokyo visit and it was my favorite hotel in Tokyo (I stayed in multiple). Park Hotel is a mix of business and pleasure. While there are a few locals clearly staying for business, there’s also a great number of tourists. When walking through the lobby, one can overhear German, English, Chinese, Korean, etc being spoken by guests. Park Hotel has an impressive multilingual staff as well. During my stay, I met two staff members who were fluent in Japanese/English/French and Japanese/English/Russian. The restaurant in the lobby serves fairly decent food as well! However, what really makes this hotel shine is it’s location. Park Hotel is literally located above Shiodome station and is only a 10 minute walk from Shimbashi station. This was great for getting home after a long day of sightseeing and not having to transfer trains multiple times to get home. Overall a great stay and would definitely rebook for my next visit!
user_name:
AshCEsch
New York City, New York

review_body: I am hoping my review from 12 years ago is visually linked to this one, so everyone can see what a “cool” reviewer I was /sarcasm with a bit of cringe/. Well the good news is the girlfriend in the 2007 review is now my wife, we have more than 40 bucks to drink with, and the Park Hotel is still an amazing place. Hopefully my review this time is a bit more helpful in explaining why you should select this as your hotel.The Hotel itself takes up floors 25-34 of a high-rise structure, with 34 being artist rooms. There is art throughout the hotel and even projected onto a 10 story inside wall of the hotel atrium, it’s really nice. The lobby is great and offers incredible views and has nice bars and restaurants. It’s a nice place to enjoy people watching and relaxing. It is a very welcoming area, but to me the price of food is a bit much. At 9 USD a coffee I had to decline even though I was sitting with family. The Whiskey Bar has an amazing selection and a nice atmosphere to unwind after a long flight or day. It has a really unbelievable selection of craft beers and local whiskey. The food selection was good as well.The corner view king is a great way to go for more space and a nice view. There are four very large windows with a full view of the Tokyo Tower and other buildings. I think some queen Tokyo tower views have even better views due to buildings blocking out the tower base, but corner king is very large. The room has all the essentials, razor, shaving cream, toothbrush, etc. It’s very functional and nice.The location is 5-10-minute walk to Shimbashi and the Tokyo Loop, you can buy 1 day passes there for about 6 USD and enjoy full use of the subway until midnight the same day. Shiodome station and taxis are plentiful on the first floor and basement level. There is also a Family Mart, which has everything you might need and is very similar to a US 7/11 – water, beer, snacks, everything you need for the room at very affordable prices. Also, there are dozens of nice restaurants in the Shidome City Center, a short 5-minute walk with dozens and dozens of bars etc. It’s a bit corporate but is a nice introduction to the area. Hong Hu Giao Zi Fang on the 2nd floor had good food and comfortable seating, friendly place. There is also sky dining a 2 minute walk away in the Caretta Shidome building, five star views and food, but very casual before the dinner rush.The price, cleanliness, stellar service, amazing views, and a great location make it hard to beat. Great well run hotel.

This hotel was very close to the subway which you could enter from underneath the hotel. It is also next to the Sky Tower with many excellent dining options. The staff were very helpful and gave excellent suggestions for dining and transport options to popular tourist attractions. Will definitely make this our first option when returning to Tokyo

Stayed here for three nights for a business trip. Good central location close to Shimbashi Station. Lots of restaurants close by and raised walkway connecting to the station. Breakfast was really good and view over the station was nice. Especially watching the bullet trains on the tracks.

We stayed on the artist floor in the breathtaking Geisha Goldfish room and thoroughly enjoyed our stay. The room is not huge but had an amazing view and had everything we needed. The hotel is in the business center of Tokyo but right next to the subway so we felt it was a great location for us. It’s super close to the Ginza area of Tokyo with all the swanky shopping. The artist floor includes a lounge that has toast, croissants and coffee in the morning and drinks in the afternoon. We took advantage of both and enjoyed the view in the lounge. The staff was super helpful and called various restaurants for us to make dinner reservations. All in all great start in Tokyo on our adventure through Japan.

I think this is better suited to business travellers rather than tourists, based on its location and size. Rooms quite spacious and pleasant view. Good buffet breakfast with both Japanese and Western options.

Nice hotel in shidome area of Tokyo. Service was first class and staff could not do enough for us. Room was on the small side but a great view over the city towards the river. Good breakfast choices. Location is good and as it sits on top of the subway it's easy to find your connections to the excellent Japanese train and subway service.

A wonderful hotel close to the Ginza. Comfortable rooms, friendly staff. Enjoyed Zen room! The choice between Western and Japanese breakfast was appreciated and the art themes made the hotel seem not run of the mill

The room is very decent in size and facilities by Tokyo standard, given the price level. Most outstanding is the staff members. They are extremely helpful and nice. Certainly stay here if I go Tokyo again.

Nice and friendly hotel with a central and practical location. Good breakfast with Japanese and Western selection of fresh products. Rooms have nice views over the city. Efficient check-in/check-out service.

We picked this hotel based on the great reviews I had read and its overall rating. I was not disappointed. The hotel was based in a great location for transport links being easily accessible to Shiodome and Shimbashi stations. Also there were coffee shops and mini marts right on the doorstep. There was not lots to do within the direct vicinity of the hotel, however, this was not a problem as we had a full itinerary of things to do whilst in Tokyo and it did not take long to reach any of these places. We had a triple room and the size of the room was great, very spacious and affording nice views of Tokyo. The room was very clean and had all the amenities we required. Staff were very friendly. We did not have breakfast at the hotel, so cannot comment on this. Would definitely stay at this hotel again if returning to Tokyo.

This hotel was part of our Japan tour and we stayed 3 nights.This hotel is in a business district and so you had to make your way to the real Tokyo by train. That was ok as the station was so close. Many staff are not Japanese so English is spoken very easily, they cater for an international clientele. It is quite a luxury hotel so the dining options can be quite expensive especially the Japanese Kaiseki restaurant. There is also a French restaurant and casual international dining which also can be expensive. We tended to eat in Shiodome city.Breakfast had many options both local and Western.But the room was quite amazing with a huge window and an amazing view of the city skyline. The hotel starts on the 25th floor so you can only be in a high level room! Was a good size and the bathroom had everything you needed.

Conveniently located for business and tourism. Hotel staff were excellent! Very pleasant, helpful, knowledgeable and multilingual. The breakfast is worth the price, excellent multi-cultural assortment. If you are in need of massage therapy and the Spa is booked, the in-room masseuse is excellent and very reasonable price. Will stay again next visit

Ver nice hotel, lobby on 25th floor, rooms 26-34th floor.Great view of the area, regardless of floor. (mine was on the 34th floor)Standard rooms are rather small, but well equipped. Ver nice staff. Excellent breakfast (pricey!). Ver close to major train/subway station. I know where to stay on my next trip to Tokyo.

Stayed in an “Artist Room” with original mural on walls, very nice room, very comfortable. Hotel staff were exceptionally pleasant and helpful. Breakfast was wonderful each morning with both western fare, Japanese cuisine, lots of fruits and good coffee/latte machine.Basement of hotel connects to other buildings and concourse with restaurants and shops, and an international ATM at 7/11 store!Our best view of Mt. Fuji was from lobby one morning!

Spent 4 nights here. Room was well appointed and very clean, but on the small size. very good location for transport and sights. Easy access to Train & subway system. Breakfasts were good, plenty of choice. Lots of opportunities to eat in surrounding buildings. Would recommend.

The best thing about this hotel is the very friendly and helpful staff. The hotel is convenient to two railway stations and we located some great restaurants not far from the hotel. The room was very basic, bland and small for the price we paid. Bathroom was very small with the toilet taking up most of the room. (You could not have 2 people in the room at one time). The dining area was not impressive and some days the food area was crowded. The hot food such as the eggs and bacon were always cold. We did enjoy a delicious meal in the Japanese restaurant. The last meal in the French restaurant was not that impressive after all the other delicious meals we had. The last night at the hotel before we departed was in a room nearly at the end of the corridor, a long distance from the lift. Staying 5 days at this hotel, a larger room would have given us a bit more space.

We really enjoyed this hotel. We stayed 5 nights, and really felt quite comfortable here. The hotel is directly connected to train stations, and there are countless food options in the area. Staff were very helpful, in every case. Food in the breakfast buffet, while not extensive, was quite good. Rooms were a good size for Japan, and very comfortable, with excellent views. And being able to do laundry in a self-serve laundry room was a nice bonus, since we had another full week ahead of us after we left. I'd stay here again, and recommend it to others.

Close to Shiodome and Shimbashi stations - in fact there's an entrance at subway level if you can find it - The Park Hotel (not to be confused with the adjacent Royal Park Hotel) is a very pleasant and relaxed place to stay in Tokyo. Upgrading to "Artist Rooms" is worth it - each uniquely decorated.....but more practically you get access to a lounge with free breakfast and evening drinks - plus the use of a dedicated concierge. Plus, the views from the 31st floor and above, across Tokyo, are spectacular.It's not a budget option - but it's not a budget hotel. Best booking options are directly on their site, we found.Great recommendations from the concierge also.For us, worth the extra splurge after two weeks travelling around Japan - and we'll go back another time, so recommended!

We stayed here for 3 nights at the end of out ten day trip to Japan. It was a lovely way to end our trip. The check in staff were very pleasant and the process was quick and easy. Our room was room 7 on the 32nd floor. The room was small but no smaller than a Premier Inn type room here in the UK. But what was better was the view. We were on the Tokyo Tower side and the views from morning to night were spectacular. Th room itself was clean and had a small fridge and a TV, and a wardrobe and room safe. Everything you'd need really, if you're spending your whole trip here. As we were staying only 3 nights, we didn't make use of any services such as room service and laundry, so cannot comment on those. We also didn't have breakfast in the hotel as we found the price a little steep for our budget, especially at the end of our holiday, but I'm sure it was delicious and to the high standard of the rest of the hotel. If like us, you won't be having the breakfast in the hotel, there are plenty of Lawson/Family Mart/7Elevens in the very close vicinity, as well as plenty of restaurants for all your meals. We found the area over the road under the railway was the best and closest place for cheap food. Ramen Hokuta was a favourite of mine. Overall, I really enjoyed my stay here, as did my boyfriend. A lovely hotel of you want a bit of luxury. The views alone are worth it on my opinion!

A city centre hotel, surrounded by office blocks but convenient for stations. Rooms were comfortable with good views (rooms are from 26th floor upwards) but small. Well equipped and comfortable bathroom. No free water provided - unlike most hotels. There is a very tiny gym - three pieces of equipment! Breakfasts were really good - extensive Japanese and Western options. As everywhere, staff were helful and efficient.

Park Hotel is conveniently by both subway and JR rail stations, though situated in a business district rather than by major tourist sites. Hotel is elegant, comfortable, and staff are very attentive. Only wish they had a proper fitness center!

The hotel is nice, but our rooms needed a refresh. The carpet, paint, etc were pretty worn and we had a bit of a disappointment when we first arrived. The location is good - with the Shiodome underground stations just below - makes travelling anywhere in Tokyo pretty easy. We also liked that the rooms were on high floors with the lobby on the 25th floor - so we didn't have any issues with street noise plus had a great view of the city with Mt. Fuji in the distance. Overall, I would stay again, but hope they perform an update. Note - it's possible other floors may have been updated. The lobby itself looks very nice.

The reception check in was very efficient although the the English person on reception did fail to correct a charge mistake made when booking the reservation. The bedroom was very spacious and extremely comfortable as was also the bathroom, especially the warm toilet seat. The restaurant is an open space just behind reception. The food is okay although expensive, we had an evening meal and breakfast.The concierge dept is excellent, pre arranged tickets for the Bullet train, hair appointment and car transportation all went smoothly...most impressive.Drawback is the location..too far away from the main attractions to walk.

First, the hotel itself is superb! Great rooms, excellent staff, and stunning views. The concierge arranged pickup at Haneda, and even with a six hour delay for our flight, our van was waiting for us - great service! On the other hand, it's a bit out of the way. The line of the Tokyo Metro that serves Shiodome is one of the less useful lines, and the walk to the nearest major connection is either traffic fraught or a journey through an underground maze. The hotel is on top of a major commercial/media area that evacuates at 5PM, so finding a place to eat can be a challenge. Fortunately a monorail will take you to a major shopping mall with a great variety of places to eat. We really liked the hotel, and would have rated it excellent were it just not quite as handy for touring Tokyo as other hotels might be.

To preface this review, we like to stay at non-touristy spots and get lost in our travels. If tour groups and non-immersive culture are your thing, then you will love this hotel.Nothing was necessarily wrong with the hotel although the price point was rather high for the size and comfort of the room. It was more the way the hotel caters to Western tourists. Great location to hit the metro and go sightseeing along with some great dining nearby.Customer service was good, too, but overall, I honestly did not feel like I was in a different country. That's the reason we travel, right?

This lovely hotel that starts on the 25th floor is very close to the Shiodome. It is well situated, within walking distance of the Ginza district. The service is excellent and the rooms are large and well appointed. The hotel had all the amenities that you would expect of a first class establishment, but the breakfast buffet is like no other that I have ever experienced. They had both Japanese and Western dishes in abundance and variety and all were delicious. It was an impressive and beautiful feast every morning. Excellent value for money.

Stayed here three nights. Hotel staff were very helpful and polite. Room was super quiet; it almost seemed like no other guests existed. We heard no noise from other rooms or the hall. Being on the 30th floor, even siren noise was muted. Location is in a business area but lots to do and easy access to Shimbashi and Shiodome subway stations. Breakfast buffet was excellent with varied cuisines represented. We had dinner the first night in their most expensive restaurant and it was $$$$. Food was good but we didn’t want to spend that much but we were tired from the long plane ride and jet lagged. Bed was very comfortable but we like a firm bed. I didn’t use the gym since it required a reservation since it was very small. We enjoyed our stay very much.

This is a modern, stylish and quiet hotel in Tokyo, high in the sky as the lobby entrance is on the 25th floor. Like many hotels in Japan the rooms are not large but they’re comfortable, functional with spectacular views across parts of the city. The bathrooms are well equipped; bath and wet room etc. and the usual all singing all dancing Japanese toilet with seat warming, bidet and female shower facility. In the bathroom there were toothbrushes, razors, shower caps, hairbrush alongside the usual shower gel etc. This is classified as an art hotel so there was plenty of ‘art’ decoration around which was very pleasing. The restaurant was well laid out, offering a choice of menus and there was good range of breakfast options for both European and Asian palettes. The staff were all very helpful with the lobby and restaurant staff speaking good English (something we certainly needed!). The hotel was over one of the main underground walkways and only a short distance from a Japan Railway underground station so it was easy from the hotel to get around the city. I’d stay there again.

My wife and I stayed here for 2 weeks in May 2019. The hotel location was excellent, with easy access to transit (Shimbashi station is a short walk, and the yurikamome station is right outside). Would highly recommend getting a Tokyo tower view - you will not be disappointed, and on a clear day Mt Fuji is visible.The staff are very helpful and friendly. The buffet breakfast was also excellent, with plenty of western and Japanese options to choose from.The room was a great size by Japanese standards (but a little smaller than most western hotels). The room could also do with a bit of a refresh (starting to show some signs of wear and tear).Being in a business district, the area is nice and quiet, particularly on the weekends, so it can be a nice way to escape the busyness of other parts of Tokyo.Vending machines on each level were convenient, as was the coin laundry on the 26th floor (although this was also quite busy). Would not hesitate to stay here again, and very much look forward to booking our next stay.

Location is SLIGHTLY odd, and a bit hard to get to and from the hotel occasionally BUT when you are there staff are lovely, room is comfortable. We had amazing views over Mt Fuji from our room. Clean, comfortable, would stay again and recommend.

A brilliant hotel that served as a great point to access other areas and sites around the city. The staff here were very professional and welcoming, offering lots of respect to guests. The breakfast was extremely varied with both Japanese and Western options. Both of which were tasty and plentiful. The hotel has the most incredible atrium. A wonderful stay and highly recommended for business and leisure guests alike.

Good location if you don’t mind the maze of Shimbashi station. Smallest room we experienced in our 14 nights in Japan. Breakfast was a good buffet to satisfy all tastes. 32nd floor views were good. I asked for a hotel with a gym but the gym here was a joke. The space allocated was 19 square metres ( like 3/4 of a bedroom)and it had thee pieces of equipment only - 2 aerobic and one resistance. It was so small you had to book! Otherwise hotel was pleasant enough

We really loved the Park Hotel. It’s conveniently located in a ‘quieter’ part of Tokyo close to public transport. Staff is knowledgable and very friendly. Rooms are pretty and with nice views. The breakfast buffet had a good and varied selection. All you need from an hotel in a major city.

This hotel is an excellent hotel, located very close to two metro stations and not far from major Tokyo attractions, The staff is very warm and friendly with any aspect of your trip. My wife and I stayed for a week and thoroughly enjoyed ourselves.My only negative reaction is that, while the breakfasts are sumptuous, they are certainly not worth 2,800 Yen per person per day. They offer a continental breakfast of some pastries and coffee for gratis at each floor, but there are no fruits there. My suggestion would be to lower the price of the breakfasts or at least add some basic fruits to the gratis breakfasts.

Nice, clean and friendly staff, always keen to help.Room a bit small.Lot of restaurant in the walking distance, also rail station.Reception at 25th floor, bit problematic for fist timer,No bell boy or concierge at the ground floor to direct you.Overall we had a pleasant stay.

Good location. Walking distance to Ginza. You can get to two of the subway stations without having to go outside in the elements. Great views from the room as all the rooms are above the 25th floor. The breakfast was very good. The staff was excellent

Solid upscale hotel with a great view over Tokyo behind the check-in counter. Stake very helpful, good business center. Breakfast is fine, though not spectacular. The seating area in the lobby has a chill vibe though, nice to sit and relax with a coffee.

Stayed 4 nights.Staff were helpful and attentive Room was on the small side but OKWe arrived at 9:00pm and there was no one at the building entrance, Reception is on the 25th floor. Our travel had not advised us.The check in was quick and goodWe had dinner in the Japanese restaurant and it was very good.

The hotel is located away from the hustle and bustle but in a very convenient location. It is right next to Shimbashi (Ginza & Asakuza line) and Shiodome (Oedo line). The check-in process was very quick, everyone was extra polite and they even checked us in several hours earlier w/o prior notice. The room was small but this is typical for Japan and no big surprise. What was truly unpleasant was the dirty carpet covered in old stains - yes they give you slippers to wear but that hardly makes up for it. The bathroom and all the furniture was also not renovated and showing their age and heavy use. The towels were so old that they had thinned out and were very rough. And lastly, the blankets were heavily stained. We went to speak with management about getting another room. Everyone was very polite and they tried to do everything possible to come up with a solution. Unfortunately (or fortunately for us) they were all booked up and couldn’t offer us a change of rooms so they gave us a free upgrade to a much nicer room. They helped us move as quickly as possible and apologized profusely. I still can’t give them 5stars, however, as even this much nicer room has issues such as old stains from glass rings (which are easily scraped) and same old furnishings. At the end though we were happy with the stay and will be going home with a positive memory.
user_name:
BMilano
New York City, New York

review_body: Great hotel, if you are lucky you can see mount Fuji from the reception area, or maybe even your room. We were impressed with the size of the room as we heard that hotel rooms in Japan are very small but we thought our room was reasonable size and had a lovely view over a park area. Handy for the trains and the monorail.

We stayed here after a mammoth journey from London with a five hour layover in Paris. Our room on the 33rd floor was perfectly adequate, but not luxurious. The decently large bed was comfy and we both slept well after the long journey.The ‘European’ style restaurant has very limited dinner choice and so not a great variety of food on offer. The house wine is pleasant but expensive especially when it comes in rather small quantities and you have to order a second one! Service was prompt and pleasant.The buffet breakfasts are heroic in both quantity and variety but the dining area is quite small so at peak times when the hôtel is full (as it was) people often have to queue for a table. Not good when you need to check out, send your luggage on ahead and catch a train! Ditto at the coffee machine where five or six people waiting in line often with two cups each was not unusual. (Also a coffee machine in what purports to be a top of the range hotel is frankly a bit naff.)If sending your luggage on ahead you would be well advised to do this the night before you leave. In the mornings there is a queue of (in our case) four people ahead waiting to do it and filling out the forms takes quite a bit of time for each one.Final thing, this is an obviously tourist hotel with mostly holidaymakers staying. This is fine as long as you don’t expect an authentic Japanese experience!

Such a great hotel, would go back there in a heart beat! Fantastic service, beautiful art, great breakfast, amazing views and terrific location. I had two artists Room experiences there and both were tastefully done, some other rooms my group had were hilarious and so much fun. A big thank you for organising the performance by artist Akiba for us too, such a treat!!!

this hotel is just oozing with Japanese customs and practices. the moment you check in until you leave, they will treat you as if you are the only guest in the room. they are so polite even with their limited English. the room is very clean. I tried their massages and wow, I was so relaxed and forgot the tiredness from walking and stress from figuring out the train system....just a haven to be in.

Great hotel to stay in .... near train station for extra tours and close by shopping in Ginza and nice restaurants. Staff are impressive in that they are all unfailingly helpful and courteous..... Probably the best hotel staff I have ever encountered

Stayed twice with them in April; couldn't have asked for more. Beautiful public spaces and rooms, friendly courteous helpful staff, delicious breakfasts. Good location. Would recommend to anyone visiting Tokyo.

This hotel is great for city transportation. The hotel itself is quirky situated above the media building it has an artistic focus with lounge, restaurant and corridor walls displaying a variety of art work. The rooms were compact but this is not unusual for a city centre. The great thing about it was the picture window over looking the Tokyo Tower and for a short time when the clouds cleared Mount Fuji.Unfortunately this was not the ideal stay we would have expected. On booking in the receptionist was brusquely move aside by another lady who did not welcome us but became fixated by the fact that we would be booking out early and what did we want to do about our pre-booked breakfast as the restaurant would not be open at that early. Breakfast became the issue of the stay. On our first morning we arrived for breakfast to find a couple of slices of cold meat the plate was not replenished. The hot food was tepid so not really enjoyable. When I went to get hot water for tea the jug was almost empty so I asked for more .
