( you should book a room with a view of the Tower, the other sides of the building are not that great, as you will be pretty close to other towers).We asked a room at the highest floor possible, we receive it: 34th floor and it was a treat seeing Tokyo by night and day.(+ good; +/- in between ; - bad)+ : excellent room, with everything one may need, although a little bit disappointing in comparison with other 4 star hotels I've been in Japan. But if you look at the price and location, it's still good value + : location, location, location. the hotel it's located very close to some of the major metro/train lines in Tokyo, you will get anywhere very quickly. Also, pretty close to the fish market or Ginza. If you want to eat, I recommend going to the neighborhood next to Shimbashi station, you'll have a hard time deciding where to eat, the choice is overwhelming. + : the usual Japanese check-in, quick, professional, they take the bags into the room, etc+ : the staff is very helpful, they will help you with everything you need. also, very good English spoken by most of the staff.+/- : the breakfast is OK but largely overpriced for what it is at ~2800 yen/person. But hey, 4 star hotel = 4 star prices- : nothing!

My son and I stayed at the Park Hotel August 24-28. We were extremely satisfied with our stay. The staff is helpful and friendly. Rooms are tastefully decorated and very comfortable. Location can't be beat. It is an interesting, boutique feeling hotel with artwork installations that add a lot to the visual interest. Way better than a big chain hotel. Highly recommend this place. Good value for Tokyo.

We checked in and were very satisfied from the start. The staff was exceptionally helpful and spoke good English (reception, portier). The room is spacious, well-furnished and has the most amazing view we had in along time (29th floor, far over the city on Tokio Tower). The restaurant on the 25th floor (ty) serves a very good, high-cuisine menu which is reasonably priced.Further, the hotel is well-located close to Shimbashi and Shiodome stations to quickly reach each point in the city. Recommendation: Clearly book a stay!

Our family of four stayed here for several days. We loved the modern design with artistic style, exhibits, special rooms. Service was impeccable. Very close to transit, great views from the rooms. We will be back.

It was my first time in japan, unfortunately i did not see cherry blossoms however the view from my room makes all sense. I love the city view. Love the japanese food. The staff were very accommodating. The check in and check out were ver fast.

This was our first stop on our Japan trip and I very much complimented myself on my choice! We had a room with a Tower view and as it turned out it was one of the bigger rooms we would come across in Japan - 2 double beds like a North America hotel. It is convenient for arriving by train being 10 minute walk from Shimbashi station and Shiodome station was even closer via basement lift and underground walkway. It was also extremely convenient for the Tsujiki Fish Market but take my advice and check Japan Bank Holidays before going there, turns out August 11th was Mountain Day!There was a tiny gym that you had to book a 45 minute slot for - was expecting something a little better given the size of the hotel.The lobby is very lovely and makes you feel you are in a quality establishment. The checking in process was easy and the staff very helpful. The coin laundry is a great addition. If I travel to Tokyo again I am pretty sure I will stay here - unless I become super rich and can afford one with a proper gym and a pool!

Despite needing to go up from the street to reception, first impressions were ok. Quickly went downhill. Room, although big (it was an Emperor King) was clean but basic. Fitness was a joke and the bar closes at 23.00, so don't be late. Then the concierge could not help with an exec car because the journey was not to or from the hotel. Breakfast was poor. Nearer to 1 than 3.

Really liked this hotel, the rooms were spacious (by Tokyo standards), the staff was super helpful. The coin operated laundry was a nice surprise as you can save some money there. The lobby bar drinks were over priced however when compared to some the better Ginza drinking establishments. The one thing that did let this property down is the location, a little bit of a walk from anywhere you want to go, plus the minor inconvenience that the lobby is on the 25th floor.

We booked this hotel to make sure we got a great view to end our trip. The view of Tokyo tower is amazing but found the location to be a bit too quiet. We'd stayed in Shibuya and Shinjuku before and both these areas are much more exciting if that's what you want. The Shiodome station is below the hotel and you can get a train easily over to Odaiba (this was very busy). This line is not covered by a JR pass though and you need to walk to Shimbashi station to use the Yamamote line. This isn't far and is still convenient.The hotel does have an art theme and there's interesting work around. The room itself was a bit tired; the bathroom was basic and not like others we had during our trip. Complementary bottled water was not provided and we'd got used to that in other hotels we paid much less for. Coffee was not always replenished in rooms either. We were a bit disappointed as we'd paid much more to stay here than he had in our other hotels and we didn't get the 'wow' factor other than the view. We thought breakfast was pricey so we opted to use the Family Mart in the basement of the hotel. The NewsArt Cafe was closed the whole time we were there. The hotel is within media buildings and we saw lots of filming going on. The Studio Ghibli clock was also good to see. Overall it was an ok sort of stay. You won't see crazy Japan here and this might be what you're looking for.

I was there this August for my Honeymoon.It's a good recommendation if you go to Tokyo. The hotel is located between 2 stations:Shiodome (JR Yamanote) and Shimbashi (Metro). In both stations, you can also take the Yurikamone line to Odaiba Island.I liked the location because is very well communicated (only 2 stops from Tokyo station if yo come by train, and 1 stop away from the Monorail to Haneda Airport).Additionally, it's quiet because it's in the heart of the financial district, but only a 10-15 minute walk to Ginza, a very popular neighbourhood.The rooms are quute big compared to Japanese standards.The only thing I would improve is breakfast. It's quite expensive (2.800Y/person/day) and it hasn't a "wow effect". It's first quality food, but the variety is scarce.Conveniently, you have some cafeterias and supermarkets nearby, so it's easy to have a breakfast. But I was surprised by the price. We tried it the last day just to see, thinking that it should be amazing since the price, and we were quite dissapointed. Hence, I would not recommend to by breakfast.The rest of the hotel, facilities and staff are perfect.

I picked this hotel for the fact it was near a subway and close to some of the places I wanted to see. But I was skeptical of it because of the price. Boy was I happy to the proven wrong. THIS HOTEL IS AMAZING!! The staff were super helpful and friendly they helped me find directions on how to get to some of the places I wanted to go. They also have a small convenience store below the hotel. If I go back to Tokyo I'm going to try to book here again!

Nice hotel with great views and centrally located. The lobby is on the 25th floor. They have some great art all over the hotel . It is sooo clean. Great Bakery on the first floor. Very close to the fish market.

We were a little disappointed initially with this hotel. The room was small and a little smelly, and the shower was just over the bath with a curtain. But we do appreciate that space is at a premium in Tokyo and the location is excellent - you can walk all the way to Shimbashi underground via the extensive network of subway tunnels (complete with plenty of shops). The breakfast too was great - good choice of buffet items - and all staff at the main and concierge desks were friendly and helpful.
user_name:
Lindsay K
Bury St. Edmunds, United Kingdom

review_body: Although the room was small, it was functional, with a fridge and bath. Breakfast was simple but good, and the bed was very comfortable. Located more than 30 stories above street level, hardly any noise is heard from the train tracks located not far from the hotel. Service was excellent.

Currently staying here with my husband on our honeymoon, in the Mt Fuji art room. Incredible room, beautiful art and the service is amazing! Cannot recommend highly enough, has got to be the best in Tokyo!!

The Park hotel (not to confused with the Royal Park Hotel next door) is a typical Tokyo hotel whose foyer is on the 25th floor. The foyer and restaurants are all on the same level with the rooms rising above, all rooms being outward facing with a view of the city skyline and the middle of the building hollowed out giving the restaurants a vast atrium style. Our room however was tired but perfectly comfortable. We opted for a corner room to get more space (as Tokyo rooms can be tiny) and we had plenty of room to unpack and still have space to wander. Breakfasts are varied and good, both Western and Japanese. Dinner one night was expensive but not fantastic. There are several little restaurants in the basement levels heading to Shimbashi Station and Ginza is walking distance. The immediate area however is new buildings and not much atmosphere until you get to Ginza and the laneways around the station. There is one floor of the hotel which features rooms painted by local artists. They were just finished and open for inspection while we were there. Some are lovely, some are totally weird! If you want the hustle and bustle of Shinjuku or Shibuya this is not the location for you. Having said that Shiodome station is on the main Keisei line straight from Narita and Shimbashi is on the JR line to all the major sights so easy to navigate and a bit quieter than some of the bigger stations. It is close to the fish markets (walking distance) and the lovely Hamarikyu Gardens. Train takes you straight to Shinjuku, Harajuku, Shibuya, Asakusa and Ueno without changing. A good hotel but a little tired in its decor and fitout.

Good location with a very nice staff where communication was not a problem and they were always ready to answer our questions. We experienced very fast Wifi while there as well. Had a great view of Tokyo Tower as the hotel begins on the 25th floor and had direct access to the Shiodome train station.

We spent 3 days here at the beginning of a 10 day Japan visit. The hotel is very well located. One is really very close to three different stations giving you access to the public transport system. The hotel is located from the 25th to the 34th floor of the building, thus affording you lovely views of Tokyo. Ask for a room facing the Tokyo tower when booking. There are 3 restaurants and a hidden bar on the 25th floor. The rooms are clean and well appointed, a bit on the small side. The staff are super helpful, friendly and efficient

We stayed here for part of our stay in Tokyo. The Artists rooms are unique. Large for Asian standards and has a real King size bed. The service is excellent and the lounge for people staying in the Artists room has a light breakfast and afternoon cocktails. The location is excellent for access to the subway and to the Tsujiki fish market. It is a bit far to Shibuya and Shinjuku. Would recommend staying here if you want to stay in this area.

Premium room on 34th floor was surprisingly spacious for Tokyo; second room for kids easily fitted 3rd bed for our stay. Staff really friendly and helpful. Art cafe a really good fall back if the press of people during the day means you want to eat in house; the breakfast is also good and really sets you up. Location takes a bit of learning as the really useful Shimbashi subway station is something of a walk. However we were here in August so that may be a little unfair as in lower temperatures the 2nd floor level walkways are probably readily navigated and less off putting than the subterranean passages that offer an air conditioned alternative in high summer - anyhow, would certainly recommen

Thank you to all the team at the Park. I completely enjoyed my stay over a long week of travelling. Simple, easy and well mannered. Room was clean and comfortable with great bathroom. Plenty on foreign channels on TV.

If you're looking for a hotel in Japan but don't want to pay an arm and a leg, you'd be hard pressed to find a better hotel than Park Hotel. Conveniently located near the fish market (although I heard it was moving in November so soon that will be irrelevant), and multiple subway stations that can be reached through the underground paths.

Really like the quality and location of this hotel. Located in Shiodome, the oedo line is in the basement but also very close to shimbashi (metro and JR), asakusa line and yurikamome stations. Very artistic with new artists featured each month. Views are great! Check out the cool moving clock next door.

In a nutshell, it was great The hotel is located above a business centre, with the lobby at the 25th floor and rooms from the 26th to the 34th, which gives you a sense of the view you can get from there, whatever the weather conditions and the hour of the day. Our hosts were very professional & welcoming, and gave us all the requested information to start crawling the streets of Tokyo. The hotel is closed to very central metro lines which will drive you easily to all destinations in the city. Ginza is even at walking distance (10 minutes). It's true that rooms are small but ours were well furnished and well designed with all the required equipment, and to be honest, if you're in Tokyo to stay in your room, I guess you're in the wrong place!!Even though we could listen to the sounds of the city below, rooms were very quiet, and we heard no noise coming from the corridor or from the other rooms. Breakfast was great with a large buffet made of various meals from Europe and Japan; furthermore, the place around Shimbashi station (5 minutes walk) is full of restaurants and there is coffee restaurant in almost all the buildings around the hotel. So, very good choice for us, and nothing to add

Located in the new Shiodome Development this Hotel is conveniently located. Steps away from both the Shimbashi Metro Station (Ginza Line and JR Yamanote Line) and Shiodome Metro Station. Walking distance from Ginza. You can walk anywhere in Ginza or take the Metro from Shimbashi. Is only one station).The Hotel is located on the top floors of a new tower with wonderful views of the city. The size of the rooms might be considered small for Western standards but very reasonable for Japanese standards. Good size bathroom. Breakfast buffet has plenty of options for both western and asian style food. I would definetely stay in this Hotel again. I had a very confortable stay. My kids loved it.

We chose the hotel because it was very conveniently located, with great access to the subway as well as cabs if needed. It is also walking distance from the Hamarikyu gardens.The hotel is very modern, with a lounge-ish sort of feel to it, particularly on Friday nights when they have a DJ playing just above the lobby restaurant. Comfortable, well appointed rooms.What really impressed us was the level of service by the staff at the reception desk and the restaurant nearby. We were traveling with a couple of vegetarians, and we were really touched by the concern and help extended by Ieva from the Park Hotel. She proactively helped out on multiple occasions, making us feel very welcome and very much at home. So much so that when we returned to Tokyo after 3 nights away, coming back to the Park hotel felt like returning home. Would definitely stay here again.

It has a good communication with 3 subway lines with underground passageway that makes easier to move around and a walkable distance from GinzaStaff is incredible nice. Rooms are just enough but comfy, I would come back

If you don't want to be in the thick of the crowds but be close enough to access it, then this hotel is a good one.The rooms are typical, they are not big but plenty of space and very nice.The customer service was excellent.Value for money suited us so we'll stay here again as very happy customers.

We stayed he for 5 nights, if you have the chance, please book for an artist room. The lobby its on a 25th floor snd its connected to shimbashi station and some other metro lines as the ginza one. Staff its very helpful, and they guve u very good advive when need it. They offer a good breakfast with very bad coffee though. Worth very penny

This hotel starts on the 25th floor of a very tall building. The views all around were amazing. Our room was clean, quiet, and felt safe but very very small. We got two rooms for a family of five, one room at two twin beds in the other room had three twin beds. The lobby area was fine to hang out. The location was also very central very convenient and just above the subway lines. We couldn't ask for a better location. I wish the rooms are bigger.

I went with myself, husband, young child, and elderly parents. The location is great as far as being accessible to trains but restaurants and attractions were not close by. Hotel appears more geared toward business travel rather than families. Staff was polite and helpful. Views were amazing.

That hotel has been a personal recomendation of a specialist and we did not regret. Of course, the rooms are not really big (it is Tokyo) but the service is perfect, the hotel has got plenty of ambience, the breakfast buffet is with fantasie and everything fresh and cooked with passion. The restaurant is fine, good food and fine wines. The ambiente is perfect, full of art and spirit. The location is absolutely downtown (you could not get closer) and the view around Tokyo over the roofs is stunning. Expecially in the night. I can recommend that hotel to everybody

What a great hotel in a great location and the subway is basically just downstairs. The staff were very helpful and the view was just spectacular especially at night. Everything is close by would definitely recommend this hotel. The hotel's reception is on the 25th floor very unusual.

Stayed 4 nights here with my family at the start of a tour of Honshu. It was a really great experience. The hotel is on the upper floors (25-~34) of a new tower in the Shiodome/Shimbashi area. Views from all rooms are fantastic as can be imagined.We'd arrived very early for our check in and rooms were not ready but we were made very welcome and we were able to find a couple of things to do locally until lunchtime when our rooms were free. Rooms themselves are quite small by European standards but nicely decorated and very clean. In common with other places we visited there is not a lot of closet hanging space or drawers. Perhaps , Japanese torists prefer to live out of suitcases on holiday? The staff were really excellent. Pleasant, well informed and polite of course but also not too formal. It made for a very relaxing stay. The breakfast buffet was the best of all of our Japanese hotels. The concierge was also very good, organising a private tour by metro for us on the first day (something I'd recommend as a good way to gain some orientation on the metro) and advice throughout. The hotel is also connected via an underground labyrinth to 2 subway stations (Shiodome, Shimbashi) so it's easy to get pretty much anywhere direct from the hotel. Haneda airport is also just a 20 minute taxi journey away.Highly recommended.

Beware, this is a different hotel from The Royal Park nearby. Its logo of three skinny coloured flags helps you find the right one. It is a four star establishment, an easy walk from Shinbashi Station, in the south-east area of the city. A difficulty for tourists in much of central Tokyo, including this site, is that they use multiple levels for walkways, shops, restaurants, etc, and what you need might be three floors up or down six flights of escalators. The Park Hotel is no exception, and it was three days before we were reasonably confident of finding one of the front doors after an outing.The actual Reception and dining room are on the 25th floor and the guest bedrooms above that. We had no idea what went on in floors 1 - 24 or the various levels of basement. However, the place is clean (after all, this is Japan) and bright, with bedrooms and bathrooms of a pretty good size for this country. The bed was comfortable, and everything worked well in the rooms. However, as first time visitors to Japan we were taken by surprise by the heated loo seats and hygienic washing mechanism. Supplies of toiletries, hot drink ingredients (including good filter coffee), and useful items like toothbrushes razors and hairbrushes, slippers and kimonos were excellent, although they had no soap, only washing gel.The staff were all efficient and very friendly, but we found the constant Japanese bowing a bit disconcerting until we got used to it. We didn’t eat at the hotel as meals were too expensive, but bought supplies from the nearby shops and take-aways.

This is well located within walking distance of the fish market , main park, two train stations and tube and excellent shopping and restaurants.All rooms are great for views as 25 + floors and above. Check in not until 2pm but they will store baggage.Breakfast serves mixture of western and Japanese, pretty average and too small a dining room so you may have toe wait 10 mis or so.

My partner and I stayed here for one night for the end of a long trip through Japan and it was very comfortable. A bit confusing to get there from the JR line but doable. Once there the staff were very nice (nothing that blew me away... but maybe I'm just getting used to Japanese hospitality - everyone is lovely!) We got a corner view room and I adored the view! The water wasnt free in the room though (which every other hotel we stayed at in Japan had supplied no charge) and I can't say much about any of the other services as we only stayed one night- but the beds were comfy and the aircon worked a treat so would definitely stay there again- perhaps longer next time!

High standard rooms and service with stunning views across Tokyo. Extremely clean, modern and catered to all of our needs. Breakfast was nice and staff were more than accommodating. Only thing I would say is that it could have better signage for the hotel, as it can be a bit of a maze trying to get into the place at night what with it being on top of the underground and having other businesses mixed in with it. Aside from this, fantastic hotel and enjoyed our stay there.

We stayed at the Park Hotel for a long weekend visit in Tokyo. Hotel is really well located (albeit a bit confusing to find from Shimbashi Station with all the pedestrian overpasses). Connected to Oedo Line making for easy commuting anywhere in central Tokyo. Nice rooms and lovely lobby area.I want to make special note that the Park Hotel has the best mixologist at the Lobby Bar, Koji Nammoku, who made the best mixed drinks, classics to inventive. It's hard to get a well poured old fashioned and harder yet to get the right caipirinha, and Koji nailed it every time. Even if you are not staying at the hotel, stop by the bar for an awesome cocktail and great view of Tokyo, 25 floors up.

Having purchased Japan Rail passes we wanted a hotel close to a JR station to make full use of them while in the city. The hotel is close to Shimbashi station (5 minutes walk on a series of walkways), has an amazing view of Tokyo tower (it's hard to concentrate on the formalities of checking in with the stunning floor to ceiling view behind the front desk) & superb, attentive staff. The hotel has floors 1 & 25 - 35 of the building & offers views across Tokyo from our rooms. With a lounge/restaurant (for breakfast buffet) plus an excellent Japanese restaurant (try the chef's recommended set menu) & a French restaurant you don't really need to leave. Ginza is just a 10 minute walk away with yet more great restaurants & lots of top end shopping. Don't forget Shimbashi which has a number of karaoke bars for a fun night out. This modern hotel makes an excellent base for a trip to Tokyo, has wonderful service & helpful staff.

I stayed with my 4-year-old daughter. Every staff is so friendly with smiles. The room is not big but quite cozy, very clean. Located near Shiodome station (Yurikamome line) and Shinbashi station(Yamanote line...etc). There is a convenience store down stairs.The restaurants in the hotel look very nice. I'd live to try next time.

Nice hotel, for the price, Near Shimbashi station.Pro's- great bathroom, laundry on your own or done by hotel. Friendly, helpful staff. The French restaurant had amazing service and good food for not a crazy price ($100 for two people). The breakfast buffet had plenty to offer. Con's- and this is a big one for me- don't pick this place for its "gym". There's one cable/weight machine that isn't set up properly, and almost useless as a result. There are two cardio machines, which is silly as Tokyo requires so much walking, I'd think no one would want to hop on a bike or elliptical. My two cents- ditch the elliptical, maybe keep the bike if you must, and put some free weights in instead. Also- get that cable machine checked out. It's a death trap.

This is a nice hotel. It is a great location near two train stations covering several lines.Including direct service to Harajuku, Shinjuku and Shibuya. A few minutes walk from the main shopping district in Ginza.The hotel itself is clean; the rooms are adequate size and they come with bathrobes, slippers, toothbrushes, razors, washcloths and other toiletries for your use. Also a hairdryer. Apparently, in hotels in Japan, it is okay to keep the bathrobe and slippers. Every time we used something, it was replaced the next morning. For example, I used a robe, hung it up and the next morning, it had been replaced with a new one. Although you can leave a card to ask that your robe not be replaced and be a bit more environmentally friendly. We had a new supply of toothbrushes every day. Rooms have a mini bar. The hotel starts on the 25th floor and from my room on the 33rd floor, we had a great view of Ginza, the Tokyo Sky Tower and the bullet train going by.The hotel restaurant is good. Breakfast is very good with lots of variety although a bit pricey at 2,800 yen per person. We decided that for convenience and the quality of the food, it was worth the price.It is non-smoking and has free WiFi in both the lobby and the rooms. We used both all the time with no problemsI would stay at this hotel again.

Returned to the Park hotel for the 3rd time last year for a family holiday and we booked adjacent corner rooms - a double and a triple. Hadn't got around to reviewing until now. This really is a fabulous hotel. Great service, amazing views, modern, spotlessly clean and so easy to travel anywhere in Tokyo from the metro station in the basement or the JR station 5 min walk away. if I return for a 4th time I'll definitely stay again.

Stayed for a week, this was our second time staying here and again it did not disappoint. Rooms have a slight feel of a cruise ship cabin, but we really like it, views are great, can see Tokyo Tower and one morning was able to see Mt Fuji in the distance. Buffet breakfast was not as good as last time we were here but it was decent, great value for money, metro is right outside for the Yurikamome line and basement for the Uedo and Ginza line. Can get from metro to your room without stepping outside and getting wet if raining. WiFi worked fine. Plenty of restaurants around, from Taco Bell, to high end Japanese. The bar at hotel has an outstanding whisky collection, and the Japanese restaurant was very good with beautiful views of Ginza which is a short walk away.

We arrived late into the night in Tokyo, with only a short metro ride to the station and a very small walk down a road to the Hotel, we were met with open arms! The staff are so friendly and the view is amazing if you face towards Tokyo Tower. Breakfast's were great and the hotel really showed off Tokyo in style, its about a 5 min walk to the station - or if you need the metro its actually connected to the hotel via the 3rd floor! I really would recommend this hotel to anyone

My husband and I stayed here for 6 nights in July. Months before coming, we emailed them multiple times asking them to make reservations for us at various restaurants and they were very helpful!! The service here is great. They are genuinely friendly and want to help you. They helped facilitate a delivery from Kyoto for us. We checked out and left our bags there because we were going to Mt. Fuji for one night and when we came back, they remembered us right away. The rooms are perfect. Not too big and not too small. It has everything you need and you have great views of the city. Great location. It is next to the Shiodome metro station. When I say next, I mean the hotel elevator takes you to the subway and you can get in and out within minutes. This was important because if you stayed in Shinjuku or Shibiya, the stations there are huge and takes a while to get back to your hotel. Overall a great stay! We would definitely come back.

The reception desk is mid-way up this skyscraper with the hotel above. Hence, the views are fabulous. Very convenient to Tokyo's monorail, rail lines and subways - although it was not easy to work out which one we needed. A relatively short walk to the Ginza area for great shopping and restaurants. Our room was on the artists' floor where each room is decorated by an artist. We preferred our bamboo decor to some others on offer, which were a little more colourful. Excellent breakfast and helpful staff.

I actually stayed here back in 2015 on my Honeymoon.This hotel is fantastic, great staff, great quality and fantastic views.The room was very comfortable with views of Tokyo tower and Mt Fuji in the distance.There were some art exhibitions on at the hotel which was a nice edition and got to met one of the artists while there. Nice to sit in the lounge bar and look at all the work.This hotel is so good that we are visiting again in April 2018, can't wait :)

Nicely appointed rooms and a good size.The staff speak English.Breakfast buffet is about 2500 yen and the food is good quality.Aircon in my room could of been a bit cooler.Reasonably priced good hotel

The hotel is just excellent - it's about all I need and expect from a hotel. The location is mega-convinient: right near the monorail line to Odaiba, and three subway stations and and Shimbashi JR station are just steps away. You can get literally anywhere in Tokyo and around from here. There's a lovely old garden right beside the hotel. The hotel lobby is on the 25th floor of the Tokyo News Media tower, and the rooms are on 30-34 floors. The views from there are stunning, and you can see Mt. Fuji in clear days even in summer! Get the Tower View room and you wouln't regret it! The breakfast is servet in the Art Lounge and is very very good. It's an art hotel, and they always have some exhibitions ongiong right within the hotel. Aslo, some rooms are all painted by local artists. I stayed in a Corner room with Tower view and my family and I were very happy with our choice. You can also buy tickets to Limousine Bus to the airports from the hotel's concierge with no extra charge - very convinient. There's a convenience store on B2 floor and some shops and cafes nearby. And finally, there's the famous Miyazaki clock on the neighbour building. The clock performs a music and light show at certain hours. I cannot find any faults with this hotel and would stay there again once back to Tokyo.

My mom and I stayed here for 4 nights and we absolutely loved the place!! We stayed on the floor with art in the rooms and it was wonderful. We opted for the smallest room because it was cheaper and at first we were a little offset by how small it was so if you are looking for something large, get a bigger room, but once we adjusted to it, it was perfect! We don't spend much time in the room so it didn't bother us at all. Everything was top notch! The bathroom was nice, the room was clean, the whole floor with painted rooms was an art exhibit itself so it was lovely to walk around, the floor we were on had a complimentary small breakfast with tea, coffee, juice, and some breads, and at night they had complimentary alcohol, and best of all was the staff there. Everyone was so nice and helpful, it was such a nice stay!! Also the convenient location to the train station was a major plus as well. You don't get the feel of being by a train station but if you go all the way to the basement you have immediate access to all of the train terminals that you could possibly need.

We spent 6 nights here and loved the hotel. Comfortable rooms extremely friendly and helpful people. Did not have breakfast here as we tend to eat little ans so cost is qiute expensive. Lots of restaurants nearby and close to Shimbashi station.

Tokyo is so busy and chaotic it is wonderful to come back to this peaceful hotel. It is also very convenient to the trains so we have taken several day trips to other cities without even going outside!The room does come with many toiletries and even robes and slippers. This is a great hotel.

A very short walk from Shimbasi JR station, and right above Shiodome subway station, this is a perfectly located hotel. In a nice and futuristic zone of tall buildings and many levels, it is just a matter of paying attention to which sky walk you must follow to access it quickly. From Narita we took a shuttle that left us at the building door - the lobby is on the 25th floor. The view is spectacular - from the Tokyo Tower to Mt Fuji and a broad view of Tokyo, it's breathtaking. The service is superb. When they realized we would be coming back to the hotel after visiting many other cities, they immediately offered to keep part of our luggage so we wouldn't have to carry it across Japan. They kindly explained us in detail and with maps how to get to the places we wanted to. The room was small but very comfortable, with a great view, too. Clean, with everything we needed. We definitely recommend it and would certainly go back. It is THE place to stay!

We stayed for three nights and were so impressed by the location of this hotel with it's convenient access to the Shinbashi train station and the host of dining choices in the nearby Caretta Shiodome plaza. The staff were very helpful especially when it came to forwarding our luggage on to Kyoto, our next stop on this trip. I would highly recommend this low cost service (about $15 US), especially if you're traveling by train/subway/bus to get around Japan. There is one elevator that takes you directly to the subway station level but you must look carefullly for the sign. One thing, however, this may not be the hotel for you if you prefer a very soft mattress.
user_name:
Expatravel
Abu Dhabi, United Arab Emirates

review_body: My daughter was staying at the hotel, and I wanted to send her a bottle of champagne. The personal attention, kindness and brilliant service of the hotel staff in organizing was superb. And when she checked in, she was delighted with the the hotel, its amenities and customer service. A truly great experience. Thank you!

We stayed in Tokyo for six days last summer and we wanted to stay in a good hotel which was centrally located. That's how we ended up booking our room in Park Hotel. And I am happy to say that it was the perfect choice. We had a wonderful stay.As we stayed in the higher floor, we got a fantastic view of the city. The room was a bit small and had modern interiors. Japanese bathrooms are so impressive, so was ours in Park Hotel. The hotel offered all the essential amenities. The staff were extremely polite and helpful. The hotel is expensive, but definitely worth it.

We visited our son in Japan and while in Tokyo he stayed at the Park. Right across from the Conrad building and right near the Shibashi station so you have easy underground access to the trains. While not in the same class as the Conrad, it does offer a very nice deal in the center of Tokyo.

I loved staying here. The area around the hotel was modern and clean. The walk to Ginza, the train station, and the fish market was within minutes. As soon as we entered, we were greeted and the wonderful customer service continued throughout our six night stay. Because I signed up for their membership online, we were able to get an upgrade. Our upgrade was a corner twin room and well worth the extra cost if I hadn't received it as a free upgrade. The view was spectacular to say the least. The bathroom had all the amenities we needed; the room was comfortable with enough room for our luggage. I loved everything about it. They helped us with having our luggage transported to our hotel in Kyoto. They did all the paper work and had it ready when we brought our luggage. The employees went out of their way to greet us, treat us with respect, and were very efficient. Park hotel helped make my trip even more memorable.

I'm used to stay in this hotel during my frequent trips to Tokyo , normally for business purpose . There are no surprises and you always get there a very high quality of service and facilities . Staff is very helpful and friendly and location is convenient , just close to the Shimbashi station and in walking distance to many places such as Ginza , Imperial park ,etc.
user_name:
Udi D
Tel Aviv District, Israel

review_body: Awesome hotel with unique art in each room, a museum in the lobby, great views of Tokyo, close to the subway and City Center, easy airport shuttle access, and some of the finest restaurants in Japan. My family and I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights and it was a convenient hotel, with easy access to restaurants, shops, and some of the recommended sites. The Tsukiji Fish Market is about a 15 minute walk from the hotel via the pedestrian sky walk and is very close to many of the main subway lines. Airport limousine drops off and picks up directly at the entrance to the hotel, providing for easy access to the airport. Rooms are cozy and bed was a little firm, but the rooms and hotel are clean, well kept, and comfortable. We did the a la carte breakfast, instead of the buffet, as I felt that it was a bit expensive for the offering at 2400 yen. 2 pieces of toast and 2 eggs cost about 1600 yen, but it did the job. Our last morning, we opted for breakfast at McDonald's in the City Center instead and paid about 450 yen for a McGriddle combo. Good location and comfortable stay.

I stayed here with my family for 3 nights during a recent Japan trip. It's a very clean (what isn't in Japan) and modern business hotel that is great for tourists as well. We enjoyed the location, as it was away from the very busy touristy areas but close to great food, the fish market, and two train stations (so you can reach the busy touristy areas easily). The service was first rate, and it was very Western, making the transition into Japan easy. I highly recommend the hotel and will be back the next time I'm in Tokyo.

Just did a 14 day tour of Japan and this was by far the best hotel we stayed in. It starts on the 25th floor of Shiodome Media Tower. We were able to walk to and from the Ginza shopping district. The room was small but well laid out with a panoramic view of the city. The breakfast was the best we enjoyed in 2 weeks in Japan. I would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a moderately priced luxury hotel in Tokyo. There is a bit of noise from the Shinbasi train line nearby, but it did not wake me up. The station makes it easy to get around the city.

We recently spent a few nights here with my daughter. The hotel itself was beautiful and 'unusual': it starts from 25th floor and up. As it should be, the best part was the wonderful staff. They were ALL top notch, helpful, friendly, knowledgeable. I would recommend this hotel.

We stayed for one night only at the end of our trip and it was really good to be somewhere quiet, away from the hustle and bustle of the main centres. I'd recommend it if you are looking for an it more peace and quiet but not if you're looking for a vibrant area as I think it is in more of a business/office district. It is however good for transport links with the subway and JR lines only about 5-7 min walk away. Ginza is also only about 10 min walk away. Room with Tokyo tower view is definitely worth it!

I have stayed several times over the years in this Hotel but never took the time to review it. Is a great hotel and a great service. Tokyo is a big town but the location is convenient and the metro is just below the building. Great views of the city. A special mention also for the staff at the Bar who makes great drinks and is very professional.

Fantastic hotel. Great view. Was just challenged to find my way in & out of the hotel. More signage would have been helpful.All the staff where polite but as a person who was travelling alone & for the first time in the Japan, it would have been so much better if the hotel offered tour packages or tour guide service. But overall, it loved my stay, breakfast was modest but always amazing. I will choose this hotel again if I ever come back to Tokyo.
user_location: Abu Dhabi, Abu Dhabi, United Arab Emirates
user_name:
LeiZapata
Abu Dhabi, Abu Dhabi, United Arab Emirates

review_body: I stayed here late May 2017 and found the hotel perfect. My room was spotless and the bed was extremely comfortable. The bathroom had a full bath and shower. I would recommend booking the breakfast-included option as the breakfast was excellent and included Japanese and Western options. There is a great bar on site and the location is central and near many restaurants.

We stayed here in the last leg of our Japan holiday and the amazing view from our room overlooking the Eiffel Tower was spectacular. Great size bed and all the amenities you need. The bar in the hotel has the most fabulous assortment of whiskey. Apparently one of the largest selections in the world. Helpful reception staff and great art to look at in the lobby and corridors. Not sure about the bar and restaurant closing times of 10.30 pm tho!!

First things first: The lobby is on the 25th floor. That should tell you off the bat that the views are going to be spectacular. But they're even better than I expected. Absolutely beautiful, whether you're facing the Tokyo Tower or the Hamarikyu Gardens. Hotel is a very short walk to the Tsukiji Market, and has great access to Subway lines. 35 minutes to the Tokyo Dome, even less to Ginza and Akihabara. Also close walk to many small restaurants. Another thing worth noting - they included so many amenities, I basically didn't need to pack a toiletry bag. Everything from soap to toothbrushes and even razors/shaving cream were included.Ratings:Wi-fi: 5/5Water pressure/shower: 5/5Cleanliness: 5/5Bed Comfort: 5/5Location: 5/5Breakfast: Offered, did not partake

We stayed here while in Tokyo recently. The hotel is ideally situated, not far from Shimbashi station in the heart of the city. It is a modern hotel, occupying the upper floors of a skyscraper building. Our room was surprisingly spacious for the centre of Tokyo, with great views to the East. An excellent breakfast buffet is available and there is a choice of restaurant for those wanting dinner in the hotel. Service was very friendly and efficient. Free Wi-Fi with a strong signal is available throughout the hotel. Definitely recommend this hotel.

The Park occupies the top 25 floors or so of a skyscraper adjacent to Shiodome and a few minutes walk away from Shimbashi stations. The immediate location it shares with a cluster of modern tower blocks/offices but it is very well situated for getting around Tokyo either by foot (you can walk to Ginza or the fish market) or metro (from Shiodome to Ropponghi for example or anywhere else via the Hamanote line at Shimbashi).It has a couple of restaurants and you can also eat in the lobby area if you're too tired to venture further but there are restaurants on the walkways to Shimbashi and there's plenty of choice in Ginza. It also has a laundromat, which was very useful.We had a Tower View room which was plenty big enough and had a fantastic view of the Tokyo Tower.Staff were friendly and efficient.

Hotel ideally located close enough to both metro and jr without being too close. View at night out of the window of the room was amazing. Room was comfortable and staff friendly. Breakfast was ok was probably the only slight downside. If and when I visit Tokyo again I will certainly look to stay here.

We had four wonderful nights. The rooms are very nice and comfortable. The daily breakfast was delicious. The location is excellent with the subway station adjacent to the hotel. I strongly recommend this place to anyone visiting Tokyo whether for business or pleasure

The lobby is on the 25th floor of a skyscraper, so great views abound! Service is most gracious. The breakfast buffet is abundant with both Japanese and Western options. Everything from omelets, fresh fruit, salads, rice, fish, and miso soup to get your day started. The rooms are quite comfortable and are located around an atrium rising from the lobby. The hallways could use a refreshing of new carpeting and paint, but other than that, no major complaints. We would stay here again.It's well-located in the financial district, maybe a 20 minute walk from Ginza and near several train lines.
user_name:
Laura F
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: The hotel occupies the top 10 or so floors of a highrise.That said,the views from our topfloor room were amazing. As this was our first stop in Japan, we did not know quite what to expect, but the the room was quite nice with many amenities. The front desk and concierge were extremely proficient and helped with any requests we had. As we like to dine at local establishments, we did not eat at any of the hotel's restaurants, but the recommendations for local were spot on. We did have drinks at the bar our first night after a long 15 hour(medical emergency) flight and found it to be be quite expensive. After that, we found a family mart on the first floor which served our needs(but we did expect the costs of the bar to be quite high).

We stayed here 6 nights and it is a wonderful hotel. Very close to two subway lines and with easy access to JR Line. Adequate size rooms, very clean and quiet. This was our second stay (other being 2015) and they have maintained the property well. The concierge was very helpful and most of the staff speak English. Excellent breakfast. Nice smoking room off reception area. Has immediate access to underground, there are lots of eating places close and there is a Family Mart in basement for snacks/drinks. Would definitely return!

We have stayed here twice now and love it. It is centrally located when u find your way around and the metro stop is just in the basement. I do thing it is pricey for the size of room- we took an upgraded room for a view of the tower and got a glimpse of Mt Fuji as well. The gym is poor. Food downstairs is good but again pricey. Rooms are tight and shower is part of a tub.

We were happy to call Park Hotel our home during our recent trip to Tokyo. Our room, aside from having ample space by Tokyo standards, provided a spectacular view of Tokyo Tower, and, on one lucky morning, Fuji-Sama. We loved how art was incorporated into the hotel’s design and decor, right down to the quirky smoking area.Park Hotel’s location was ideal for getting around the metropolis, with access to Shiodome Station right at the basement, and Shimbashi Station across the road. We even discovered we can get to Don Quijote in Ginza by the elevated walkway. Taxis were also available right by the entrance. The front desk personnel and hotel staff were wonderfully accommodating and efficient. They made booking tickets in advance for the Airport Limousine bus back to Narita a breeze. Overall, we would love to stay here again.

The views from our room were everything claimed looking over Tokyo from the 29th floor. Staff very friendly and helpful. Rooms very comfortable and well equipped. The hotel is well located with over ground and under ground walkways to neighbouring buildings with easy access to many restaurants as well as metro and Shimbashi JR station. The only improvement would have been a choice of freshly cooked eggs included in the breakfast.

Very modern and well appointed hotel in the central business district with international guests. The staff is extremely nice and very helpful. Delicious morning buffet though there was very limited room service choices. In room coffee packs were kinda crazy.... think I spilled more than I drank. Had a corner room with a great view of the city. Comfortable king bed but it took up a lot of from. Bathroom was nice .....especially the toilet!

The park hotel was our first stop on our Japan tour and on arrival we had been flying for 19 hours , so the lovely warm welcome was greatly appreciated. In addition our tour company had told the hotel we were celebrating our 30th anniversary so they sent up a bottle of champagne . The room on the 33 floor looked over Tokyo tower to sit wonder on the view and drink champagne was fantastic. Rooms are slightly small but well equipped with nice toiletries and comfy beds . The hotel is 5 minutes from Shimbashi station which makes travel around Tokyo really easy. Staff speak excellent English and are very happy to help with directions etc. Breakfast is buffet style with both Japanese and Western options, - flaky croissants and fresh fruit were delicious. A great touring base .

We stayed at the Park Hotel both before and after our trip around Japan. It is an excellent hotel. The room was good sized and the king-size bed was very comfortable. We had the Tokyo Tower view room, which was lovely. We had the buffet breakfast one morning and it was very good. The staff is very helpful and almost everyone speaks English. We also enjoyed Tateru Yoshino Bis twice. The only negative about the hotel is that it is a bit hard to find and a bit farther from Shimbashi station than I thought. If you are staying there and plan to walk from Shimbashi, go to the hotel website under Location and download and print the Walking Map. Using the underground passage, you go down an escalator and then walk for awhile. Then you go down another escalator which looks like you are going into a subway station. Soon you come up an escalator to see a flower bed. The hotel is just a bit beyond that through some doors at the right. Once we got the hang of getting to and from the station, it was easy. For the price, I think this hotel is one of the best buys in Tokyo.

This is a fantastic hotel with a lobby on the 25th floor of a tower! We stayed on the 32nd floor in a great room with a marvellous view of the city. The room was spacious and luxurious. The room facilities were also great. The bathroom toiletries were of the highest quality and very generous. The service provided by all staff was excellent and they were always keen to please. The hotel is placed conveniently near Shigashi and Shiodome stations. Made it very easy to get around Tokyo. I would recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Tokyo. Great hotel. Chris Foulds

Stayed here three nights with family, had a wonderful time. Great view from reception on 25th floor and also from our rooms on 28th floor. Very comfy beds, great shower, spotlessly clean. Buffet breakfast was good, nice selection of fruit. Staff extremely helpful and efficient. Great location close to Shimbashi station. Some nice restaurants nearby.

Comfortable beds, great bathroom size, wonderful breakfast buffet and helpful multilingual staff. We stayed a total of 5 nights two separate times across a 10 day trip this year and it was just as great as it was last year. We stayed in a premium king room each time, room was spacious with a fridge and great view. Buffet well worth the price but there are other breakfast options in the hotel restaurants and on level 1 of the building.

Fantastic place, lovely atrium with views over the city, great food, I can recommend the French restaurant, lovely rooms, friendly staff and nice art displayed in the lobby. Very handy for the transport links around the city and to get to the main stations and airport, minutes from the Ginza shops and loads of great, cheap restaurants nearby

Stayed here four nights in total, one night after arriving in Japan. Stayed in one of the artists' rooms. Cutest room I've ever stayed in and the best single room ever with a double bed. Left large luggage here and returned after staying in Kyoto and Hiroshima for another three nights before our cruise from Yokohama. I was given a choice of artists' rooms and chose the views of old Edo and modern Tokyo. Breakfast fine on all four mornings with plenty of choice. Used the concierge lounge with free juices and free wine in the evening. Also washed our clothes before our cruise although the driers took forever and many 100 Yen coins. Found various restaurants in the other buildings along the overhead walkways with plenty of choices for evening meals.

The Park Hotel was a very central location (walked to fish market and Ginzu area) and room had amazing view, since it is up above the 25th floor in an office building. The staff were all very polite and extremely helpful in giving good restaurant recommendations and making reservations for us prior to our arrival. They also reserved Kyoto bullet train tickets for us and gave us the tix when we arrived (it was probably not necessary to get them ahead of time, but we wanted the peace of mind to have them). It was a cozy room, very clean and well appointed. Bed was extremely comfortable! Breakfast buffet very nice, a variety of Western and Japanese breakfast items. Bar had 2 for 1 happy hour until 7 pm for certain beverages.

We stayed 8 nights at this hotel in mid-May 2017. The hotel rooms are clean and a good size. Staff was helpful, courteous and most spoke English. Complimentary coffee and tea was provided. Bottled water was not available (mentioned by another reviewer). They also asked us to pay for our rooms half way thru our stay (as mentioned by another reviewer) due to our "long stay". They give you to option of paying in JY or USD. For me paying in JY provided a better exchange rate. My only complaint was the limited number of outlets for all of our electronic devices.The views from the hotel lobby and our rooms was fantastic. Great view of Tokyo Tower every day. Even got to see Mt. Fuji one morning. We were on the 28th floor, but I suspect every room in hotel has great city views. The location of the hotel was great for exploring Tokyo. Located above the Shiodome subway station and a 15 minute walk to the Shimbashi station (via the underground mall, on B2 or elevated walkway on the 3rd floor). Being so close to transit was a welcomed relief at the end of a long day of sightseeing. The hotel lobby is just an elevator ride from the subway and a 15 minute walk from Shimbashi via a well lit mall that was still active late at night (so you felt safe). Ginza and the Tsukiji Fish Market are also a 15-20 minute walk from the hotel. We did not eat at the daily breakfast buffett. We hit the Family Mart (multiple locations in the underground mall below the hotel) and stocked up on snacks to eat while sightseeing before a sit down meal for lunch. There are multiple restaurants (20+) in the mall with different price points. On our last day we ate at Marugame Seimen in the Caretta building after checking out of the hotel. They serve tempura and udon cafeteria style and cater mostly to business people. Fortunately, they have an English menu - just ask. . Service is fast. Starbucks, McDonalds. and 711 stores are common in the Caretta building.Narita Airport Limo Bus will pick you up from the hotel and take you to the airport from the first floor of the Shiodome Media Tower (name of building hotel is located in). Beats the hassle of hauling luggage thru subway/train stations. A little more expensive per person but worth it. The hotel staff can make reservations for you. The staff will deliver your luggage to the bus.

Room was a bit worn and I found the bed and pillows to be somewhat uncomfortable. Room was small but I think that seemed to be pretty standard size for Tokyo and the space was efficiently used and kept cleanThe hotel was very helpful with forwarding our luggage to our next destination and that was appreciated.

...well, actually it's a great hotel, too - just the highlight for me were the views from our room..We stayed earlier in May for 7 nights, this being our first trip to Tokyo... Great 4* hotel, I would definitely stay again and recommend to others.Positives:- Did I mention the view? The hotel lobby starts on the 25th floor, so all rooms would be guaranteed some kind of view. We paid extra for a corner room (Sky Tower view), on the 29th floor and were not disappointed! Almost floor to ceiling, panoramic views looking towards Mount Fuji, from the bed! Incredible.- Comfortable and fairly spacious room, with huge bed. - Good bathroom, toiletries etc.- Very quiet, we slept very well every night.- Despite arriving early, we were able to check-in at 10:00, some 5 hours before official check-in (which was handy due to some serious jet-lag).- Location, fairly quiet, commercial type of area with lots of nearby offices, but very handy for public transport, being right on 2 subway and 1 railway lines. If you don't mind a bit of a walk, you can easily wander up the main '5th Avenue' style shopping streets which we did several times - on your way to 'Tokyo' main station. Also you are very near to the fish market - a must when visiting Tokyo.- The staff were great and couldn't do enough for us, with plenty of available advice on how to get to places.- Prices around the hotel (e.g. the minibar) were fairly sensible.- There is a convenience store in the basement of the building where you can stock up on snacks, if required.Negatives (TBH, not many):- The communal areas of the hotel were fairly small, with not much choice of dining options.- The restaurant closed fairly early (by UK standards, anyway). On a particular Saturday night, after 21:30 there was only room service food available to eat in the bar. On the night when we did get to the restaurant early, the service felt very rushed as they hurried to clear everyone out. - Being that the area was very commercial, at the weekend, it felt very quiet and again, nearby restaurants were closed early.Summary:As long as you are not expecting a 5* hotel (although this came very close, in my opinion) and are not scared of heights - then this could be the ideal resting place for you! Just plan your day to make sure that you either eat out or have plenty of time left in the evening to have your evening meal at the hotel. Getting to all the attractions that Tokyo has to offer was easy by using the nearby subway and train links. Tips:- A taxi from Haneda airport came in at around $45US, although it would have been possible to take the monorail to a nearby station, with just a single change and then short walk.- Getting to Narita airport was achieved by using the Narita Express (included on your JR Pass, btw), to Tokyo station then a quick change and a few local stops to get to the hotel. As it's much further out, I think a taxi to Narita would be expensive.

The Park Hotel is a very well located hotel, close to Ginza and the Shinbashi train station. Extremely clean hotel and helpful staff. Hotel is nice and quiet but close enough to the nightlife to keep you active. Great views of Tokyo tower from the corner rooms. Good sized rooms.The Yamanote line (which circles Tokyo) can be accessed from the Shinbashi station which is extremely useful. This gives you extremely good access to most of Tokyo's attractions. Train travel on the Yamanote line is free if you have a JR Pass.no complaints.

This was our last stop in Japan and we stayed a week here. It's a nice hotel but caters more to foreign travelers than local Japanese tourists. They serve a morning breakfast which we didn't sign up for the package. The place touts itself as part museum so you see lots of art pieces in the lobby which is nice but has a sterile feel where you don't quite feel comfortable like in a museum. The staff is polite but feels guarded. The strange thing is that 2 days into our stay, they asked for partial payment on the rooms because we were "staying a long time". Most hotels settle the bill at the conclusion of the stay. So either they have fiscal problems or have gotten stiffed on the bill in the past. There is a small laundromat on the 26th floor as well as a gym. Use of the gym requires booking an appointment. From our room we had a great view of the city and Tokyo Tower and one clear day we're lucky to see Mt. Fuji in the distance. The hotel has access to small Japanese restaurants in the basement which were frequented by business folks. It is walking distance to a mall with Starbucks, Japanese restaurants and the metro. There are a couple of nearby Family Marts to pick up food, Japanese snacks and water. We were able to purchase tickets from the hotel for the bus to pick us up from the hotel lobby and take us to the airport for our flight home, recommend you book 2 days ahead to guarantee a seat. The rooms are clean and they give you complimentary drip coffee, tea and a large bottle of water. I would stay at the hotel due to location near the metro and JR lines which we took daily but didn't really like the stiff feel of the lobby and the strange policy of paying for part of your room bill halfway thru your stay.

The staff was friendly and helpful, and central Ginza is a 15 minute walk. Quick access to two subway stations but get a map or directions to navigate the underground to Shimbashi, or take the elevated walkways. Good international breakfast buffet with extensive selections. The room was small but clean and serviceable with a nice view from the 29th floor. One amusing tidbit--not a complaint: we wanted to eat something light after returning from Ginza on our first night (ever) in Japan and ordered the "chef salad" from the cafe in the atrium. It included a nice variety of very fresh lettuce and a bit of julienned cucumber lightly dressed--that's it. I was looking for "the works" so this was my first of several mis-translations during the trip. Fortunately there is a convenience store located in the tower basement.

It's for that extra special feeling of being inside an artwork. Guests on this floor can enjoy a quiet breakfast room. Great for something quick before heading to the airport. I think it was complimentary as we were not asked any questions. The attendant was very nice and made us panini and fruit smoothies. There is a coffee machine if that's all you want with your newspaper and city views.

This was the first hotel we stayed at in Japan and it was a very pleasant experience. The staff were most helpful and answered all our questions. We ate in three restaurants all good and the breakfast provided sufficient choice. The rooms are very small but we found that was not too much of a disadvantage. Shimbasi station is close but it is important to get directions and a map of the underground passage between the hotel and the station. Without this you can get lost in the Shiodome area. I would definitely recommend this hotel to others visiting Tokyo.

On this trip, I stayed at 4 hotels throughout Japan. Everywhere I stayed I was treated with such lovely thoughtful hospitality. You get valet service, taxi translators, check ups on your day and how they can help you. Not the case at the Park Hotel. You're very much on your own. Nobody ever said anything to us and you were totally on your own. The room was run down, carpets spotted and TV are old. Beautiful view of the Tokyo Tower and the subway and train station were close by. The room was very quiet and the wifi was blazing fast. I streamed Netflix without any service interruptions. This hotel does not deserve the 4+ rating and I regret I didn't make another choice. It's frustrating because I did a lot of research and this seemed like a great fine.

The Park Hotel is a terrific property in the Minato Ward in Tokyo. The property is close to the Ginza area, and about a 2 minute walk from the Shiodome Station on the Yurikamome Line or the Shimbashi Station with access from a number of major train lines including the Yamamote, Tokyo Metro Ginza, Tokaido and Asakusa (Airport Limited Express) lines.The hotel was reasonably priced for the Minato/Ginza area, with reasonably good sized rooms and a great view of the city and Tokyo Tower if you get a room on that side of the building. The lobby is on the 25th floor, with the rooms above. You won't have to go to Tokyo Tower's lower observation deck if you stay here. Our room on the 33rd out of 35 floors was at about the same level as the tower's first observation deck. This is a medium-to-higher-end property that is clean and well cared for. The buffet breakfast was quite good. I would rate it 7-8 out of 10 compared to other hotels that I have stayed at in Asia, with a number of quality items to choose from. The only thing lacking was some of the made-to-order options often available at some properties, and the variety was at the lower end for higher-end hotels. But still quite good. The hotel staff was terrific and very helpful.I would highly recommend the hotel for those looking for a quality property at a reasonable price (for Tokyo!). While this is more of a 3.5-4-star hotel rather than 5-star property, I give it a 5-star rating due to the reasonable cost, location cleanliness (even by Japan standards) and above average quality rooms.
user_name:
David P
Salt Lake City, Utah

review_body: This hotel is like the Japanese people - very organised, beautiful and very clean. We loved it. The rooms are very clean and well appointed. Bed is comfortable and we slept soundly as it is also very quiet. The staff are very friendly and always smiling. Although we didn't have an artist room we still some special art painted on the wall. Lovely hotel.

My wife and I stayed at The Park Hotel for 2 nights prior to a cruise. The hotel reception is on the 25th floor and there are some fantastic views from the reception area and from our bedroom which overlooked the Tokyo Tower and a night it was magnificent (we had booked a standard room but were upgraded). We even saw Mount Fugi in the distance. The hotel is well placed to either walk or take the very efficient public transport system. The staff were very pleasant and efficient. We had booked a personal guide (8hours) who took us to the highlights of Tokyo using the public transport system - I think this enabled us to get about quickly and efficiently. My wife and I walked easily to local attractions and the main shopping areas. Eating in the hotel is expensive but Japan is for us Brits quite expensive!

We enjoyed our stay at Park Hotel. We felt very welcome by English speaking staff. Lovely, clean hotel with a Metropolitan feel. Quite comfortable room with small fridge, in-service room safe, coffee. Comfy beds, nice bathroom, great views, located near two train stations. Highly recommend!

Spent 6 nights in this small hotel. The hotel is on the 25th floor of an office building. I ended up paying extra for the Tokyo tower view and it was worth it. Breakfast is quite good. Staff polite and helpful. Great location,minutes from Shimbashi subway station

Being on top of Shimbashi station makes getting anywhere else in town very easy. Short walk to fish market. Nice whiskey bar in the lobby. I had a nice view from my room looking over the city. Staff were friendly, no problems at all.

Great location. Had room with view of Tokyo Tower. Very cute sign in room stating that we paid for the wonderful view, so enjoy it! View was exceptional at night with the lights on the tower. Staff was great. Very helpful. Hotel lobby is on the 25th floor so all guest rooms are above. Rooms are small by US standards, but fine. Breakfast buffet very good. Would recommend it. Would stay again. Wonderful start to our visit to Japan.

A good room, excellent staff, some great views, very handy location and at least one excellent restaurant. We greatly enjoyed our stay at this hotel and appreciated all the help staff we able to give us. Good breakfast in an elegant setting. One night we ate in the TY Bis restaurant and I had probably the best lamb I have eaten in many years (and having visited New Zealand 18 times in the last 40 years I count myself an expert!). Service there was first class. I know where I will stay the next time I am in Tokyo!

My stay was great , the room was spacious, comfortable and clean, the staffs very professional, friendly , knowledgeable and helpful. Our room was a corner view king bed,33 floors with a view of the Tokyo Tower,The location is near train station,easy access to many attractions.Have a nice stay.

We arrived so tired from the flight but upon entering the lobby and seeing the gorgeous view of the Tokyo Tower, we immediately brightened up! And it only got better after that - our room had the same incredible view, the bed was very comfortable and the breakfast buffet was utterly amazing. In fact, we cancelled our hotel for our return trip and booked our remaining nights with Park Hotel Tokyo. Can't wait to return!

Excellent location for exploring Tokyo. The rooms, though compact, are clean, well equipped and have good bathrooms. Service is efficient and helpful. The Park got our vote for best breakfast! and the in-house Japanese restaurant is so good, you need to book a few days ahead. Overall, the ideal choice for a short break visiting Tokyo. I would definitely return.

Fantastic find in the district of Shiodome. Room on the 28th floor facing Hama Rikyu Gardens and the bay, was on the small side but otherwise spotlessly clean. The bed was very comfortable and the shower had plenty of hot water with good pressure. Bathroom supplies included hair brushes, toothbrushes, toothpaste, razors, Qtips, and the usual lotions, shower washes, etc. A minor irritation; there was no one to open the main door for you as you enter the hotel with luggage because the hotel lobby was on the 25th floor. Would come here again and highly recommend this reasonably priced property.
user_name:
Merlew917
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: We stayed here in February 2017, and arrived at a week at the snow. The staff were incredible from the day I made my first enquiry. They made everything so, so easy & there was never an issue with a language barrier.We chose to stay in a Tokyo Tower View Queen room, which was was worth every cent. The view is absolutely breathtaking, and we could even see Mt Fuji in the background on a clear day. The bay window was an absolute delight to sit in and take in the views. Despite reading reviews regarding the size, I was actually really happy with the room. We had enough room to put our two large suitcases (the staff were incredibly helpful and kept our giant ski bag in storage for us), and we had plenty of room to move around. We didn't spend huge amounts of time in our room, but even when we had room service we felt there was sufficient space.The bed was super comfy, and the room had all the amenities we required (yep, even the fancy Japanese toilet). The bathroom was small, but it had everything we needed, and it is Tokyo after all!We had no issues with finding the hotel (we took a taxi from the bus terminal). It was so awesome being right above the train/subway lines. We used the shops in the walkway a fair bit too, which was super convenient. It was so easy to explore from the hotel room that we didn't eat in the local area much.The staff really went the extra mile by booking us in at a 3-Star Michelin restaurant in Osaka, which was one of bucket list items. I didn't have to worry at all about our booking, as the staff had a confirmation form & corresponded directly with the restaurant on our behalf.I would definitely recommend staying here if you're after something modern, close to transport, excellent value for money, and first class service.

the hotel is 10 minutes walk from Ginza district. and 10 minutes walk from The fish market. The rooms are clean, not small, very elegant, the lobby Decorated with works of art. the hotel starts on the 25th floor and has sea and city views. The nearest train station is Shinbashi station.

It was my first trip to Japan and the hotel was like a home for me in the new and unfamiliar world. The staff was very friendly and helpful and the room was spacious and very clean. The Tokyo tower view was simply stunning at every time of the day. Ginza and the fish market is just a short walking distance away and so is Shimbashi station which brings you everywhere a tourist needs to go. I will be back for sure.

We arrived from Haneda airport via the metro. The map we had made it look easy to find the hotel from the station exit. But which exit had we emerged from and where was the access to the raised walkways. Late at night in the cold and dark and with suitcases this was not ideal but after one false start of trying to check in to the wrong hotel we found our destination. Reception staff were welcoming, despite the late hour, and we were soon in a small but very comfortable room with wonderful city views. We only stayed the one night but we could not have been beeter looked after - and the included breakfast was good too.In daylight and travelling in the opposite direction it was easy to find our way back to the station!

This is one of the best hotels that we have stayed in. It was a little confusing to find it in the first place (as we were navigating from the train station) but once we arrived, we were greeted with such great service. We had one of the rooms with the art work and the view was amazing over Tokyo. We couldn't fault anything with our stay at the Park Hotel Tokyo. The rooms were clean and lovely, the staff were amazing and the location was fantastic to the train stations. We will be coming back to Tokyo to explore more and will definitely be staying at the Park Hotel!

Being the first hotel we stayed in Japan, it didn't disappoint. The hotel rooms are located on the top 20 or so floors so when you arrive on the lobby, the views of Tokyo are simply stunning. The staff are extremely friendly and will cater to all your needs. There is also a decent choice of breakfast buffet including a traditional Japanese breakfast and your typical 'western' breakfasts.One of the best features about the room/hotel, besides the view is its location. It's located extremely close to the world famous fish market and also has its own entrance exit to the Shiodome station. Shinbashi station is also a 6 minute walk. Most certainley recommend the hotel to anyone.

The Park Hotel is part of Shiodome's complex of high-rise office towers and hotels connected by a network of above ground walkways. It's also close to the Shimbashi station for both Japan Rail and subway lines. It's walking distance to both the famous Tsukiji fish market (until they move) and an Edo-period public garden. The Ginza is about a 15 minute walk. There's an excellent breakfast buffet. The French restaurant is popular so advance reservations are necessary (we tried to get one a day in advance but were unsuccessful). There's also a cafe in the building lobby that serves western food; we had a quite acceptable late lunch of clam chowder, small salad and quiche. The hotel lobby on the 25th floor also has a lounge where you can get lunch or dinner. We ate there; they were out of a couple different entrees but the salmon we had was tasty.The hotel is popular with tour groups, so breakfast a peak time is a bit of a scrum.From the lobby early in the a.m. it may be possible to see Mt. Fuji in the distance (look for it to the left of the Tokyo Rail Tower).

Brilliant hotel! Great architecture starts with the triangular building and the high rise lobby. Lovely rooms pretty spacious for Tokyo standards with amazing amenities. We just loved the Shampoo :-)!!! Excellent Breakfast.If you are lucky you can see Mount Fuji from the reception, behind Tokyo tower.

Great Location (literally on top of a metro station) and a short walk away from a ton of areas worth visiting (be prepared to walk a lot in Tokyo - it was usually quicker than the metro and your fitbit will love you for it), attentive service and super helpful staff who sorted our bag transfer to our next destination with zero fuss. Room was great with a crazy view of the Tokyo skyline and the breakfast well worth getting out of bed for. My only vaguely negative point to make is don't bother with the bar, drinks are crazy expensive and it boosts almost zero atmosphere - but with a million other bars worth visiting in Tokyo not really sure that's an issue?!

Loved the hotel. Regular rooms are small but I suppose that's normal for Tokyo. However very clean, bathroom fully stocked and very attentive staff. Loved the bar with the special designed icecubes.5 minutes walking distance to shimbashi station and a ton of tiny restaurants. We visited every important part of town and loved this part the most because of the eateries . Great view !

Cannot fault the staff - very polite and helpful. Location was good as well. The hotel itself was a bit of a let down. The room we had did not come up to expectations and could do with a general make over and update.

Room with a view 2812. Our first hotel on arrival in Tokyo. Close to the rail links. Great Corner kingsize room on the 28th floor, looking across at the Tokyo Tower. Our only view of Mount Fuji on the last day in the mist behind the Tower. Great access to transport links. Excellent staff, very helpful. We had room service on the first night which was prompt and very good.Only problem we felt was the lack of drawer space, but everything else perfect. Great supply of toiletries which were replaced daily.We had our luggage forwarded on from here to Kyoto, something we had never done before and were worried about, but we needn't have been. All very efficient.There was an exhibition in reception, which is on the 25th floor, of Beckoning Cats, all hand made, my treat to myself.

First time to Tokyo and the first hotel we stayed in. Good location about 90 mins by car from Narita. Very close to Shimbashi and Tsukiji fish market. Well sized room and terrific views from our 32nd floor room. Overlooked Shimbashi station which is very busy but the noise didn't bother us. Good bathroom with all the extras. A/C works well and is not too noisy. Staff are helpful and courteous. Breakfasts buffet is excellent with good range of Western and Japanese foods. Hotel is very clean and well decorated..loved the central atrium area. Wifi works well but most people rent a portable router and reception for that is good throughout the hotel.

Excellent customer service, very convenient access (walking) to Ginza shops and restaurants. We had an artist room, which was a really nice touch, and also included access to the artist rooms floor lounge that offered free coffee and breakfast snacks and smoothies.
