The hotel is pricy but very nice, ultimately, it's competitive for the location. Train stations are really easy to get to from the third floor exit, and there's a really cool Miyazaki-designed clock that animates/chimes at certain hours just outside the third floor exit.

This was a great hotel to stay at for a first hotel on a first trip to Japan - beautifully appointed twin room, clean, bright and modern, convenient located near Ginza in the business district. The hotel is essentially right above a metro station, and a few minute walk to a major JR train station. The buffet breakfast was huge, with excellent selection of western and Asian dishes.On our return to Tokyo we stayed in an AirBnB in Akihabara which I ultimately preferred, but I'm really glad we stayed at the Park while we were acclimatizing to being in Japan. It was really helpful having an English-speaking concierge and front desk in those first few days.

Excellent location close to stations (rail and metro) and clearly well used by western tourists. Breakfast buffet is as you'd expect in any serious international hotel and service from staff is splendid. Extremely helpful and courteous. The bar is (very) expensive but not out of keeping with similar establishments in Japan. I would stay here again if travelling to Tokyo.

We had a very memorable 7 days stay at the Park Hotel Tokyo. We were given a room on the 30th floor with a great view of the Tokyo Tower. The breakfast was great too, with a good spread of Western and Japanese choices. The location is superb due to it's proximity to the Shimbashi station and just one stop away from Ginza. Also, we were happy to have a couple Indian dining choices at the Shiodome itself! All in all, it was a very comfortable and enjoyable stay for us. The service too was exceptional. We are already looking forward to our next visit!

On the whole, this is a nice four star hotel with the usual amenities. No complaints there.I got excellent support from the concierge on several requests for dinner reservations.But there were odd lapses too. I had a great Italian pasta dish for lunch, delicious in every respect, except for the canned Kraft "parmesan" on top. In another lapse, the scrambled eggs on the breakfast buffet were significantly underdone two days in a row. Intelligent people can argue about the correct doneness of scrambled eggs. However, "pourable liquid" is generally not a favored option. I tried to print out a single page in the business center and came away stymied after forty minutes without my page. I couldn't get the computers to do anything I wanted to do seemingly because of a lot of firewall protections blocking fairly normal websites.I also disagree with other reviews about the hotel's "great location." Every hotel in Tokyo is convenient to a subway station. For the Tsukuji fish market, it's convenient.  maybe. If I wanted to do "shop until you drop" shopping in the Ginza, I'd stay at a hotel more conveniently located in the Ginza. This hotel is a good 30 minute walk from Ginza 7, the first real shopping street. This is also not a great area for restaurants. They do exist at the top of office towers, but most things in the neighborhood are pedestrian and close up after the office workers have gone home. I'm finding I'm spending $50-60 round trip on taxis every night to go to Roppongi to eat in the restaurants I want to explore.As a tourist, I'd stay in Roppongi the next time I'm here.

This hotel is centrally located, convenient to the train station, restaurants and connected by sky walkways. The lobby is located on the 25th floor with friendly staff and concierge ready to help you. Was very happy with our room, it was spacious, clean, comfortable bed and I really liked the bidet with the heated toilet seat. The view from our room was spectacular, especially at night when the Tokyo Tower was lit up. They have a very good breakfast that was an additional charge I thought to be a little on the expensive side. All in all; a very luxurious hotel.

The hotel is is an ideal location, especially for first time visitors to tokyo. Having the subway station in the building really makes learning to navigate the city easy. Bring high up gave great views of the city and made the rooms very quiet. The rooms are comfortable and the bathrooms are a good size. The breakfast was quite expansive and generous. We would highly recommend this hotel.

My first stay in Tokyo. An exceptional Hotel with excellent staff, their English speaking skills were exemplary. The room was very well appointed and of a good size, the views were breathtaking from our 26th floor room. I highly recommend a stay at this hotel. If I had one little gripe is that the fitness room was small and somewhat lacking otherwise top marks.

Stayed in an artist's room, facing Tokyo Tower. Views must be some of the best you can find in all of Tokyo. I would recommend anyone staying here to stay in an artist's room. 31st lounge has complimentary wine and liquor in the evenings, which I still find astonishing (and it's pretty decent too). Service from all staff, front desk, concierge, etc. was truly top notch. Only complaint would be breakfast - food not that good, also kind of strange that you eat breakfast in the lobby/the arrangement was quite weird. Everything else about the hotel and our experience, however, was excellent.

We spend 3 nights and took an upgrade to the Tokyo tower side view which we did not regret. The room was conformable and correct size. The could be at least 1 English channel on TV, all were in Japan. The reception is on the 25th floor. The plan to get to the hotel from the train station was not that obvious with large bags so we hired a taxi that cost 500 yen so save your back!. There are restaurants and a convenience store in the basement and many restaurants nearby as well. There are concretions to subway lines and JR. I would recommend this hotel. The restaurant on the premise is in the Michelin guide, we did not try it out though but we bought patisserie at the bakery on floor1, great taste!

My only gripe about this hotel is that they have essentially no gym. I think they have a bike and elliptical machine and that is all.Otherwise, it was a great hotel. Good location near 2 separate subway stops. Shuttle bus stops here from the airport so that was also easy. We had a great view of the Tokyo Tower from here. The staff was great. I would say that another slightly annoying thing was that the concierge had limited hours.The hotel room itself wasn't large but wasn't small either. Good bath products. Also, this place is one of few nicer hotels in Tokyo that had onsite laundry machines (the machine is a combination washer/dryer for 400yen)...this is great if you are like me and coming for over 2 weeks but don't want to bring a ton of clothes.I would definitely consider staying here again though.

First time I stayed at this property and I will definitely stay again. The rooms are modern and large for a Tokyo hotel. The staff is very nice and attentive to details. Very nice location with good access to transportation. Overall a very pleasant stay.

From the time you arrive, until the time you leave, the staff takes care of everything for you. The food was wonderful, the messages were perfect, the service was delightful and their location is hard to beat. Our room was clean, well supplied and good size for Tokyo. We will definitely stay there again.

The hotel is located in the Siodome media tower on the 25th floor. The media tower is above shiodome station and very close to Shimbashi station making travel around Tokyo really easy. Rooms are clean, bright and comfortable with artwork painted on the walls. The bathroom is equipped with an array of toiletries and useful items including hairbrush, razor etc. There is a hairdryer in the room. Tea and coffee making facilities including green tea. A minibar which was well used on arrival after a long tiring day of travel. In room safe also available. The hotel staff are very friendly and efficient even loaning us an umbrella. Breakfast is a mix of Japanese and western foods. The fruit was delicious and really juicy. Didn't try the hotel restaurant at night due to the array of restaurants in the area.

We were in Tokyo for a few days and wanted to stay somewhere convenient. Park hotel was about 10 minutes walk from the Shimbashi metro station and about 15 minutes walk from the famous Tsukiji fish market. The hotel is located on the 25th floor of Shiodome Media Tower. (It took us a while to realize that we actually reached as we were expecting the lobby to be on the first floor)While the hotel was a little old, the rooms were reasonably sized (for Tokyo standards) and very clean. Wifi was fast and I had no problems watching Netflix. As with most hotels in Japan, there are limited selections of English channels on TV. Service is good and staff were quick to help in reservations of restaurants and giving directions. During the morning, we could easily stroll to Tsukiji market for breakfast. Shimbashi metro station connects us to many stations easily so we did not waste too much time travelling. We will not hesitate to stay here again the next time we are in Tokyo.

Stayed at a corner king with Tokyo Tower view. In consideration of other hotels in Tokyo, this room was large and had a great view. This hotel's location is good for walk and the use of subway system. Do not miss this the breakfast buffet.

A bit more than the standard business hotel. A warm welcome on arrival, comfortable room, attentive staff and comfortable room made this a pleasant place to stay during a busy schedule. My only criticism would be the breakfast was a bit more expensive than one would expect.Close to transport links and easily accessible. The views are stunning and the ambience is relaxed and calm.I liked it.

This modern convenient high standards hotel impressed from the moment we arrived. Reception staff were welcoming and very efficient. Our room was spacious and very well appointed. And spotless. The room was quiet. It had remarkable cityscape views. The buffet breakfast covered all tastes: the staff were welcoming and attentive .The Park Hotel is well placed for the subway and conveniently placed for tourism/business.

Beautiful classy hotel. We had a room with a view of the Tokyo tower and it was gorgeous. Rooms were clean and the bed was very comfortable. Bathroom was nice and clean. The breakfast buffet was average. I think a lovely place to stay and close to the train station.

very lovely ( big ) hotel . On top 10 floors of the shiodome tower. Amazing views over Tokyo (Tokyo tower looks amazing behind reception windows) Service and food is very good . Room was excellent with 180 view of Tokyo - great value for tokyo

we arrived well before check in time after a 12 hr flight and were immediately shown to our very comfortable and spacious room on the 29th floor with a view across the city and the Tokyo Tower in the foreground, particularly dramatic lit up at night. our first acquaintance with a Japanese toilet with heated seat and undercarriage washing and drying and automatic flushing and lid raising and lowering was a revelation. Breakfasts were excellent with a wide choice of both western and Japanese dishes and was served in the attractive 8 storey atrium where we also had dinner. this was ok but with a rather limited menu and too loud music. we also had one meal in the Japanese restaurant which was very good but rather impersonal. service throughout the hotel was friendly efficient and helpful. we used the luggage hotel to hotel next day forwarding service which worked very efficiently throughout our trip.the hotel is located conveniently to the subway rail system, is connected by extensive and complex subway walkways to several stations, other buildings and shopping areas.

For those who plan to visit the fish market early in the morning, this hotel is a good choice. There is no need to take a taxi or the subway, it took about 20 minutes walk from the hotel to the fish market. The concierge helpfully provided us with a map depicting the location of the fish market and we simply followed the route shown. Part of the route is along the elevated walkway linking the hotel and some other office buildings, the latter part is along the highway with pedestrian crossings. To reach the hotel, we took the Airport express to Shimbashi station via Tokyo station. From Shimbashi station, its about 10 minutes walk to the hotel. The trouble we first encountered was we mixed it up with the Royal Park Hotel which is located across the road. Once we found our bearings, it was not difficult to find. Also, Ginza is within walking distance. After checking in, we strolled to Ginza for shopping and a delightful dinner. Our room had a view of the Tokyo tower, twin beds and all the essential amenities such as toiletries, slippers, free wifi, TV with English channels, safe and tea/coffee. The room is small yet its comfortable and clean. Check in was efficient and the staff was friendly and helpful.

My second stay at the Park hotel was just as enjoyable as the first however it was spoils slightly by being asked at check in to pay half the bill in advance. When I asked why, I was told "because it is a lot". I declined to pay in advance, which the receptionist accepted, however there can only be one inference from this request - which I genuinely find unacceptable.This incident aside, the hotel is well placed, nice spacious rooms and good service.

My husband and I recently finished a long cruise with the last stop in Tokyo. We booked the hotel based on the excellent ratings and the art connection. They have several rooms designed by local artists and also have are displayed in the lobby. Our room overlooked the Tokyo tour and Mt. Fuji. Luckily we were able to see Mt. Fuji the last morning we were there. The room was very comfortable with a central location with enclosed areas to other buildings where shopping and many restaurants can be found. The hotel lobby is on the 25th floor and also has a restaurant and coffee bar. We would definitely stay there again.

Very close to stations for easy access around Tokyo and beyond. Very comfortable room with great bed and all amenities. we were on the artists floor which gave us access to a free light breakfast and drinks during the day...and wine available in the evenings. The view from that lounge is very good and it is a great place to wind down after a days sightseeing with a complimentary glass. The restaurants are good and not unreasonably priced. Staff lovely.

The hotel lobby located at the 25th floor of a high rise allowing for beautiful view especially at night.The rooms are relatively spacious. Pieces of original art work are spread around the lobby, restaurants and some hallways.Breakfast is served in a buffet style and is really generous.

Picked this hotel based on the view of Tokyo tower and did not disappoint. To wake up to a clear blue sky morning and see not only Tokyo Tower but also Mt Fuji in the distance was a delight. And to come home in the evening to see the tower lit up just gave the room a special touch. I don't normally pay extra for rooms with a view, or additional features as I don't spend much time in the room but I am glad I did and it was a great way to cap off my Japan holiday. Hotel lobby is on the 25th floor of the building so as you approach the reception desk you get the first glimpse of Tokyo Tower. The room is small and bathroom is tight but that's to be expected for a Tokyo hotel. Everything was clean and functioned well.

arriving at noon after flight from London our room was immediately available. spacious and comfortable, magnificent view of tower and across city. best hotel WiFi connection ever.cafe/restaurant in Atrium attractive and comfortable with many works of contemporary art.excellent breakfasts dinner ok but with limited menu. dinner in Japanese very good but a bit soulless. service throughout the hotel helpful friendly and impeccable. one slight cavil music one evening in atrium far too loud.

This was a very nice hotel in a good location, convenient to the subway and train station. The staff was super courteous and helpful. The rooms were clean and well appointed. The breakfast was very good and so was the coffee. It was the first hotel we stayed at on our trip through Japan and was by far the best. Thank you Park Hotel we hope to return some day.

Service is very good, rooms spacious and with some good views, excellent breakfast buffet and convenient location. Would definitely return, and would happily recommend to friends or colleagues. Bathrooms are very snug, but have everything that you might need.

My family of 5, 3 adult daughters and parents, stayed for 3 nights during our first trip to Japan. The hotel is steps from the subway station and very modern. Views from the lobby were incredible. My sisters and I shared a room with 2 twins and cot. I slept on the cot which was comfortable and the room was fairly spacious despite our large suitcases. We felt a bit separate from the more "exciting and modern" parts of Japan and we seemed to be in a more "business" district. The one stand out problem we had was the first night when my sister found bright red blood drops on her bed sheets. The sheets obviously hadn't been washed. Staff quickly brought up fresh sheets. Gym is barely big enough for 2 people and has a broken bow flex and old stationary bike and elliptical. It must be reserved in advance. Breakfast was included in our package and was and nice buffet. My sister is vegan and was able to find satisfying options. Wide variety of traditional Japanese breakfast items along with more western foods.

I'll try to detail my review here because I didn't on booking.com and I really regretted not doing so:- Very well located hotel, you're connected to Shimbashi - a hub for a lot of major subway line so you can get to anywhere from there, not to mention that you are a short walk away from Ginza. - The view from the rooms is breathtaking - our room was on the 31st floor and we had a magical view on Tokyo Tower from there. Important to mention is the size of the windows: they're huge! my favorite thing to do was to sit on the window side (it's cushioned) and enjoy my early morning coffee. - The artist rooms are really amazing, you can spend a long time staring at the walls without feeling like an idiot :) They also let you choose among the available rooms so you can get the room of your choosing!- The staff is very helpful and very kind. We arrived at 9am (the check-in is from 2pm) but they gave us one of the rooms immediately because it was available and they sped up the cleaning of the second one so they can enable us to rest as early as possible - I really appreciated that after a 14h flight. - If you are staying in an artist room you will have a complimentary breakfast in a small room on the 31st floor - again with an amazing view on Tokyo Bay. A very nice touch which we didn't expect at all. All-in-all I would very highly recommend this hotel if you are looking for something different and new with an amazing view. The pricing is very correct and you definitely get more than you pay for.

I had the pleasure to stay in one of the artist rooms and it was an amazing experience! The Park Hotel is a very good location, very central and it's very easy to get to places around Tokyo. I absolutely couldn't keep my eyes away from the view from my hotel room, the city lights and Tokyo Tower was gorgeous. I can't wait to stay with them again!

We love the view from our room, tokyo tower and city light very beautiful at night. On daylight we can spot the mount fuji.Room and toilet quite small but clean and comfortable enough for us to stay for a few nights.In addition, coin laundry also available in this hotel. Plus point for traveller like us who need the laundry service with cheaper price for our kid clothes.Service staff quite friendly, check in and out procedure also quite efficient.On top of that, location considered quite good as it is connected directly to JR train station (i.e shimbashi) for just a few minutes walk.

We stayed here four nights and everything was great.The room was spacious and clean with a great view (we had a double non-smoking room on the top floor).Staff was very nice and helpful. The bar and lobby were wonderful as well. Location is great, really close to Hamarikyu garden and Ginza, which is a nice area for shopping and eating. Absolutely would advice to stay here when staying in Tokyo!

On the upper floors of an office building so a little strange. However, rooms were clean and adequate. Skip the Asian restaurants, there are better local restaurants nearby. But the breakfast buffet was wonderful!

We stayed for three night in March for leisure. Our room was on the 30th floor and we had views over Tokyo Tower and Mount Fuji and it was spectacular, unfortunately Mount Fuji only popped out twice at evening but it was still magnificent. The room was larger than most in Tokyo and the bathroom a moderate size. Amenities provided were good. There was an ice machine and a vending machine on our floor and this was welcomed. Reception for this hotel is on the 25th floor, as you enter the building turn right and you will see the elevators up, it's not confusing. Our receptionist spoke excellent English.We ate at the mezzanine restaurant on the first night and the food and the service was exceptional but be prepared to pay a little more. We went to have breakfast at the cafe on the first floor on our last morning but it was full of business people or people who were well dressed and they did not look like they would have appreciated any westerners sitting among them, we got looked at with derision, sorry, but that's how it was. So we grabbed some pastries from the bakery next door and went back to our room for coffee. The pastries from this bakery are the best we have ever had and we love pastries and eat them nearly every morning we are away.We also had in room dining and it was only okay.When we ate at the restaurant, they sat all the westerners on one side of the plants division and all the Japanese on the other side of the plants, make of that what you will. :)We enjoyed our stay here and would not hesitate to recommend it. Just be aware that, like a lot of places in Japan, westerners are still only tolerated.

Cons:- TINY, single person, reservation-based gym with only a bike, an elyptical, and broken all-in-one unit, which is hazardous to physical safety. Since this is a business gym, all key times are booked by business travelers. Each reservation is only 45 mins long, any infraction of duration limits will land you very nasty looks from the lobby staff and a phone call to the gym room (a repurposed bedroom) to hurry back down. The room can only be opened by the hotel gym key, which is handed out upon reservation and returned when complete. There is no excuse for this hotel to skimp in this amenity considering dozens of other hotels around this area having better facilities.- Room service ends early in the evening. You better get food prior to arriving at the hotel if your flight lands in late.Pros:- Excellent location, near Shimbashi and Oeno train stations, convenient walk along upper and lower walkways accessible next to the hotel- Great views of Tokyo tower- Modern and sleek, artistic feel- Clean but tiny rooms, bathroom is small but shower head and toiletries are offered.- Hotel staff can speak English.

The overall experience of the Park Hotel Tokyo is one of ease and understatement. I was traveling on business and the hotel was great and easily accessible to several areas of the city. The artists floor, hotel room and lounge were lovely and offered quiet space to work and enjoy the morning views of the city. The hotel is 1 mile away from the Imperial Palace which made it is easy to go for early morning scenic runs. The artist rooms at the hotel are beautiful and I very much enjoyed mine. The main lounge and restaurant are also great for a business lunch or evening meeting at the bar over a drink. I highly recommend the hotel. The staff is great and very helpful.

Entering the building about 7.30pm after a long flight we i was looking at a empty area with a escalator to another empty floor. thinking the taxi had dropped us off at the wrong building, only to be told by departing hotel guest to go through a door in the corner to a escalator to get to the reception on the 25th floor. On finding the reception we were delt with efficiently and to shown to our room.The view was fantastic as you would expect on the 26th floor looking at the Tokyo Tower with mount Fuji in the background. The room was small as expected in Japan, kept very clean by a pleasant staff. the restaurant food was a gamble, ordered wagyu beef, first was good we didn't return after the second identical dish as I nearly asked for a steak knife, this steak the knife should slide easily through it.

We initially booked this hotel only for two days but when we arrived we thought that the location and the quality of the hotel were excellent for our one week stay in Tokyo. The hotel's service is good and the rooms are well equipped. We stayed at the 31st floor which has a small complimentary lounge access. The hotel is well connected to the Shiodome offices and to Shimbasi station. It also connects to the metro line which goes directly to Big Sight, the big expo center. it is walking distance from the fish market and the Shimbashi food area. The price is reasonable compared to some of the larger chain hotels.

My family and I have visited Tokyo 3 times in the last 5years and each time we stayed at Park Hotel Tokyo. We've never stayed anywhere else.The regular rooms are slightly bigger than what you'd expect for a Japan hotel room. Amenities are complete, beds are comfortable, housekeeping is also great! Since hotel starts on the 25th floor, the views from the room are always very good (the rooms facing Tokyo Tower cost a bit more). Oh, and the wifi signal is consistent and strong.Staff service is always above par. English is widely spoken by Reception, Concierge and Bell Service so arrangements can easily be made with them. On our last day in Tokyo last 04March 2017, our flight was very late at night and our Airport Limousine Bus was at 9:25pm. Since check-out is standard at 12noon, we had our bags stored at Bell Service. At 9pm, we claimed our bags, intending to go down to the first floor entrance to wait for the bus. Bell Service told us to stay comfortable at the Lobby and at 9:15pm, he accompanied us with our bags to the first floor entrance, waited with us for the bus to arrive and saw us off. That's service!Breakfast is not fantastic, tho (for us at least) but there's a Family Mart in the Basement. The area is quiet at night, away from the bustle of places like Shibuya and Shinjuku, but getting around is not a problem. The Oedo Line's Shiodome subway station is right under the hotel. The Yurikamome line has a station just outside the 3rd floor walkway. Shimbashi Station is 8-10 leisurely minutes away, via the Yukikamome Line walkway, if you want to catch the JR Yamanote. And Ginza is a very short walk from the hotel! Location, location, location!And the view from the Lobby's wide windows? Tokyo Tower lit up at night is always beautiful; the lighting changes every couple of days so it's always a treat to see it. And on the morning of 03March, Mount Fuji could be seen crisp and clear beyond the Tokyo Tower.I recommend making your booking directly with the hotel on their website, where they offer promos. It's always easier if you need to make changes to your arrangement when you deal directly with the hotel; rather than booking thru one of the online hotel booking sites.I always tell my friends about Park Hotel Tokyo. It may be bit pricey for someone on a budget but, let me tell you, it is all worth it!Do I want to try another hotel? I've stayed elsewhere before but have not strayed since we discovered Park Hotel Tokyo. Will I stay here again? With 100% certainty, yes, I will.

first...the view to Tokyo Tower is fantastic and make you stick to the room window for a long time. The staff are very friendly, helpful and importantly English level is good. Location got nothing to complain. With door stop to/from the airport, stations to most Tokyo rail lines. You can simply go everywhere will short time of transportation.

If you're looking for a clean, modern and attentive hotel that's aesthetically above the rest, this is the place. Located within a stone's throw of the JR loop line's Shimbashi Stn and practically right on top of the Oedo subway Stn which also loops through the city, this palace is very convenient. Most of my business over the years was in Shinjuku so I frequented the Hilton, Hyatt and Keio hotels. Now my business is in the Toranomon/Roppongi area. I last stayed at the Okura. Lovely old hotel which brought back many memories, one of my old boss and professor who took me and my girl friend to lunch there in the 80's. First time I had gazpacho. The Okura is great, big rooms, great staff, great restaurants and literally a 5 minute walk from my company's Tokyo office. It's pricey and after decades of visiting and living in Japan, I wanted to branch out. What caught my attention about the Park Hotel is its art rooms. Why stay in a regular hotel when you can get uniquely designed and painted rooms done by individual artists? The room size is a little narrower than "western" standards but ample by Japanese standards. I live in a McMansion at home and have no problem with the Park Hotel's room size. Great view of Shimbashi Stn and the Shinkansen. A central atrium gives a sense of expanse and openness. It's distinctively decorated from the lobby on the 25th floor on up. I love it here. Even though it's a 25 minute walk from my office, I prefer this to the Okura and plan to make it my go-to hotel from now on. The only other hotel in the city that interests me like this is the Park Hyatt in Shinjuku which is 2-3 times the price without the individual art.

Again I stayed at the Park Hotel Tokyo (like I did during the last 4 years) for a week during the Smart Energy Week, a fair about renewable energy technologies, which always takes place end of February.This time I had selected a room without Tokyo Tower view as as had enjooyed it already a couple of times and wanted to save money now.Now I had a view on Shinmbashi station which is of course not so nice. Ok, as I am at the hotel for sleeping purposes, it does not play that important role. But as the first view of the day there are nicer alternatives. One should also mention that around 5 am the trains start there daily operation (which stops again round midnight). So from that moment on you will hear the trains getting in and out the station, or the Shinkansen passing by. It is not so loud so that you wouldn't be able to sleep any more (windows are well protecting from noise). But when stay awake due to jet lag, you will notice that. However, it did not disturb too much.Again I would like to spend some words on the breakfast. This is getting more and more annyoing. Every year and every morning the same things to eat. Costing 2.400 Yen one would expect more variations. One sort of cheese and sausage, the same every day. And still this old toaster which needs 5 minutes or more to bring some brown colour on the bread. Why can't they invest in a newer, more powerful one? And one toaster only! That might take 15 minuets before you have your bread toasted. Another point: although at least 5 waiters run around, they never notice you when you want to have new coffee. Maybe I should dance on the table next time.My recommendation: if breakfast is important for you, go to the Royal Park Shiodome which is just on the other side of the street. Or have breakfast outside. But apart from that, the hotel is still worth a high recommendation.

Great location offering an incredible view of Tokyo. Easy walking distance to fish market, Ginza and Imperial Palace and easy travelling to other areas via the two metro stations (Shiodome and Shimbashi)

The Park Hotel Tokyo is a great hotel for the price you pay. The convenience of having two stations (Shiodome and Shimbashi) was invaluable in getting around Tokyo. Also the location of the hotel is central to most well known places in Tokyo (Ginza, Tokyo Tower, Odaiba, Tsukiji Fish Market, Asakusa, all the districts of tokyo, etc...). As for the hotel and it's accommodations, the staff was extremely warm and helpful. Their hospitality and attention to detail was present everywhere in the hotel. Would recommend this hotel for those wanting a 5 star hotel experience but not at the price.

We loved our stay at the Park Hotel Tokyo. For such a large city, it is hard to say what is and isn't a convenient location - but Park hotel is above the Shiodome station and near to Shimbashi. If you take Narita express from the airport to Tokyo station it is an inexpensive taxi ride or 2 subway stops away; they also have an airport bus but we did not use it. It is very near to the Ginza district which has some of the best shops and restaurants. It is also near to the Tsukiji fish market. Before our arrival the concierge booked us several dinner reservations at high end restaurants, most of which were lovely. Upon arrival we chose to upgrade to the Tokyo Tower view. Worth it! Our floor had a lounge with breakfast offerings and a floor specific concierge service which was a nice touch. The staff are incredible. Room service was great. Room was large (we had the regular size one) and spotlessly clean. Wifi worked perfectly. The art around the lobby and lounge were a nice touch. There was a piece I wanted to buy, but it was already sold. We would recommend Park Hotel to anyone.

We stayed here for 4 nights whilst touring Tokyo It was a good 15 min walk to the subway. The airport bus stopped here.The western breakfast was not good the eggs were disgusting and croissants were very dry! We saw locals having afternoon. So thought we would have some but told you had to order 24 hrs previously !

Location-wise, the hotel is just perfect. It's connected to Shiodome station (though be warned if you're bringing big luggages as you have to go up and down some flights of stairs), Yurikamome line on the 3rd floor, and Shimbashi station is just a walk away. Also, a little stroll down a few blocks will get you to Ginza.We arrived pretty early after a 2ish hours trip on the Shinkansen. The staffs are really helpful with checking in, and much to my surprise they even have prepared 1 room out of the 2 we reserved to be available early before checking-in time. This was a really sweet gesture as we could freshen up and all.The room is decent-sized, not too small, and very comfortable. Beds and pillows are just perfect, and bathroom amenities are also amazing. What's more was that the hotel is currently showcasing very lovely artworks, and they even offer an upgrade to artist rooms. Though I didn't get to try the upgrade, the artworks showcased was very aesthetically pleasing.Also, the fact that the Airport Limousine service is available right on the doorstep makes it even better--saved us the hassle of changing train lanes et al. Reservation was fairly simple and quick, many thanks to the very attentive and helpful staffs.Safe to say, I really enjoyed and appreciated my stay here and the only down side is that I didn't get to stay longer!Really looking forward to staying here again when the opportunity arises.

We stayed at the Park Hotel in August and were very content with our stay. The service is outstanding, and the views were phenomenal. We were right above the train station and could walk to many sights and areas within Tokyo. The room was decently sized for Tokyo standards, and the staff were extremely helpful. We would recommend this hotel to first time Tokyo travelers!

We debated between The Park and The Royal Park. In the end we went with The Park because some people on TripAdvisor had said it was more convenient to restaurants and the transit. Well, they are literally connected by a walkway and they are both conveniently located.The staff at the front desk, concierge and the bell hops were great. There was always somebody to help us with reservations or finding a location.Our room was compact but worked well and was quiet, just like we wanted. The pillows took a little getting used to compared to our North American style.The breakfast was not included but factoring it in made it the same price as the Royal Park. It was really good. There was a good assortment of fruit and juices. There were scrambled eggs and bacon or sausages with some veggies. One morning we asked for fried eggs and they provided them to perfection. There a small but nice selection of pastries as well. We had many cups of good hot coffee and felt ready to start the day.All in all we were happy with the whole experience and would probably stay again, if the price were the same.

JR and Metro station is in nearby distance. Room is clean (if offer free bottle water will be nicer), the Tokyo Tower View from day to night is terrific awesome!!! There is coin laundry, very convenient for a mom travelling with two kids.

This hotel is conveniently located. I love the simple contemporary decor together with wonderful city views at the lobby as well as in the rooms. However, the stand out about this hotel has to be its service. All the staff I spoke to were well equipped to handle guests requests and they are able to rotate around without fuss due to a well trained understanding of all the guests' needs. As my wife was not well, I left a series of instructions to the front desk/concierge staff who diligently followed through with them all. The same staff also had a strong knowledge of all surrounding amenities outside the hotel and named me a few pharmacies located nearby by drawing them out on a map. The only thing they could probably improve on is the lunch options and quality. It is a bit underwhelming given that they have such an awesome lobby to have lunch in.

Our room was on 34th floor and had a magnificent view. Spacious and clean with free wifi. Staff are lovely and friendly and breakfasts was great all you need to start your day. We could see Mount Fuji from lobby window so clearly. Situation is great too with plenty to see i.e. Park and clock, we also went for evening walks. Can recommend this hotel. We had a great stay our thanks to all staff.

Park Hotel Tokyo was our 3rd Hotel during our Japan Trip and it was the nicest and spacious hotel we ever had. Viewing Tokyo Tower from the room at night was a memorable memory and Breakfast was great. Tokyo -> We will be back :)

The location is nice, as it's very easy to jump on the subway. I was a little surprised that in a hotel where everyone speaks some english there wasn't one english TV channel. Room was small but plenty adequate and what we were expecting.

Really well located and good value. Rooms are well equipped, and breakfast covers most tastes. Being by Shimbashi station gives good access to rail networks, and the famous Ginza shopping district. Staff are always helpful.
user_name:
Peter B
Ardleigh, null, United Kingdom

review_body: It's walking distance to Ginza and you have access to all of the subway and above ground trains outside the front door of the hotel. Get the room with the Tokyo Tower view, it's well worth it. Waking up to that with Mt. Fuji behind it is a beautiful way to start any day!

I stayed for three nights at the Park Hotel in Minato. It is convenient for three stations and the Ginza district. The hotel starts on the 25th floor. The reception has fantastic views of Mount Fuji. The staff were excellent. The rooms are really nice. All rooms are compact but this room was really nicely appointed. Breakfast was very good. There was a wide variety on the buffet - Japanese and international. I will definitely stay at the Park Hotel when I next visit Tokyo.

We stayed in the Park hotel for 3 nights. Lovely staff, all spoke English, great concierge who did show bookings for us, immaculate rooms very well stocked with toiletries; great experience, we can thoroughly recommend this hotel.

Great hotel that doesn´t cost a fortune( but not cheap). Good location and good sized rooms. Actually not much to complain about. Breakfast and eating is however a bit to expensive at the hotel. The surroundings of this place are also nice.

We picked this hotel due to it's front door arrival by the Limousine Bus. Every time in Tokyo we always got headaches using the train system. So this time we elected to pick a hotel that was serviced by the Limousine bus directly to/from the airport. The hotel is located in a quiet business district. Not much directly around the hotel but if you walk a few blocks you will be in Ginza. The hotel is suited for business travelers. We noticed every guest in the hotel was there for business. During breakfast we were the only ones eating not in business suits taking about electronic brands. The fish market is walking distance from this hotel. However lacking in sense of direction we took ubers everywhere. Uber to Fish Market, Tokyo Tower, Ginza was roughly $10USD each trip each way. The lobby has a breathtaking view of entire Tokyo. We originally had a standard room but the lobby view sold us to upgrade our room to the tower view. It was an extra $15 a night and well worth it. The rooms are standard Asian size small . Which I am not sure why people complain in other reviews. That is the standard in all of Asia, it must be their first time here. Small but efficient and very modern, all toiletries included so leave your razor at home. Also has the standard Japanese modern butt warmer, sprayer toilet. Breakfast is 25$ USD per person every morning . You can pay at check in or just bill it to your room . The breakfast selection was tiny and highly over priced. I understand $25 for breakfast if the buffet is extensive. However there was a little of fresh fruit, breads, and some eggs, salad, and soup. Since the hotel doesn't have many close restaurants nearby we just sucked it up and ate at the hotel. There is a pastry/coffee shop on the first floor of the building. So if you are a light breakfast eater that can be an option. Another perk was we were able to book our limo bus tickets back to the airport with the hotel concierge. (Super Convenient) This hotel truly has some of the sweetest people who work there. Everyone was so helpful and attentive. Already booked again for our return trip to Tokyo in a few months.

So the rooms are a little small by some standards, but that is more than made up for by the amenities and location. Close a number of train lines so very handy for getting around, the hotel starts on the 25th floor and works its way up. We were on the 33rd floor with a stunning view to Mt Fuji. The rooms are modern and clean, the bed firm and comfortable and the shower hot! The people who work at the hotel are wonderful too. A great spot to base yourself in Tokyo

Loved our stay here. The staff are very attentive and kind. Stunning hotel lobby and restaurant area. Amazing bar. The bar manager Koji Nammoku made our entire stay, what an amazing and kind man he is. Always made us feel very welcome and we were sad when we had to leave. The hotel is in an excellent location. Train station right next door and Ginza shopping district just 5 minutes away! Can't wait to make it back here later this year.

Our deciding factor to stay here was that the hotel offers a triple room which was ideal for us with a young family, the children top and tailed so we only needed one room rather than two. It is a great location to be able to walk to varied dining options, JR and Metro connections, Tsukiji Fish Market and Ginza for shopping. Also to the nearby Carreta which has good dining options, especially on the 57th floor where you get great views of Tokyo Bay. The service was rather slow on reception and concierge, but in the end we did get a good dinner recommendation. Spa is a nice gesture, but not worth it if you are looking for a remedial type massage which we wanted after a week on the snow. The airport express shuttle bus does a pick up from here, which was very convenient and a speedy, relaxing journey straight to our terminal. This hotel did exactly what we needed it to do - gave us a comfortable, convenient stay in Tokyo. It was clean and our room was a good size. It does not attempt to be anything other than a 4 star city hotel, if you like bells and whistles then go to for the Park Hyatt. I have stayed in both and would recommend both depending on the situation, this trip, this hotel was the right choice.

The Park Hotel in Tokyo is in one of the best locations in Tokyo. Lots of JR (train) and MTR (metro) access just minutes away and a short walk to Shimbashi and Ginza. I've been visiting Tokyo for over a decade and this is, by far, my favorite place to stay. Very clean, professionally run, great views of Tokyo Tower (and when visible, Mt Fuji).

I stayed at the Park Hotel with my husband in April 2016 - I was looking for something reasonably priced and close to subway lines - this place fit the bill perfectly. We booked one of the artist rooms and got the geisha room which was great. The room wasn't overly large, but it had a great view and the hotel design which allowed you to look down on the gorgeous lobby was great. The artwork in the lobby was amazing - I really wanted to buy some pieces but wasn't sure how I would get them home! This hotel is within walking distance of Ginza/fish market and super close to multiple subway lines. The concierge was really helpful and booked us a last minute sushi reservation at Kyubey - which was absolutely amazing.
user_name:
RalphCatNY
New York City, New York

review_body: Glourious hotel, very new and modern. Have been to tokyo and this time spent a little bit extra this time, our last tokyo hotel had a hatch sized window which is depressing considering what a great view was outside. we chose the tokyo tower view and its worth the extra few yen we thought. The rooms are roomie for tokyo, good sized (similar to European sized rooms) . very clean and cleaned daily.The staff are excellent, couldnt do enough for us, very pleasant to deal with and have a excellent help desk with a good speaking staff remember, she even rang a specific car company for me and arranged everything for me. Located 1min walk to the nearest metro(this one easily brings you to odaiba), but the bigger more main station is about 5 mins walk. but can be accessed underground from the hotel. overall an excellent hotel and would definetly stay again.

I stayed here for a few days in October for a business trip. From the concierge to the bell service, the service was great - everyone was courteous. The rooms are small, which is not unusual for Tokyo. One thing though - I'm not sure if it's an old hotel or what but the rooms smelled a bit... stale (for a lack of a better term). I thought it was just my room but went into my colleagues' rooms and it smelled the same. I wonder if it'll be better to invest in some air freshening? Also, make sure you "sign up" for a slot at the gym, (which no one told me about). AND - also make sure you set aside some time to get a taxi. The hotel is on the upper floors of the building so you can't just go out the lobby to grab a cab.

Great hotel in great location. I stay for a week in a spacious room with rounded panoramic window. The room start from 26th to 34th floor and the lobby is in 25th. They have 2 laundry machines for guest in 26th floor.

The Park Hotel is mid-way through a project to create art rooms on the 31st floor - commissioning famous and up-and-coming artists to create truly one-of-a-kind rooms. It's a great idea and worth the small extra amount. The 31st also provides access to a VIP lounge.There's also an amazing panoramic view of the Tokyo Tower (and Mount Fuji, if you're lucky) from reception.

After a somewhat confusing morning trying to find the hotel (it's up on the 25th floor of a building) I was greeted with nothing but professionalism. The staff were all great and helpful and the rooms, although small and a little dated, were clean and comfortable. I've read in some of the other reviews of people saying they couldn't sleep because of the noise? I must have been in one of the quietest rooms i've ever stayed in! The food in the lounge was just delicious, although if you are having breakfast, the Japanese breakfast is much nicer than the 'western' one, and the location, once you have an understanding of your surroundings and how to get from A-B, was really convenient. Also the view is really special. I will certainly stay again.

We have just enjoyed three nights at the Park Hotel, we are repeat visitors having stayed last year. If you are willing to pay a bit extra the Tokyo Tower view King rooms are worthwhile. Location of the hotel is a real plus with easy access to the monorail from Haneda airport (800m) and being literally on top of Shiodome station and 10 mins from Shimbashi getting around Tokyo is a breeze. There is a family mart on level B1 and the Excelsior coffee shop 3 mins away on level 3 serves a great coffee and breakfast so if you don't want to eat in there are some great options nearby. Service is always outstanding, certainly recommend and will stay there again.

Spent 7 nights in two rooms at the Park Hotel with family of 2+3. No adjoining rooms but they were able to accomodate us with rooms next to each other. The lobby is on the 25th floor and on a clear day the view out to Mt. Fuji is spectacular. The concierges and bell hops were all very helpful with translating our English requests for restaurant reservations and suggestions and all the directions needed for subway/JR/taxi rides. Expensive but worth it for some first-timers in Tokyo.

Park Hotel occupies the 25th floor and above of the Shiodome Media Tower with superb views of Tokyo. You can see the Tokyo Tower and Mt Fuji from the 25th floor reception lobby. The lifts from B2 and 1st floor are fast and efficient. The rooms are slightly small but well-equipped and very clean and comfortable. My request for firmer pillows was quickly met. There was minimal noise from adjacent rooms. Location wise, it is adjacent to the Toei Oedo line Shiodome station and within 5 to 10 minutes walk of the JR Shimbashi and Tokyo Metro stations, making for good transport links to the rest of Tokyo. It is just 20 minutes walk from the boundary of Ginza. There are many eateries nearby, some most serving good and reasonably priced good. Two Hanamasa supermarkets are within walking distance (10-20 minutes). Hanamasa cater mainly to the catering trade and the range is slightly limited but the prices are very competitive.The Narita and Haneda Airport Limousine stops directly in front of this hotel.

This is a relatively convenient mid to upscale hotel aimed at business and tourist travellers seeking a slightly different experience. Don't confuse it with the nearby Royal Park Hotel which is slightly more upscale with at least one star more of facilities. Many hotels design their shop front to be their best feature and this is no different. The lobby and (presumably) the artists rooms look great. But the hotel is flawed despite it's great views starting at the 25th floor of the media tower. It really is a budget hotel dressed up.We found:- the rooms to be small (even for Tokyo) - although not uncomfortably small.- the bathrooms to be at least one or two grades below the room. The towels were mini sized.- the pillows were lumpy and crackled a bit when you moved which was off-putting to say the least.- the noise in one room (we had 3) to be intolerable. Surprisingly the noise from the train station directly below came straight into one room making it VERY NOISY. So much so that the occupants of that room had to use headphones to get to sleep! Of the 3 rooms only the room facing the train station directly suffered.- check in was slow (not helped by the fact that the booking was messed up by them)- the rooms to be overpriced by comparison with other similar hotels (and that is without staying in the artist rooms)The two best features of this hotel are the views and the location. Note that while it is situated virtually on a train station the underground walk is quite lengthy with many up and downs and may not suit people with lots of luggage or mobility issues.

Stayed here Jan 2017. Customer service was exceptional from the moment we arrived. Reception is located on level 25 which is a little odd and can be a bit annoying always getting two lifts but thats minor. We stayed in a corner room with an exceptional view of Tokyo. I imagine most rooms would have excellent views as it begins on level 26. Rooms are small, but standard for Japan. Bathrooms are probably the only let down, just a little bit tired and need an overhaul. You can pay extra for what they call an 'art room'. Same as the others but is finished in murals by local artists. If that is something that excites you, then go for it. However personally wouldn't spend the extra. The buffet was about 2000 per person and food was great, plenty of variety and constantly refilled. Accessing the hotel is easy from Narita, there is a shuttle bus both ways which will cost 3000yen per person. All in all its a good hotel, great service, good location and honest price.

Great location. Located very near to train stations and one can walk to these train stations via connected underpass without being exposed to the elements/weather.As this is the CBD, be prepared for the massive crowd in the morning and evenings.Plenty of food places, cafes and restaurants in the area. There is a convenience store in the 2nd basement floor. Hotel is situated in the higher levels of an office building in the CBD area. Room is quiet, and if you are staying in rooms facing the tokyo tower, the views are amazing. bed is comfortable and air conditioning/heater is just right.The room is however quite small - as with most tokyo hotels - so you have to make do with the size. Also, the washroom had a weird stench.Service was however excellent.All in all, I highly recommend a stay in the hotel.

We stayed here on our last night in Japan. I chose this hotel for its proximity to Tokyo Station (where we arrived from Kyoto) and for the Airport Limo bus to Narita. But other aspects of the hotel surprised us and exceeded our expectations.It was a bit tricky finding the correct exit from Shimbashi station, in spite of the hotel's detailed directions on its website, but once we did, we reached the hotel quickly and easily. The walkway there amid the skyscrapers with the gardens and unusual clock was quite interesting. Then you take the elevator to the hotel's amazing lobby--be sure to wander around and investigate the art displayed around the lobby and lounge (much of it is for sale!). Like many Japanese hotel rooms, our rooms were compact but well-organized twin rooms, with incredible city views overlooking the Tokyo Tower and Mount Fuji! We could also watch commuter and bullet trains on the tracks far below. All the usual amenities (although we only discovered the robes in a drawer the next morning). We made reservations for dinner in the hotel's French bistro restaurant, which was stellar. One of the best meals during our two weeks in Japan. Highly recommend the venison and Wagyu beef. Slight mixup over breakfast. I didn't think breakfast was included in our room rate, yet we were given three vouchers for breakfast, so I thought perhaps breakfast was included after all. Two of us had breakfast. When we checked out, we were charged for three breakfasts. Don't know why we received vouchers if we had to pay for breakfast, or why we were charged for my son, who didn't have breakfast. We were short on time at checkout so I opted not to pursue it. But if you unexpectedly receive vouchers, do ask how they work. The breakfast buffet was very good, by the way.The staff took our bags down to the airport bus for us and made sure we and the bags got on the bus. Easy ride (past Disney Tokyo) to Narita. The location near Shimbashi Station was easy for getting to Shibuya and the sumo wrestling hall. The art work in the hotel (even in its smoking room) is outstanding. My son used the self-service laundry room with great results. Highly recommend, and I would stay here again.

We spent 8 nights at the Park Hotel in a standard Queen size room. The room was very well presented and maintained. It was excellent value for the discount rate we paid through Hotels.com. We would have preferred a bit more space and a more luxurious bathroom but those things come at a cost in Tokyo and we were very happy with the hotel in general. The location is outstanding as you have easy access to the Toei Oedo subway as well as JR Shinbashi station being within a 10 minute walk through the underground passageway. We visit Tokyo regularly and were surprised by the convenience of staying in Shiodome. You can walk to Ginza in 15 minutes, get to Tokyo station within a couple of stops for any Shinkansen or express train connections and easily access anywhere in Tokyo by train. There are lots of small cafes and restaurants nearby if needed, including an Excelsior Cafe in the Pedi building which serves good espresso/cappuccino as part of their morning breakfast set. Another pleasant surprise was a picture window view of Mount Fuji from the lobby each morning - one of the bonuses of visiting Japan in winter! We would stay at the Park Hotel again.

This hotel in the shiodome district is perfectly located near train stations that go in several directions. The breakfast is excellent, staff very friendly and attentive. The rooms were spacious as I know rooms in Tokyo can be very small. I would recommend this hotel if staying in Tokyo.

Rooms were much more spacious than I thought - I was used to HONG KONG room sizes , but these were slighter larger. Best to book the room w TOYKO tower view - it comes w free breakfast ... gourmet breakfast - not buffet style , but one where they make the dish for you ( mainly western food- toasted French style panini & fresh Berry frappe made on the spot ) . Did I mention you get the view of Tokyo city while you consume your hot breakfast ? Service is excellent from check in to room service

Park hotel has alway been among one of my favourite choice under my booking list either for business or leisure in Tokyo!! In my opinion, it definitely deserves to be included on 2016 Michelin Guide on Tokyo Hotel List in Black 3 Pts category, it is fair to say that its hotel facilities are probably on par with that of Southern Century, lower than Hyatt Regency & Marunouchi Hotel, but if judging by the level of customer service experience & value for money based on my own experience over the years, I would say Park Hotel would definitely over and above most of its peers in the Black 3 category(exclude Ryumeikan Ochanomizu which I never had chance to stay)! Please Keep it up with all the good work and level of services, and hope to see you on the list of Red 3pts or even Black 4pts category soon!

Visitors arriving in Tokyo Haneda will find the convenience of having a direct train service to the hotel invaluable. The view from the rooms is excellent as is the service. Rooms are a bit small but they're ok by Tokyo standards.

Looked for a reasonably priced hotel in tokyo with a great location and we found it in the Park Hotel Tokyo (not the royal park hotel).We had a corner King room with amazing views to Mt Fuji and the Tokyo tower and city skyline. You have the shimodone subway station right below the building and a short walk to Shimbashi station. So you can get anywhere you want in Tokyo from here. Room very comfortable and good sized. The king bed was enormous and very comfortable. Staff were helpful and competent in English. Highly recommend.

Park Hotel Tokyo is super fun. Get an art room and enjoy how it is appointed and read about the artist who redid the room. The front desk and concierge are all great. The concierge booked some restaurants for us to eat and gave us some great printouts on how to find the places. The hotel can offer some nice views of Tokyo Tower if you're lucky enough to get that view. It's quite close to the station, but it's somewhat hard to get to unless you know the system of tunnels and cat walks...so get some exact directions if you're coming from the JR.

Really nice hotel in the Shiodome district - handy for the main Tokyo station and the Imperial Palace. very nice rooms - some with view of the Tokyo tower. we ate several times at the restaurants which were very good as well. Staff really helpful and friendly

Great professional staff that will go out of their way to make your stay a special one. Rooms are decent and location is good with the Shimbashi and Shiodome stations around the corner. Great views from the rooms as well!

We stayed here for 3 nights at the end of our 2 week Japan adventure. What a great choice - the hotel was much better than expected with a lovely ambience and excellent rooms. We booked triple room with our 10 year old son. The room was huge and had loads of space and amenities. The twin rooms are not as spacious. Staff were all brilliant and helpful (pretty much standard in all of Japan). Amazing views of Tokyo Tower and Mount Fuji at the reception desk on Level 25. Great options for supplies and food nearby. Also many train/subway stations nearby, so easy to get around. Fantastic way to end our trip - felt a little bit "spoilt" - everything a holiday should be right?!!! Only semi-weird aspect was that we were given pillows that felt as if they were filled with rice! Not the most comfortable as we weren't used to them.

This place felt like great value for the money! The hotel is nice, modern, and new. Some of the views are amazing. The rooms were small (normal for Japan) but definitely had enough space for two large suitcases and two people to navigate around each other. They were clean and had everything we needed. Location is very convenient for getting around - the hotel is walking distance (10 - 20 mins) to the Imperial Palace, Ginza, and the Tsukiji Market, and only a few minutes walk from a couple different stations (Shimbashi and Shiodome). The staff was friendly and helpful. My husband got sick while we were there, and they not only pointed us towards the nearest pharmacy, but also wrote a note in Japanese for the pharmacist so they could help us find the right medicine. They gave us some great restaurant recommendations too.

The hotel is in one of the best buildings in Tokyo and sits in a prime location. The hotel lobby is located at the 25th Floor, so even at the lobby, you can already have a good view of Tokyo.The closest train station is the Shiodome Station (Yarikumome Line), but this is also very near the Shimbashi Station, where the JR Lines pass through. So if you are using the JR lines or any other line, just stop by Shimbashi and walk through the elevated pathways going to the hotel. There is even an access point to the hotel through the 3rd level of the building.The Shiodome train station also has the train lines that goes to the Seaside Park (Daiba Station - where the Statue of Liberty and the Gundam Front is located), as well as the Tokyo Tower.The Hama Rikyu Park, one of the best parks in Tokyo is just walking distance from the hotel.Great place to stay if you ever visit Tokyo.

Had 2 rooms on about the 32nd floor, overlooking Caretta building. Double room and triple rooms were spacious and views just breathtaking. Hotel was clean and staff polite, efficient and friendly. Easy and convenient access via underground malls to Shiodome (5 mins) and Shimbashi stations (10 mins). Tons of restaurants outside Shiodome station, and under the tracks, packed with office workers in the early evenings.

Lovely location. We particularly selected this hotel for the beatifil tokyo tower view which we never grew tired of. The lovely is clean, staff is friendly, location is great especially for ginza and odaiba, room is tidy, and amenities are good too. You can't expect a large room because this is Tokyo, but it has all that you need. Gowns are in the drawer, room is made always nice & clean, and in the shiodome area there are many places to eat too. Go for a tokyo view - although lobby has great view too, it is uncomparable to the view you have when you are alone with your loved ones in your room.

This was the first stop on our Honeymoon, and we both agreed that this was the best hotel.We booked the corner king room with tokyo tower view and what a view it was. I could spend hours sitting and looking at that view. It doesn't matter what time it was, there was always something to view.The room was clean, fully stocked and came with the 'Tokyo' toilet.As for the service, the team was very welcoming and we enjoyed the breakfast.The hotel is well located and you can either choose to walk to many destinations like the palace, fish market or take the very affordable metro which is just outside the hotel. We didn't eat in the hotel but Tokyo has many places to eat which are affordable. One suggestion, take the tour to Mount Fuji which the hotel can organise.

Hotel location and amenities good , room comfortable and bathroom amenities really good. Convenient location to the station and subway . Really clean hotel and loved the views. The only downside was the restaurant staff looked tired perhaps as it was New Years but we just enjoyed the stay regardless.

Excellent location - right above Shiodome station & 5 minutes walk from Shinbashi Station, 10 minutes walk from Ginza or just 1 stop from the famous fish market. Direct metro goes to Ropinggi & Shinjuku.Room is small but very tidy and clean. View is great as Tokyo tower just nearby. Staff are friendly and helpful.Highly recommend

The Park Hotel is a well located comfortable Hotel., the rooms were more quite large for a Tokyo Hotel. I particularly liked the Art displayed around the Hotel, both the Artifacts from the museum and the modern Art. Our room had a fantastic view and from the lobby the view of Tokyo tower and Mt Fuji was amazing. We dined n the restaurant on Christmas day and the meal and service was outstanding. Will definitely re visit this Hotel

We had an excellent stay. Upon arrival we upgraded to a view with the Tokyo tower, the receptionist was swift and changed our booking immediately. We were given maps of the city and when inquired about the city transport card, we were given 2 that were left previously by other guests for this purpose, it even had some money left in it! We enjoyed our stay, but I must say it was also quite expensive. Would love to repeat in a future.
Great Location and Nice scenery from room, Tokyo tower and Mt.Fuji. Easy to access by the shiodome station and shimbashi station.Nice and friendly staffs.Some appliance is quite old but it's usable.

We really enjoyed our stay at the Park Hotel. The views are amazing and there is great service and design. We opted for the artist rooms and it really was a nice touch. Not all of them have views of Tokyo Tower and Mt Fuji though, so be sure to ask for a room with the view!

My wife and I stayed at this hotel for Christmas. It's modern and our room on the 29th floor had a fantastic of the city. The actual hotel starts on the 25th floor. We took the train from Narita airport direct to shiodome station. It was not the Narita express as that only goes to Tokyo station and you would need to change trains. That was something was wasn't looking forward to after a long flight and arriving at night. It's slower but gets you to the right station and then it's just a matter of following the signs to the Shiodome media tower were the hotel is. It's all under ground walkway and well signed in English. We validated our JR rail passes at the airport and got our train tickets there as well.

We stayed in this hotel for three nights in October. When you arrive you take a lift up to the lobby on a much higher floor. The lobby itself is very impressive and well decorated with excellent views of Tokyo. Before reading the rest - this hotel is pretty expensive and when I pay more I expect more in terms of service etc. As such, I felt let down by the Park Hotel Toyko several times throughout our trip. Check-in: We arrived fairly late (9:30pm) due to flight delays and the check-in process took quite a long time, however this was ok as we were amazed at the views behind the reception desk. We asked if there was anywhere we could get any food but were told no as the restaurants were now closed. There was no mention of the bar still being open and serving food, room service or suggestion of any of the nearby restaurants (in the basement and just outside the hotel. We were left to discover this ourselves on a quest for dinner. Rooms; Large with absolutely incredible views of the Kyoto Tower/Tokyo/Mount Fuji. Our room did smell a little bit musty. The bathroom was fine - a bit dated. We had one normal pillow and one beanbag style pillow which was very strange. Free wifi was good. Breakfast: There was a large buffet with a lot of choice of both western and Japanese food although a number of hot dishes were luke warm at best (and we came at different times on all 3 days). Getting attention to have more than one hot drink was quite difficultBar food: We ate here the first night and the food is expensive (standard bar food all £20-£30) but is very tasty. Service was excellent. Japanese restaurant: The food in this restaurant was very good but it is incredibly expensive and the a la carte menu portions are tiny. We left still hungry. Check-out - We had previously advised the hotel that we were four people with four large suitcases and we needed to go to the train station and asked if we needed to book a taxi and told no. On the morning, we were told no big taxis would be available for over an hour so we would need to take two taxis. The doorman who then helped with our bags then told the taxi driver to take us to the airport. Luckily we confirmed and corrected this. I don't know if this was a language barrier but this process was frustrating and left us annoyed at the hotel when leaving. Location: We thought this was a good location to explore Tokyo, however as mentioned above it would have been helpful for the hotel to provide maps/more details about the local area/restaurants to help guests.Overall this hotel could be excellent but we were left a bit disappointed.

The hotel is in s good spot in the Business district. Had a wonderful view, the hotel staff were always ready to help ( they lead us toward the BEST restaurants!) and Close to the train station. Highly recommend !

I enjoyed my stay at Park Hotel Tokyo. Staffs here are very professional. Room is clean and bed is comfortable. And the view from the lobby is fantastic; we can see Tokyo Tower which is really great. Hotel's location is very good, close to Shiodome station.

Front office very helpful, able to answer to our enquiries and needs, speaks good english. Room a bit small but good for Japan standard, we stayed at the highest floor with good view of the city. From front office on a good day you are able to see Mount Fuji. There is a dedicated lift from 25th floor to the subway which is very good should the weather is bad.
user_name:
Sui Weng F
Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia

review_body: This is a very good hotel in a nice location near all the services, food, train, subway...staff is nice and professional. It take 2-3 times walking around to get familiar with the area but after that it is easy!

Loved this hotel ! It was walkable to many sites and very convenient to shopping and restaurants (even some local choices at the lower level). I would have rated this a 5 star, however, the room was a bit small . Of course we were not in the room much so not a problem. The staff was so helpful and there to answer any questions at any time. The breakfast was amazing!

Our stay at Park Hotel could not have been better. I would have rated it a 5 star rating except the room was a bit small, however, I realize we were in a major city where rooms tend to be smaller. The staff was so helpful and efficient in every way. Breakfast was amazing with many choices. Good location for shopping and restaurants and even basically attached to a group of less expensive local choices for meals. Very convenient. Would definitely stay again.
very good location near the subway and walking distance to Ginza, luxury room toiletries and very clean. I can view the mount Fuji from my room fascinatingwalking distance to the tax free store DONKI

Great location Artists room lovely also spacious with a great view. Hotel foyer a little confused and busy. Would be better divided into reception and restaurant and lounge sections. Hotel starts on 24th floor so views are everywhere.

We hd great stay overall at park hotel Tokyo. Only blip was getting there from the train station.. Bit tricky if u dont know the way. Service was good. Its near Shiodome station. Rooms were lovely- opt for Tokyo tower view- u can see mount Fuji too!

Love this hotel -- from check-in to check-out, the staff were fast and efficient. The bathroom has all the amenities I needed for a brief stay in Tokyo. Although my room was pretty cramped, it has a spectacular view of Tokyo, the Tokyo Tower, and Mt Fuji. The only thing I'd suggest for management to consider is to have a directional sign on the first floor big enough for a tired and weary traveler could see immediately. It took me a while to figure out where to go when I entered Shiodome Media Tower. It was 11 pm and the ground floor lobby was poorly lit. Although I loved the room, the bed and pillows could be better. The pillows felt like sleeping on a bag of pebbles and the mattress felt old. If you want to splurge, the hotel has great restaurants. If you are on a budget, there are fast food and cheap ethnic restaurants located on the basement floor. Although it's quite a walk, the train station is also located on the basement floor. I love this hotel that will be my hotel when I visit my son who will start school in Tokyo soon.

Great hotel, fab location and amazing view! Must have a Tokyo tower view, the view is outstanding! Rooms all clean, right next to Shimbasi and Shidome stations so perfect location To get all around Tokyo.

Memorable stay in this hotel. The hotel is located between two metro stations, it is really convenience. Staffs are extremely helpful and nice, they offered excellent services. Hotel room is tidy and spacious, tower view is beautiful. Will come back soon.

We stayed here years ago and loved our visit so we decided to stay here again for our second trip to Tokyo. It is a little complicated to find from Shimbashi station but the instructions on the hotel website were pretty clear. The hotel is at the top of one of the high rise buildings in this area of modern office buildings. The views are great from all of the rooms and if you pay extra you can get views of the Tokyo Tower and Mt Fuji. It is close to Shimbashi and Shiodome stations and has lots of dining options in the nearby shopping malls as well as being close to Ginza and other options.Service is amazing and the rooms are very modern and nice. The beds are very good. Prices are much more expensive than when we first visited but good value for a downtown hotel.The Tokyo art fair was on during our visit and the hotel kindly provided one of the posters when we asked.A great location to stay in Tokyo.

Great location..and staff very helpful. Location very convenient to train station.Fish market..Ginza Front desk staff very friendly when I ask questions. Answer me very polite and smile.For breakfast selection not much but quality is good and fresh. Restaurants staff also very friendly.

just checked out of the Park Hotel in Tokyo , I feel like leaving home with only 3 nights here. Service is just impeccable , staff outstanding, rooms and accommodations superbe, well price , locations walk to train, subway, business, fish market, retail stores you can ask for more , I will return for sure just to great !!!!

My husband and I stayed here 3 years ago to celebrate our 10th wedding anniversary. This was one out of 3 hotels that we stayed throughout our one week stint in Tokyo.We booked a room with Tokyo Tower view and it was amazing! The room was very clean and the bed was comfortable. The bathroom amenities were replenished daily for each of us. They kept our luggages when we traveled out of Tokyo and even received our parcel on our behalf (we bought few things and got it delivered to our hotel) when we were away. In short, the customer service was top notch! As the hotel was also celebrated their 10th year anniversary when we were there, they gifted us their limited edition teddy bear which was for sale to us. It was a really nice gesture from them.Room tips: Room with Tokyo Tower view

Was a good size room. Bathroom was bigger than expected. Nice view from lobby and room.Near to train station and also walking distance to Ginza. Family mart was just downstairs and very convenient.Good to avoid peak hour travels on train

After over 14 hours of flying, was I ever glad I booked this hotel. There is a "limo bus" from Narita to the hotel that offers convenient and fairly quick access even with a few stops at major hotels along the way. But with baggage, much easier than trying a local train and subways, which would also be an option, because this hotel has quick access via connected tunnels to the subways and Shimbashi JR Train Station. This was a huge plus. I never had to fight traffic or crowds, other than those in the tunnels and on the subways. Needless to say, I could get anywhere in Tokyo after a short walk thru tunnels to the subway station. The hotel is simply beautiful. The lobby is located on the 19th floor and the rooms are on floors above that - I think up to floor 33. I had a deluxe room on the 25th floor with a stunning view of Tokyo Tower. Photo ops right out of my room window. The room was spotlessly clean and the bed exceedingly comfortable. The room was furnighed in modern and tasteful furniture and the bed was exceedingly comfortable. The bathroom was large and equipped with a combo shower/tub. I was fully expecting cramped quarters based on everything I heard about hotels in downtown Tokyo. Again, I had a deluxe room, so I imagine it was larger than standard rooms. The hotel had a great lounge on the lobby 19th floor and in addition to a well stocked bar (some very good Sake's BTW) offered great views of the city. There were also two very good restaurants on this floor and I had dinner in both of them. One was traditional Japanese fare and the other French cuisine. Both were excellent, although very pricey. Like all Japanese hotels, the staff were friendly and made me feel like an honored guest. In addition to normal concierge services, and they were extensive, they also offered baggage transfer services so I could avoid lugging baggage thru the tunnels and onto a train when traveling to my next destination. Although I was on vacation, this hotel would be perfect for a business traveler as well.

I stayed for 2 nights while on a short break to Tokyo. I had previously visited the hotel on another trip to eat at the excellent Hanasanshou restaurant.
