One of the few hotels we stayed in which had some self laundry services. Would highly recommend this hotel and would definitely stay here again.

Very good hotel, higher floors on a skyscraper building.Spectacular view.Very attentive staff, very discrete.Bathroom very well equipped, everything very good quality. Shower very strong.Pillow not so comfortable.

Stayed with family at this hotel during the Christmas period of 2015. We had a twin room and a triple room. Fantastic service provided by Hiroaki Ishii San of Room Division when checking in and out. The Reception of the hotel is on the 25th floor of the Shiodome Media Tower. Nearest subway is Shiodome station and Shimbashi station. Do not go to the ground floor, stop on the 3rd floor and use the pedestrian walkway to get to Ginza and Tsukiji in 10 mins. There are lots of restaurants and cafes in the nearby Caretta Shopping Mall and also the Shiodome City Centre. There is even a Ding Tai Fung if you are craving for some Chinese dumplings after all the sushi, tempura and ramen. We extended our check out time till 4pm for a very reasonable rate of Y1500 per hour. They came to our room to collect our luggage, kept it till the arrival time of our taxi to bring us to the airport. You just need to bring yourself to the first floor to wait for the taxi at the appointed time and your luggage appeared without any prompting. Very efficient service. Super clean rooms. Great amenities. I will definitely stay here on my next trip to Tokyo.

Only allow babies in cots up to 1 yr old. After that they "have to share your bed". Ridiculous rule and when we asked why this was the rule we were told "because it is the rules"...!!! Absurd and another example of how Tokyo is poorly prepared for international visitors for the Olympics. Room was clean and nice though.

The hotel is situated on the top floors of the Shiodome Media Tower. Check-in is on the 25th floor with rooms above the lobby level up to the 34th floor. Rooms are nicely laid out with very nice amenities.Good location to JR train station as well as being right on top of 3 different subway station and easy access.I might have given an excellent rating except they only have 2 restaurants which both need reservations and the 2 nights that I stayed there I was not able to eat dinner in the hotel (Saturday and Sunday). I was a disappointed in that I could not eat in the hotel. Also, breakfast is served in the lobby but again seating is quite limited. But the concierge was a great help in finding me an Italian Restaurant within a 10 minute walk from the hotel. It was located in another business tower up on the 41st floor with just fantastic views...Ar's Italian Cuisine.The staff were all very friendly and some spoke multiple languages including English, French, Spanish, and Chinese.

The first thing you should probably know is that this is not the posh Park Hyatt Hotel which was made famous by Bill Murray in "Lost in Translation". That's in the bustling Shinjuku area and is approximately five times more expensive than this hotel. If you're someone who thinks nothing of the price differential, then maybe we should go out sometime so you could put a ring on it. Otherwise, the Park Hotel is a smart, gorgeous accommodation in the Shiodome Media Tower occupying the 25th through 34th floors. My partner and I spent five nights here, and we thought it was a terrific deal for the bargain rate of $145 per night, tax included.First of all, the location is aces especially for a first-time visitor like my partner since it took us only ten minutes to walk to Tsukiji Market at an ungodly hour and only fifteen minutes to get to the heart of the Ginza at any time. Just a quick stroll on an elevated walkway with the oddball Hayao Miyazaki steam-punk clock along the way, the Shimbashi station is a major hub for many of the key train and subway lines including the all-important JR Yamamote line with Tokyo station just two stops away. Second, the room, while smallish, was not lacking for amenities including a most titillating toilet that hummed along with my euphoria.It also afforded a spectacular view that included Tokyo Tower brightly lit at night. Third, the service here was impeccable with everyone able to speak English with amazing clarity. Most impressive was the concierge, a young woman who was raised in Sri Lanka, schooled in Canada and spoke English better than me. You won't get lost in translation here. She provided clear directions to anywhere in the city with ease and accommodated my last-minute requests for reservations at Kyubei Sushi and the Robot Restaurant. She rocked. Fourth, the hotel offers a convenient limousine bus back and forth from Narita Airport for just ￥3,100. Our vacation in Tokyo was made all the more pleasurable by the Park.

We enjoyed our stay at this well located hotel. The service was impressive, pleasant rooms with comfortable beds and large bathrooms. Additional bonus was a lovely morning breakfast, with many choices, a great way to start our day of sightseeing!

early check in late check outStaff friendly phone call for asking any help for propose after we check insnack for check outtower view room is so so nicelarge roomBut the hotel is a bit far from the station

Simply the best place to stay at Tokyo. Worth every penny. Top class service, knowledgeable and friendly staff, superb food, convenient location and excellent room with a breathtaking view. Will choose to stay here again on our next trip.

Our first impression of this hotel was great - our flight arrived into Tokyo early in the morning. We arrived at the hotel at around 9am expecting to have to leave our bags there until later. However, we were delighted after a long flight to find that our room was almost ready. In fact, they let us check in and have our room key at around 9.30am. Perfect!The room was a good size and we had a great view of the city. Breakfasts were also good - efficient and with a good selection.We re-checked into the hotel at the end of our Japan holiday. We had an issue with the fact that we'd paid for breakfast the following morning but our airport pick-up was booked before breakfast opened. It wasn't easily resolved at the front desk but once we spoke to the manager, he made sure everything went smoothly the next morning and we were able to have a full breakfast before leaving for the airport.Overall, we were pleased with this hotel, including it's handy location.

I only stayed here for 1 night as I wanted to stay at a hotel that was within walking distance to Tsukiji fish market since I wanted to get up really early and didn't want to have to catch the train to the market. I booked the Tokyo Tower view room and it was definitely worth paying a little extra for. The view is amazing! Easy connections to trains as well.

We spent 3 nights in the Park Hotel (corner king room). The building is in an excellent location very close to the rail lines. The room came with a spectacular view of the city and Mt. Fuji. It was very comfortable & quiet but the furniture seemed a few years old. The service, once you find/reach the 25th floor entrance, was excellent and it was easy to navigate with English. That being said, there were a couple things that were a bit surprising to see in a hotel in this tier. While the hotel provides Wifi - it is an insecure Wifi. I suppose most international or business travelers would use a VPN so perhaps it just makes things simpler..but still it seemed a little weird. Second, the breakfast room is very impressive and the coffee was delicious -- but the eggs, potatoes and breakfast meat were all a bit cold/not fresh. The fresh fruits and eastern options were great. Overall a very comfortable stay and I would recommend this hotel if staying in the Ginza neighborhood and traveling by rail.

We booked this hotel due to it's high ratings and we were not disappointed. The lobby is on the 25th floor of the building, with the hotel rooms above. We requested and paid extra for a room with a view. We had the view of the Tokyo tower and Mount Fuji. Amazing! We also paid extra to have breakfast included, and the buffet breakfast in the lobby restaurant was delicious. The coffee included with breakfast was some of the best coffee I've had in my life. We smoke and the hotel provided a smoking room off the lobby, decorated by a Japanese artist. Astounding. I could not stop looking at all the different drawings on the wall. For dinner on 2 nights, because it was so good, I had their salmon with a beautiful cream sauce with potato and vegetables. Delicious. Great staff as well. If I had to go back to Tokyo, this would be the place that I stayed. We also stayed at another hotel in Tokyo on the same trip, and it didn't even compare to this place.

It's an ongoing mystery to me why hotels that advertise rooms with two double beds refuse to allow families of four to use a single room. I had booked a single room at the Park Hotel for my family of four, arrived after the long trip from California, only to be told that four people in a single room was not permissible. After some negotiation, the hotel offered a suite on the top floor of the hotel that could accommodate four people, albeit for an additional amount per night.After that bad start, the rest of our stay was wonderful. Concierge services excellent, helping to get us around the city. Breakfast in the open air atrium was plentiful and, happily, served much more than a western breakfast. (Who travels to Japan and wants to eat eggs and bacon there?!)The view from the suite was amazing, overlooking the whole city. The hotel was filled with what seemed to us like business travelers but the vibe in the atrium was artsy. information abounded about art exhibitions, and the walls of the multi-story atrium were lit at night with projections of art.Hotel is located a short walk from the fish market and from the Ginza district. Easy to navigate, though one does need to figure out a bunch of third floor skyways or walkways. The street level sidewalks are a construction disaster zone.Overall I do recommend the hotel. Just be clear at booking how many people are welcome in any particular room.

Not a typical hotel. Big art theme. Impressive lobby. Rooms good but small as usual in Tokyo. Great view of Tokyo Tower and Mt Fuji. Excellent service from staff in particular the lobby restaurant from Lorenzo.

We have stayed at this hotel in November. We were so lucky to stay at 33 floor, second highest floor of this hotel. The Tokyo Tower with city was really beautiful. On a clear day, we saw Mt Fuji just behind the Tokyo Tower. It was amazing. The location is good and centrally located. We can travel to Shinjuku, Ropponggi, Ueno very easy and also our tour bus terminal just 3 mins by taxi from our hotel and cost JPY350. The best thing was the free wifi in our hotel room. Our room was artistic and beautiful. Overall, it is a very good hotel even the hotel room is smaller than most hotel I stayed before. I think it is big if compare to those small hotel in Shinjuku.

Good location ~ Airport Limousine Bus at doorstep. Nice eatery place at Shimbashi. Nearby to Metro station. Hotel room is clean and reasonably priced. Hotel staff is helpful and polite. A recommended hotel for family.

This hotel located in a very good spot, easily go to everywhere. Very high floor so you dont have to worry about the view.The staff very professional, polite and give good recommendation. The room is not outstanding but very clean and tidy. Definitely be back

The hotel location was perfect - close to almost everything (or if not easily accessible via subways/JR lines). The room was a bit small and the one that I stayed in, didn't have the power socket that support different kind of power plug. Other than that, it was perfect.

When entering the building, the hotel is on the 25th floor upwards. The reception area was a large airy atrium with a bar/restaurant in the middle. At present there is a bird theme, with hundreds of huge birds put all round the walls. We opted for a double tower view room. Room size was adequate with 2 huge windows overlooking Tokyo, truly breathtaking. The room was very clean, with a very good selection of eminities including toothbrush, hairbrush etc. breakfast although fairly expensive was very good. A large selection of Japanese and western dishes that could cater for everyone. The staff were very polite and very willing to help.The area around the hotel is very clean and very close proximity to lots of restaurants and about a 10 min walk to the high end shopping area of ginza.

first time to japan and this hotel was a fantastic choice. The staff were fantastic and welcoming. When we were due to check out they organised our luggage to be sent on to the next hotel ahead of us. the rooms were fantastic. i had a corner king room with views of tokyo tower and mount fuji and at night the view was amazing with all the lights. I recommend staying here. A review is hard to do the hotel the full praise it deserves, you need to experience it for yourself.

Their bathroom is verry clean and orderly.Their toilet bowls is modern/advance high tech because it;s being protected against bacteria supposed to be left by different clients who used it but with the apparatus being attach germs bacterias are eliminated so clients are being protected then???I like it verry much!!!!

For our last few days in Japan, we decided to stay at the Park Hotel, because of the good reviews, reasonable price, and proximity to the rail station. Although we did have about a 20 minute walk from the far end of Shimbashi Station to the hotel. But it is right above Shiodome Station, which is very convenient. Coming from Shimbashi Station, we followed the maps and finally found a side entrance to the hotel. We took the elevator up to the 25th floor and were able to check in a bit early. We booked the Tokyo Tower view as it wasn't too much more than a regular view room and we wanted our last view days in Japan to be memorable. The view was awesome, especially at night when the tower was lighted. We also enjoyed watching the subway cars and shinkansen going to and from Shimbashi Station on the tracks below. The room was an okay size, not the smallest but not the largest, of all the hotels we stayed at in Japan. But it was comfortable, clean, and cozy. There is also a good entrance to the hotel on the 3rd floor which we found after coming back from breakfast. We didn't eat any meals at the hotel so I can't comment on that. There's a Family Mart near the entrance on the way to Shiodome station. The staff also helped us with reservations for the airport limousine bus and held our luggage for us while we explored the area on our final day in Japan. A great stay and great lasting impression of our trip to Japan!

This hotel was great, handy location, friendly staff and magnificent views - been meaning to review for ages. Best part, I left a valuable piece of jewelry in the room safe - had just purchased it. Just a couple of emails and the jewelry was delivered to my home half a world away - honest and efficient. Would stay again if in that part of the world
user_name:
Brenda N
Christchurch, Canterbury, New Zealand

review_body: We had an excellent room on the 36th floor with a stunning view.The rooms are clean, if not big by European standards.A great place to stay, near public transport and many restaurants that can be explored on foot.The staff are all very helpful and full of useful advice.

I like boutique hotels. But I also like hotels to function, smoothly and efficiently. The Park Hotel certainly has style and an impressive reception area on the 25th floor with great city views - but it is far from perfect. I checked in on a Sunday at 4pm to be told the restaurant was full for the evening and the bar could only start serving a range of foods (beyond olives or a sandwich) from 5.30pm. Indeed the listless afternoon bar staff certainly looked like more training was needed to provide the more customary attentive Japanese customer service. Salvation, however, lies in the comfortable and spacious rooms - but which side of the building you are on is also important - views of Tokyo Tower and Mount Fuji on one side; office blocks, roads and trains on the other. It's worth asking! For dinner I recommend the Sky 47 restaurant in the Caretta Shiodome less than 5 mins walk away - very welcoming and food is readily served! One more tip - Don't rely on airport bus transfers from the hotel for early flights - the first pick-ups are after 8am. Quickest route to Haneda is a 12 minute walk to Hamamatsucho and then 20 minutes on the Monorail (490 yen), or if you have luggage you can join at Shimbashi next to the hotel for a 2 minute ride on the JR Yamanote line to Hamamatsucho before changing to the monorail (one ticket will connect all the way to the airport).

1. Enjoyed staff hospitality and service to guide travelling and sightseeing in Tokyo2. Wonderful toiletries from Thann- enjoyed the pleasurable scent of the products, esp the body milk3. Request to change my room type was promptly acceded to4. 3-7mins walk to shimbashi and shiodome stns. 12-15mins walk to tsukiji market.5. 400yen for self service laundry that takes only 100mins, including drying.

We spent a great time in the hotel. The Tokyo tower and city view from our room is amazing. The staffs are kind and polite. They helped us a lot. The hotel also has great location for communication. Our new first choice for accommodation in Tokyo.

Fantastic hotel. Great ransport links with Shindome and Shinbushi underground stations near by so have a few lines to choose from. Hotel staff were excellent and gave us extra care for our honeymoon. Room with a Tokyo Tower view was very impressive and had all the amenities you would expect from a high end 4 star hotel.

Park Hotel Tokyo is a modern hotel located between Ginza and Tsukiji market, right next to the lovely Hamarikyu Gardens. It's a five-minute walk from Shimbashi station and right next to Shiodome station, so it couldn't be more convenient. Though the immediate environs of the hotel are mostly modern office towers, you can walk to Ginza in 15 minutes. The rooms are small but clean and well-appointed, and very quiet, with stunning views. I didn't rely on the front desk staff too much, but in the interactions I did have with them, they were invariably helpful. There are excellent deals on longer stays--I would definitely stay here again.

We were so pleased with this hotel. There were 4 adults and 5 kids - ages 8 to 13. The triple rooms were large and although situated in a business district and positioned as an art hotel - it works very well for us.Accessibility via Shiodome and Shimbatsu subway nations meant it as very easy to get to places.

We stayed here in 11/15 and thought it was a very solid hotel. -The Room is on the smaller side but normal for Tokyo. -Clean-Queen Bed was very comfortable and you can adjust the room temperature easily.-Staff is very friendly and accommodating.- easy walk to everywhere and the Shimbashi station- make sure to take the above ground walkway.-Places to eat is abundant and a ton at Shimbashi. - Room was quiet and had great wifi.  Make sure to spring for the room with a view, it's awesome and saves you the time and effort to get into other places with a view- via Tokyo Tower. Also on a clear day you can see Mt. Fuji.
user_name:
HCM1225
New York City, New York

review_body: Stayed five nights. Views of Tokyo by day and night are fabulous! On a clear day the "Tower view" rooms give a view of Mt Fuji. Service from the front desk and room staff wan impeccable. English well spoken by all of the front desk staff. As others have said, the hotel is in the business district, but close to Ginza with many restaurants - large small, expensive and thrifty - in the vicinity. Two train stations close by. All in all a great package. Rooms a good size, well equipped very and beds very comfortable I'd happily stay here again.

Breathtaking views, great breakfast buffet, and the location was perfect- lots of train lines connect through hotel basement. Huge mall in train station and easy to get anywhere in the city. It was perfect for our vacation in Tokyo! Neighborhood is a business district but has a futuristic, blade runner vibe....also easy walk to Ginza.....everything was great, we highly recommend!

Luxurious hotels with every possible amenity available both in the rooms and in the hotel. Has a well-priced (~$26/person) breakfast buffet that's worth checking out at least once. Convenient location close to two subway stations (Shimbashi, Shiodome). Walkable distance to Ginza, another very active area. Can also walk to Tsukiji (~10 minutes) early in the morning before subway lines start running.Staff - everyone was extremely friendly, polite and spoke fluent English. Eager to help and even booked a restaurant for me in the area upon request.Hotel - very easy bus ride (airport limousine company - $45/person round trip) which got me from NRT to hotel (door to door). They even tag and take care of your luggage. Excellent free wifi everywhere in the hotel.Rooms - extremely clean, very well-serviced by the cleaning staff, beautiful views of the city, very quiet rooms, all the pillow types you can ask for are availableNo complaints at all. Would highly recommend to travellers willing to spend a bit more for a very comfortable stay.

I stayed at the Park Hyatt for the first time and despite being used to five-star service, I was surprised, how well managed this place feels compared to other five-star hotels. The service is friendly and not as distanced as in some other hotels in Japan. At the same time the rooms are great and really well-sized. Oh, and did I mention the views?

Very helpful staffs. Clean rooms though a little bit small. This is our honey moon stay and the hotel gave us a bottle of champagne. Then staffs helped us to book two restaurants which only accepted local phone bookage.

Stayed for two nights and loved the hotel, especially the view. I have never had a room so big anywhere in Japan, especially in Tokyo. The room was huge and the bed was king sized. (Kind of a wast but impressive!) We reserved a Tower View, Corner Room and would do so again in a minute. It was about 20% more then a standard but was very worth it! We don't generally stay in luxury hotel when we travel for work but this was a second honeymoon of sorts so the splurge was called for and it was exactly the right thing for us.The location is not perfect for sight seeing but the train station is a very short walk and you can get to most of the important sights within 20-30 mins.I will book this hotel again!

Beautiful views of Tokyo Tower and Mt Fuji from the room. Very friendly and helpful staff. Conveniently located near to Ginza. Train stations are within short walking distance. As the hotel is located in the CBD area, surroundings was relatively quiet during our weekends stay, which was good.

The hotel can access from Shinbashi station or Shiodome station. Both stations are connected through underway so it is easy to access without getting wet in case of rain. The path was flat so traveling with suitcase was also easy. Ginza is just next station and Roppongi is also close. The room was not very big but with comfortable bath and bedroom. I choose this hotel because I love Thaan spa. The amenity in the room was Thaan and it is refilled everyday. I love this hotel:)

The moment I saw Park Hotel Tokyo coming out from the list of hotels I have searched in Tokyo Area with the picture of Tokyo tower overlooking from the hotel room, I knew I wanted to stay here.You can't blame me for being overly decisive basing our hotel stay from the picture with a view, this is after all my 7th Wedding Anniversary Trip.But of course we did check if the hotel is accessible and thank heavens it's an added bonus that the hotel is near an MRT station which of course brings you around Tokyo. It's really an icing on the cake!If you like to walk around, the hotel is quite near to Ginza, there is also a Don Quixote store around the area, family mart and lawson so you would never worry about getting hungry. I think the hotel is in a business area hence, the location is quiet and not crowded unlike if you stay in areas like Shibuya or Shinjuku.We stayed in Corner King Room with Tokyo Tower View and the bed is spacious bigger than a king size bed which can even fit four people comfortably. Advisable to get this room for those staying with kids as well. And the view.. it really adds to the romantic touch of the trip!Just a little more information though about the hotel that you might want to reconsider before booking, in the event that the view and location are not enough reasons..:*Lobby on the 25th floor - so we got a little confused and lost looking for the hotel during our first night but the lobby view already gives you a glimpse of the Tokyo Tower*All Rooms on High Floor - with the lobby situated on 25th floor, guests rooms will of course have higher floors. For those who have issues with heights, FYI but for those who don't the view is captivating*No Swimming Pool - just in case you needed one

The hotel is in a great location since it is right by the Shiodome and Shimbashi stations, which gave us easy access by both subway and train to all the other parts of Tokyo. The nearby Shiodome City Center and Caretta Shiodome provided us with many good food options. The hotel is modern and beautiful, and our room was quiet and very comfortable. The hotel staff are all very helpful too.

This is a very good hotel with all the amenities. The rooms are not large, but more than adequate. The breakfast buffet was large with both Western and Japanese food and had the best croissants I've had - and we recently spent 2 weeks in Paris. The location is excellent - Shiodome has a few rail lines and an indoor passageway with shops and places to eat gets you to Shimbashi and a lot more rail lines.
I am very satisfied and want to visit again.Nice workers and great view.Only the breakfast - same menu on 2days hope this can be improved.But overall very much satisfied and want to visit again soon.

I stayed at this hotel in November 2015. The rooms are very nice and both the bedroom and bathroom are quite spacious for Tokyo. The location is great, walking distance to Tsukiji Fish Market and only a few minutes to Shimbashi Station and Ginza district. I'd like to extend a special thank you to the concierges, who were very helpful and knowledgeable. Only complaint is the wi-fi, which was slow at times. I would definitely stay at this hotel again.

The hotel employs an "artist in residence", and its lobby is crammed with "works of art". But in reality, the art is puerile, and the lobby is a mess because of all the exhibits. The service at the hotel is typically Japanese: polite, attentive, but highly obsessive, in the sense that things are done their way, or not at all. Bedrooms are small and, despite an attempt to jazz them up with unusual wallpaper, are nondescript. The breakfast on offer is the most boring of the lot: exactly the same items, placed in exactly the same place, every single day without exception, with no attempt to vary items, apart from one boiled sausage which is offered on alternate days!Overall, a solid but boring choice.

Stayed at this hotel for three nights as part of a tour group. Ideally located a 3 minute walk to Shimbasi station or another minute to Chuo Dori (Chuo Road), the main road through Ginza district. As we prefer to walk as much as possible this hotel is within walking distance to major shopping district and eateries. The hotel reception is on the 25th floor and the hotel has quality facilities throughout. Our room on the 30th floor overlooked Shimbasi station and Royal Park Hotel. Made use of nearby supermarket at Conrad hotel to buy snacks before (and after) days outings. We happened to be passing the Hayao Miyazaki clock at 6pm when its entertaining animated show started. Would reccommend this hotel for couples or business

Excellent stay...very nice staff...very good location....very kind people at the concierge....artist room must be an experience....very good breakfast -japanese and american-....hotel have direct connection door to door with narita airport thru limo bus....

Love the location of the hotel, the staffs' service attitude was tip top, room amenities were great too! Basically there wasn't anything to complain about this hotel. Most of the staffs there can speak English fairly decent so communication was a breeze.

Lovrly hotel in Shiodome area of Tokyo. Friendly, helpful staff good English at reception. Rooms are pleasant and reasonable sized for Tokyo. Woke to the Tokyo tower and Mt Fuji in the distance on a beautiful day.

This was our first visit to Japan, and this hotel was a great home base for use while there for 10 days. It was a great centrally located spot to stay and reach a ton of great destinations in and around Tokyo. The art rooms are really fun, and the staff is super helpful. I would not hesitate to stay here again on future trips to Tokyo.

Room with a great view (view of Tokyo tower) but noisy at night due to close proximity to train station.Conveniently located, within walking distance to major train stations. Limousine bus stops at this hotel.

Fantastic hotel. Book ended our Japan trip with 2 x 2 night stays in a twin room. Both rooms had lovely decor, great size beds and spacious room for a Japanese hotel. No squeezing past each other & struggling to find storage for suitcases. Stayed in a Tokyo Tower view room. Beautiful views across Tokyo & were lucky enough on the last day & night that the weather cleared and Mt Fuji appeared. Rooms have a window seat so you can sit with a drink at the window admiring the twinkling lights of Tokyo.Great location, close to JR Shimbashi station, walking distance from Ginza & one stop from Tsukiji fish market. Great little izakayas & yakitori joints in & around Shimbashi for cheap & tasty dinner meals.Really helpful reception, no issue with an early check in and happy to help out with all our questions.

Each staff member is very friendly and helpful. They allowed us for early check-in. We were able to leave our luggage at the hotel while traveling to Kyoto. They helped us to call the bus transfer company for a refund of tickets. They are great! The coffee and tea at the room are good, too.

My husband and I celebrated our honeymoon here and loved it. The view of the Tokyo tower from our room was amazing. The hotel is conveniently located near Ginza. The hotel concierge was very friendly.

The hotel location is perfect. We can access to Hamamatsucho bus terminal by taxi only cost 750 yen. 10 mins walk to Shimbashi and Shiodome station. Many restaurant and shopping mall nearby. 24 hours family mart just at basement. Our room was at 33rd floor. The highest floor is 34th. We had the best Tokyo view from our room. We stayed four nights and one of the day the weather was clear we can see Mt Fuji and Tokyo Tower. The night view from our room was amazing. Hotel staff are friendly and professional. We love this hotel very. Definitely would love to stay again! Lobby is at 25th floor. Enjoyed the view during check in. Room size is a little bit small to us. But it's still fine for us. It's comfortable enough.

Great accomodation with wonderful views across the harbour. Room is very comfortable with a big window to feel a sense of space.34 floors high is an experience and there is a convenience store within the building which has great pre cooked meals as well.

The Park is a classy professional hotel ideal for visiting Tokyo the first time.....fairly accessible from Narita airport - by train or limousine bus, well located for train and subway (Shimbashi or Shiodome). Excellent reception staff, and overall feel of a superior hotel. The standards rooms are OK, big enough and fairly well equipped although for the price I would have expected more and enjoyed better and moremodern rooms in my three week trip to Japan.For me the downside was that there was little of interest in the area, basically consisting of offices and Shimbashi station.There are lots of restaurants and bars on the other ide of the station, a short walk away by pedestrian walkway but the area around the hotel is dead with nothing at all open, especially at weekend? For me the Park was a great hotel to arrive at after a long flight from Europe and did the job , a decents night sleep and good transport access. But there are much better areas to stay in in Tokyo and as good if not better hotels for the price.

We stayed here for one night. The room wasn't too small and the staff is very helpful. Staff speaks good English, which seems to be rare in Tokyo hotels. The best part about this hotel is the artwork presented around the hotel, in the lobby and even in the rooms. It is really tastefully decorated. When we entered the lobby on the 25th floor, I wasn't sure if this was a hotel or a branch of MOMA. Also, the views from this hotel are stunning.

Booked this location for my last 2 nights in Tokyo, was able to get a room on the top floor (34th) which was a nice surprise but since the rooms starts on the 26th floor any room should have a nice view. Room was a little small compared to where we stayed previously (Grand Hyatt) but is the norm for Tokyo. Location was good, nearby Ginza and subway is nearby with access to Airport shuttle, we chose to use the Subway to the airport instead since the airport shuttle schedule was not as frequent as we would have preferred.

We booked three nights here on our way to New Caledonia for our honeymoon, and for our first time in Tokyo we found the location and accommodations perfect. The staff was very helpful and great with booking restaurants, and the hotel was actually able to hook us up with a great private guide for one day. Our room (the artist room) had a breathtaking view, was well cleaned and a decent size for a city-hotel room. The pillows could definitely be improved, but that's a personal thing.

We stayed 4 nights at the Park Hotel Tokyo and had a great stay. The staff were friendly and helpful. We had a room with the Tokyo Tower view on the 30th floor and it was breathtaking. Seeing the tower lit up at night was magical. We knew the room would be small compared to American sized hotel rooms and it was - but it was big enough. The bed was comfortable and clean. The bathroom was a decent size and very clean. This hotel is in a great location for catching many trains/subways to other parts of town. Directly above the Shiodome station, but we found ourselves using the Shimbashi Station (about a 10 minute walk) more often. We had Dinner in a Art Cafe once which was very good and had lunch at the hotel's French restaurant once which was also nice. The breakfast buffet was okay but too expensive. Breakfasts were the only downside to this hotel - not really any options other than the hotel buffet in close proximity. We decided to get food at the Family Mart downstairs for breakfasts. I would stay here again and recommend this hotel to others.

Booked one of the artist's rooms (the Washi room) for 3 nights. The themed room was very nice, clean, well furnished and lit, giving great views (especially the night view). This side of the hotel looks past the Nippon and Dentsu buildings towards the Tokyo Sky Tree (not to be confused with the Tokyo (Eiffel-style) Tower. The staff in hotel were very helpful and polite. View of Mount Fuji through the reception windows (on a clear day!) Great location, easy to walk around on the elevated pavements and only a 10 minute stroll to the shops in the Ginza district. The food of an evening was very good. We decided to eat in the main 'open' restaurant - I can highly recommend the Wagyu Curry with Rice, Japanese Fried Chicken and Japanese Beef Steak dishes. I have to mention our waiter, Lorenzo, who was great - really attentive and engaging. Nice little cocktail bar with very good cocktails and a plethora of whiskies. The buffet style 'English' breakfast was the only slight disappointment as there just wasn't enough choice. I hope they can improve on this for their western/European guests. Overall, a lovely modern hotel with a Japanese Art feel. I would definitely stay here again. Highly recommended.

We stayed at this wonderful property at the beginning of our stay in Japan and again at the end. On both occasions we stayed in one of their art rooms on the 31st floor. These rooms (the landscape and cherry blossom rooms) aren't real large but are very well appointed and have an excellent queen bed and bathroom. The view of the Tokyo Tower and on occasion, snow capped Mt. Fuji is amazing.The staff is exceptional, especially the concierge desk. Ms. Shiraki Asuka is the best concierge I've ever had the pleasure of working with. She did everything we asked and more. The room rates are very reasonable and the restaurants are very good. The location is in a business district; but there is a subway stop in the basement of the building. Also, its only a 10 minute walk to the Ginza. All in all, a great place to stay.

Very nice nice modern hotel where we have stayed before. Room with tower view has a fantastic view over Tokyo tower especially at night.Very friendly staf with concierge service at front desk with great knowledge about Tokyo and is able to advice book restaurants for you.We will stay there again because once you have visited Tokyo you would like to go again.

Hotel staff was attentive, hotel was in a great location to serve our needs, easy to reach the rail/subway station. Carpet in the room was stained, room was poorly located, so we were not completely thrilled with the room overall.

Hotel is on floors 25 to 35 of the building. Very easy to access from Haneda airport with no changing of trains and a far of around Yen 500. Can walk from Underground station the remaining 1km to the hotel all on underground walkways. There is an sub way station from another line right outside the hotel. Hotel is located in a business area and there is a McDonalds and an "English" bar close by if you are tired of sushi. A safe area to walk around and near one of the big shopping districts. The western style breakfast was good. Wasn't running that week so not sure how good for jogging.

Recently stayed 4 nights with a Tokyo tower view room. The location was excellent with direct underground access to Shiodome train station. Breakfast was delicious with a wide assortment of both western and Japanese items. Staff spoke fluent English and were very polite.

We stayed here for a week for our Tokyo honeymoon, we were treated like royalty by the staff.We arrived early in the morning after missing a flight connection the night before and our first experience was seeing the city from our 29th floor room (the hotel starts on the 25th floor, so it is more exclusive than one might initially think), and that wwas breathtaking.Breakfast offered loads of variety (however no soya milk, which to me is quite strange), I started every morning with miso soup, yum.We only ate once in each of the restaurants, they were a bit posh for us, however we did get a lovely Happy Honeymoon dessert plate on the first night.The bar however was a different matter. Lovely cocktails and beer selection, and if you love whiskey you will be in heaven.My only real criticism would be about the disconnect between the spa and reception, as they are different companies, you cannot check availability or book spa services from hotel reception.What more than made up for this was location and the sunrise and sunset views of Mount Fuji.Great hotel I would recommend highly.

Stayed for 4 nights on business trip in November 2015. Don't confuse this hotel with the Park Royal hotel which is across the street, or the Prince Park Tower maybe a mile away!This is a great hotel. Located in the top 10 or so floors of a high-rise in the Shiodome area of Tokyo. Views from the lobby and rooms were great - we had a waterfront view towards Odaba Island. Some of the rooms are "artist" rooms where the hotel hired artists to decorate - our room was very bright and unique.Like all Tokyo hotels - rooms are small, but well laid out and comfortable. Be careful how much luggage you bring.Like all nice Tokyo hotels - service was beyond great. We asked the hotel to help with some dinner reservations, and they not only called for us, they provided maps and street views for all of our restaurants. Of course, everything worked great and was super clean.Location is good for some things, bad for others. The hotel is located next to the Shiodome stop on the Oedo subway line, or else is about a 10-15 min walk from the Shimbase stop on the Ginza and JR lines. The Shimbase stop is a lot more useful, so we found ourselves making the walk a lot - fortunately, it is either via an underground tunnel (with lots of useful services) or an elevated walkway, which was nicer but not covered. You can also walk to Ginza in about 20 minutes. The immediate area is kind if a dull office area, but has all the basic services you would need.

We stopped here for 8 nights which was amazing. The view from our hotel room was something off a picture postcard. We were on the 33rd floor of the hotel and we had the view of Tokyo Tower and in the distance was Mount Fuji. The room was very clean and comfortable. Staff was very helpful and friendly always willing to help.

I can only echo the sentiments of others. We really enjoyed this hotel. Great view of Tokyo Tower, service was excellent, close to Shidome and Shimbashi metro stations. We had the JR Pass and so were able to catch the JR Yamanote circle line to main areas including Shibuya and Shinjuku, as well as being close to Roppongi and Tokyo Station where we came in from Kyoto. We had the Artist Room Sakura, with the cherry blossoms and butterflies. Bonus for me, as I used to be a member, the bar serves Scotch Malt Whisky Society scotches which was a nice, if expensive, surprise and treat. This was our first time in Tokyo, so I don't have other hotels to compare to, but I can enthusiastically recommend this hotel for people, especially couples, looking for a chic, boutique, not too expensive (by Tokyo standards) hotel.

Beautiful , comfortable hotel with stunning views over Tokyo. Great location. Highly recommended!Close to Ginza, the shopping district, the fish market and Yakitori Lane(!), easy access to the underground and trains.The rooms are "big" for Japan, well maintained furniture , subtle lighting in the room and well equiped bathroom. Needless to say everything is spotless! The hotel restaurant is very good, on the expensive side but recommended as well. You can eat cheaper at the nearby restaurants. A little advice: if you want to eat at particular / traditional Japanese restaurants(e.g.Teppanyaki-ya,Okonomiyaki-ya etc.) make reservations in advance! (I do recomend Sometaro Okonomiyaki Restaurant near Kaminarimon Gate and Isaka Ya Ism, Daita) The staff are very helpful and extremely polite. They sent our luggage with no hassle to the next hotel after checking and making sure they will be delivered to our rooms. Do your homework, get an underground pass (pasmo) and explore Tokyo from this beautiful hotel. Or try to get a guide!

Although the pictures does not translate to reality, the room is still good. It is not that big as it is pictured in photograph. The room with the Tokyo tower view is really amazing. Although the noise from the shinkansen train down below is still can be heard also the train, but it is not that bad. The TV channel in this hotel is only Japanese. Service is ok. The staff is friendly and also very professional. Reflective of the Japanese culture. The location of this hotel is in the business district. Going out at 8 am to 9 am and from 6pm to 7 pm, will be like going against or with the salary men... they are walking really fast and the train from the station nearby will be really really crowded. But this hotel is really nicely located, as it is near to Ginza, Tokyo station. There are 5 lines, I guess, near to this hotel.

It takes a few minutes to get up to the lobby on the 25th floor of the Park Hotel, but the view of Tokyo on the way up in the lift is amazing. The lobby itself is immense which includes the open plan restaurant and huge projections on the wall. The staff were all very polite, check-in was smooth and went up to our room; one of the Artist Queen Rooms - we got the Sakura room which was decorated absolutely beautiful with cherry blossoms on the walls and butterflies on the ceiling. The view over Tokyo was magnificent with the Tokyo Tower in the distance. We were also treated to free saké as well. The room itself was a good size and immaculately clean. I would certainly recommend it to anyone!

Best view on Tokyo Tower. Ideally located next to Ginza Line which goes to main tourist landmarks. There's also a direct train from Narita. And Tokyo station is just 2 stops away. Nice staff. Only dark spot is gym is private so you have to book to use it.

We stayed here for three nights on our arrival in Tokyo and again on our last night before leaving. It's in a good location, close to transport links. Rooms were on the small side but otherwise ok.Breakfast buffet was more than adequate if not the finest.Helpful front desk and concierge.Generally therefore a satisfactory but not outstanding hotel.

Concierge was very helpful in making reservations. Staff was helpful. Room was clean. Had a great view of Tokyo tower and Mount Fuji. Good location within walking distance of Tsukiji market, subway/trains, Ginza etc.

Incredible views from our room and reception. They were so great we just got a bottle delivered to room and enjoyed the sunset. Would definitely stay here again. Beautifully finished hotel, convenient with subway beneath it. Only issue for us was room service menu is very limited and doesn't go all night. So after returning from a late bit of karaoke we had no option but the convenience store in the basement. Still- was an incredible experience waking up to the views.

this hotel is located close to Ginza district, Tsukiji fish market and Hamarikyu gardens. Shiodome and Shimbashi subway stations. Customer service in this hotel is amazing - tour company did not pick us up at the hotel (mistakenly went to Royal Park Hotel) and the hotel manager had one of the concierge employees accompany us in a taxi to the station to the bus terminal to the meeting place for our tour, and checked us in! They even paid for the cab ride over! We made our tour just in the nick of time, thanks to the generosity of the hotel. There are some restaurants near the hotel, and within 10 minute walk to Ginza area (try to take in a Kabuki performance ). The hotel has a straight-on view of the Tokyo tower from their lobby (25th floor), breathtaking!

Stayed for 3 nights at the end of a tour round Japan. The hotel, service and rooms were very welcome after 2 weeks of travelling. Staff were friendly and professional, room was very comfortable and spotlessly clean, the location is central, but actually finding the hotel can be a little confusing at first. Would definitely recommend to family and friends.

Beautiful hotel, very quiet, peaceful and relaxing after walking around for hours. Walking distance to Ginza, Imperial Palace, Tokyo Station and transportation options. Delicious meals and lovely staff.

Spent an excellent couple of nights in this hotel. The room had been painted by a young japanese artist and it was brilliant. The hotel was well out of the norm and benefited enormously from its art-oriented flavour.

Stayed here for a few nights for a business trip--and my first time in Tokyo. Location of hotel is great--connected to the Shiodome station and a short walk (on elevated walkway) to the larger Shimbashi station. Very easy to get around. Service is wonderful. Brekkie is also great--more western than Japanese. A small salad bar (fresh veggies) was available at brekkie. The room I had was small and a weird shape (it was at end of hall, and apparently on curved corner of building). Small, long, narrow window looked out onto the city. Took a while to figure out that the light switches were on the headboard. Bathroom (and the room) was small but very clean.For my purposes (mainly a place to sleep after full days of meetings / sightseeing), it was perfect.

Very convenient location for subway. I found the staff so friendly and helpful, an absolute pleasure to stay here. I had a basic double room which was very comfortable and nice, a great bathroom and ticked what I needed!

This hotel is in a quieter part of Tokyo, away from the nightlife but still close to Roppongi. It is very easy to find and get to on the JR line. The check in staff were friendly and efficient and the room is a large size and very quiet. The views are amazing from the room. Ginza is nice area with lots of restaurants and bars. It was far more expensive however than another hotel we stayed in in Tokyo and overall I don't know if it was worth the extra money. But it is clean and quiet and very near the transport system so I would stay again.

Well located in Ginza close to train, metro and all necessary connections this hotel has everything to be excellent. Moreover, the hotel has outstanding views over Tokyo and Mount Fuji.The reception was however quite chaotic on our arrival and nobody explained on hotel facilities, it was a automatic way of receiving guests.We used the concierge service twice and we got a just ok service, but they did not accept to do a restaurant booking for the day of the check out, as bookings need to be only when you are staying with the hotel. Compared to the great service that Japanese generally provide, it was a cold minimal service.The breakfast is good but it is in the lobby/atrium, with a limited number of tables and the multi use as bar and breakfast makes that the space does not serve perfectly any of the two purposes: not a real chill our bar not a restaurant/ breakfast space.We did not see much of the "art" that is used to advertise the hotel, rooms are just standard and confortable hotel rooms, there is no particular design or artistic decoration. With more friendly staff and some improvements in the lobby this could be a very good place to stay in Tokyo. As it is now, we would not return.

We stayed here initially for four nights in late October and returned early November for one night just prior to returning home. Hotel is located on 25-34th story of the Shiodome Media Tower. Rooms are moderate in size but have a clever layout and include a picture window. We splashed out for our last night and were rewarded with a clear view of Mount Fuji. Easy access via Shimbashi station ( JR. Line and subway) and Shiidome station (subway). Handy for a quick morning visit to the fish markets. Very quiet rooms with faint background of the city. Breakfast buffet provided both Japanese and western cuisine. Tour desk was very helpful confirming pre organised tours and phoning the ryokan to advise of our pending arrival time and pick up details. This was most appreciated. We had a hiccup when checking in for our last stay - issue with the requested late checkout and their credit card reader failed. This was embarrassing and caused some concern, I immediately phoned my bank and was reassured that the problem was the hotel's card reader. The hotel charged me 680 yen for the call. Overall good value for central Tokyo accommodation.

The hotel is on top of an office building so all the rooms have a good view. We looked out over the bay. Staff was very helpful. I have celiac disease and they went out of their way to accommodate me for breakfast, which was a feast. Hotel is near fish market.

The Park Hotel Tokyo is located in a business district and not immediately close to any shopping or tourist activities. However, the hotel is nice, clean and the staff welcoming and helpful. The room was small (we were on 26th floor) but very clean and completely fine for 3 days stay. Our room had a view of Tokyo Tower wish is really wonderful at night all lit up. Also two of the mornings were very clear and we could see MT Fuji very well in the distance. The breakfast is great and offers variety. Most of the guests in the hotel seemed to be with tour groups so I assume it is a well frequented hotel and the staff certainly seem well trained. Costs we moderate and we were very happy with the price/value ratio. The only negative was the fitness center - literally a small room with a treadmill and an elliptical and not well maintained. The proximity to tourist locations walking distance was not great, however the subway is very convenient.

This is a very nice hotel. The staff are friendly and courteous. There is a good lobby area where breakfast is served. We were offered a room upgrade which was worth it for the size (very good compared with average Tokyo rooms and significantly bigger than the standard room), the view (nice view to Tokyo Tower, but the view from the standard room is also OK) and free access to the swimming pool and gym (normally charged which seems a bit much). The upgrade also gives access to the Club Lounge, but this is not worth having as there is nothing much there. The room is very comfortable, with a good bathroom.The breakfast was good. Not a huge choice but what they had was well prepared and presented. We didn't eat in the restaurants but they looked nice.Wifi is free and reliable.The hotel is next to Shiodome Metro station, but this is only on the Yurikamome line which is not so useful. However it's only a short walk to Shimbashi Station which is a great connecting station for several Metro lines and also the JR line so it's easy to get to most places including Tokyo Station for the Shinkansen. It is also walking distance to the Ginza district and the Tokyo Fish Market (well worth a visit).I can't comment on the price as it was part of a package so I don't know what it cost.Overall highly recommended.

We stayed at the park hotel in October for the first three nights of our Japan trip. We liked it so much that we decided to spend also the last night when we returned to Tokyo. Both views sides are amazing and the rooms are clean and spacious enough for Japanese standards. The price is also good value for a 4 star hotel. Good location, close to two tube/rail station and attentive staff that really take care of their guests. There is also a coach service to and from Narita airport that leaves you at the Hotel main entrance, very handy if you arrive with luggage and don't want to bother changing trains.

The Park Hotel Tokyo is fantastically well situated for a first time trip to Tokyo. Close to all major transport lines including the Yamanote circular and the Shinkansen from Shinagawa the hotel allows for relatively straight forward orientation.Inside, the hotel offers all the charme of a 1990s business hotel, much improved by the very charming and helpful staff. The rooms (we stayed in both a King's Corner and a Premium Twin) were serviceable – the view made them memorable. Everything is perfectly clean, the bathroom has one of those amazing toilets (easy to understand), and the mirror is heated so doesn't steam up.Beds are comfortable, there's free tea and coffee, and one of those ever present FamilyMarts in the basement, perfect for snacks and drinks.The hotel sits atop the Kyodo Media Organisation (think a Japanese version of ITN) and opposite Nippon Television which sports an amazing clock designed by Studio Ghibli at its side (watch out for the three-hourly display!). The area around the hotel is used for outdoor TV shooting which includes mascots and all sorts.

This is a modern hotel occupying the top 12 floors of a 38 floor building. Lobby on 25th floor. Excellent staff, good english. Beautifully laid out and cool art everywhere. I recommend an "Art Room" painted up extensively by Japanese artists. Enjoyed drinks at the lobby bar and Lorenzo took great care of me. Room was reasonable size but small by western standards. HIGHLIGHT -- I had a Tower View room , which has an expansive view over the city. Last morning, it was clear and sunny and behold! Mt. Fuji right there looking at me from afar. A lifetime memory.

A good choice as it's close to the metro and JR line. The hotel reception is on the 25th floor of the building so you have wonderful views of the city when you arrive. (on a clear day you'll see Mt. Fuji) The breakfast is plentiful and you can choose Western or Japanese. Our room was immaculate and we had a very comfortable and peaceful stay. (they have the quietest lifts) We found all of the staff helpful and friendly. I'd recommend a stay here.

The hotel lobby was very nice with wonderful unique art. The staff was very hospital, kind and helpful. The concierge answered all my questions. The best part of the location of the hotel was the night view of Tokyo Tower. Which can be seen from the lobby. The room was average and the toilet in d bathroom was very nice I would love one just like it in my house.

We bookended our trip to Japan with stays in the Park Hotel and enjoyed both stays immensely. The hotel is within a stone's throw of both Shimbashi and Shiodome metro stations, and within easy walking distance of Ginza and the Tsukiji fish market. We stayed on the 34th and 31st floor and the top floor particularly has great views over the river to Odaiba. The rooms are well equipped (particularly the bathroom supplies which are of excellent quality and variety). They are very comfortable with lovely beds and bedding. As with most Japanese hotels (in our experience), wardrobe space was limited although the second room (31st floor) was more spacious. Breakfast was extensive and tasty with a variety of western options and a good Japanese selection. All of the staff were very polite, helpful and spoke excellent English (as well as humouring my rather poor attempts at Japanese!).

I spent 2 nights at the Park Hotel Tokyo and was extremely please with the hotel room, service and food. The hotel itself is conveniently located across from a major train station and is within walking distance of the Tokyo Tower. I can't say enough great things about the hotel and the staff. I plan to stay there again on my next trip.

We stayed in the hotel twice during our trip around Japan - upon arrival for a couple of days and in the end when we discovered Tokyo. Simply said - the staff and the location of the hotel were just great. The room had a fantastic view, was clean and large enough to host the three of us for more than a week in a row. You have the Yamanote Line a few minutes walk away which brings you to all the spots you need to see. But in the end what stays is the staff - they'll never let you down with any question or request you may have.

The hotel is situated very well, close to both the Shiodome Metro station and the Shimbashi JR station on the Yamanote line. It is safe, and very clean. The room we had was very spacious - unlike what we have heard of (and experienced of) other Japan hotels. We would have liked a wider range of food choices - specially vegetarian.

My boyfriend and I stayed in this hotel while we visited Tokyo. The location is great, about midway between everything we wanted to see and do. The rooms were somewhat small, but clean and comfortable. We would stay here again!

Very clean and beautiful hotel in the heart of Tokyo. The room is a bit small as expected from hotels in Japan. The service is excellent, and the front desk personnel is very helpful. You will find everything you need in your room except an iron if you decide to iron your cloths. The iron can be brought to you from the front desk if you ask for. The hotel has also breakfast, but my time was limited so I could not enjoy their breakfast. The view from your room will be spectacular as you can see Tokyo from a big window in your room.

Stay 7 nights. Good room condition, just the pillow too flat. Mattress also too hard. Best location, go to everywhere is convenient. And waste time to wait the lift. Only one lift can reach basement. No so convenient.

Room is nice and clean, staff are so polite and helpful. Before coming to Japan , people warned me , Japanese can't speak very well English. Definitely not the staff in this hotel. Very good location. My room can see both Fuji mountain and Tokyo tower. Hotel even prepared kids slippers and toothbrush for us . The slippers are not the not the normal kinda slippers you get from other hotels. They are very good quality , comfy and thick soles. A lots of nice details can make this hotel different from the others! highly recomend. Only thing not perfect is the room is very tiny small, but well, it's Tokyo, what you expect:) In short, good hotel,I will still book this hotel if I go again.Xiaoyuan Li lived Sept 2015

Well located close to both Shimbashi and Shiodome stations, the Park Hotel in the Shiodome Media Tower has reception, lounge and restaurants on the 25th floor and guest rooms on the floors above. Walkways and underpasses provide safe, quick transit to stations and shops, and across busy streets. We enjoyed a spacious corner room on Floor 32 with views to Ginza, Hama-rikyu Gardens, the Sumida River and its bridges and the endlessly fascinating train lines. Quality fittings and fixtures and toiletries were matched only by the outstanding service from all staff members we encountered. A Family Mart in the basement, with very helpful staff, is convenient for food, drinks and general purchases. Attractions close by include the Tsujuki Fish Market, the delightful Hama-rikyu Gardens, Ginza (an easy walk), and a stop for the water bus to Asakusa. Don't miss the large animated copper clock by Hayao Miyazaki on a nearby walkway. It "performs" 4 times a day on weekdays and 5 times on weekends. Check the times, it's worth watching.Spoil yourself, stay at the Park Hotel next time you're in Tokyo.

Wonderful place in Shiodome. The view from floor 25 is spectacular. The only downside is the lack of jogging tracks nearby, which could be a problem if you are a "running-gaijin" like me. But everything else was great.

My grand son Erwan and I are In Japan to celebrate his 12th birthday. He himself chose the Park Hotel on internet, because of the flabbergasting view. We were enchanted by our stay! The view is in fact out of breath and the rooms are comfortable, modern and so well equipped.The hotel is perfectly located and the staff is devoted and refined.Such nice memories for the rest of our lives!

For a reasonable price you get everything you would expect and more. The tower view doesn't disappoint at all, and the art isn't limited to the specialised rooms.On a practical level, the staff are excellent including maybe the most knowledgeable concierge I've met, you are five minutes from a busy train station on the central circle line, and there are plenty of facilities from the 25th floor lobby upwards. Of these I used the restaurant, cocktail bar and art shop with no complaints, plus the ground floor cafe.The size of room is unlikely to wow anyone, but by Japanese standards that is nothing surprising. The only other negative was that the quality of air conditioning wasn't excellent, with a bonus one on the floor, but both were quiet and did the job in time.On arrival at midday the room was ready early and a cheap upgrade was available that maintained the tower view. I'm not usually one for upselling, but for little more than the equivalent of £10 a night extra this was a reasonable example of it.

Very good location, close to the Shimbashi Station (10 mins walk) which connects to the Tokyo Station. Quiet, beautiful view of the Tokyo Tower; rooms were clean (we stayed on 2 different occasions), beds comfortable, staff extremely polite and helpful. The icing on the cake is the coin-operated laundry room which meant we didn't have any dirty clothes to bring home. More than happy to go and stay again.

This was the first hotel we had on our three week trip in Japan, let me tell you, after an exhausting 9 hour flight this place literally felt like heaven - this feeling continued throughout our whole stay in this hotel. The hotel is located on one of the higher floors of a sky scraper. The atrium/lobby provides gorgeous views of Tokyo tower both at night and during the day. The concierge speak good English and are very friendly and helpful. The hotel itself is not cheap and is more on the luxury side. There is a lovely sitting area within the lobby and off in separate rooms are a bar area and a restaurant, we tried both the bar and the restaurant and the buffet breakfast - all of which I could not praise enough. The bar is apart of some sort of whisky association and they have some top quality drinks to try and possibly the most delicious peach bellini I've ever drunk before. The restaurant next door is a fusion of French/Japanese and whilst the portions seem small they are definitely fulfilling and delicious. The breakfast buffet also boasts an impressive spread - there are both Japanese and western options and everything tastes really fresh and nothing seemed dry or old. The breakfast seating can fill up quickly so I'd advise to go down as soon as possible to ensure you snag a seat.We booked one of the corner rooms with a view of the Tokyo Tower and I can't say much more then wow. The room was spacious and luxurious - the bathroom for Japanese standards was quite large and impeccably stocked. The bed, by Australian standards they'd basically pushed two huge king sized beds together - no complaints here it made for the most comfortable sleep I've ever had. During the day the heat from the sun can be quite strong against the windows but there is A/C in the rooms so you won't suffer. If you're lucky enough you might even be able to catch a glimpse of the mountains in the skyline, this is one of the most amazing sights I have ever seen. Waking up in the morning and seeing Tokyo tower and the sunrise AND THE MOUNTAINS! Break taking. Also there is a belief that if you and your loved one are awake and looking at Tokyo Tower before they shut the lights off you will be together forever.Overall whilst this hotel is on the pricey side it is worth every penny.

Great view of Mount Fuji and Tokyo Tower. Location good for getting train in and out of Tokyo and for sights on this side of Tokyo. Rooms were fine however rooms were a little noisy from the trains which did wake me up (but not my wife..)

We stayed at the Park Hotel during our visit to Tokyo for 6 nights.If you take the Airport Limousine bus from Narita Airport, then this hotel is about one hour away, and the bus stops right in front of the Hotel.Upon getting off the bus, we were welcomed by the staff and taken upto the reception on the 25th Floor.Standing on the 25th floor, gives a spectacular view of the surrounding areas, in particular the Tokyo Tower.We also liked the views from our rooms.The hotel is done up in an artistic way, and has good dining options. We expected tiny rooms in Tokyo, but were happy to see rooms of a decent size.The best part of the hotel is the convenient location with the Shimbashi, and Shiodome stations being walking distance.We also visited the Hamarikyu Gardens which is also walking distance.The Tokyo Imperial Palace and Roppongi Hills is a short train ride away.It is also convenient to visit the Tsukiji Fish Market if someone is interested to visit it.There are also good restaurants nearby.The concierge was extremely helpful and helped us make the most of our trip to Tokyo.The breakfast is also good, though a but pricey, and has plenty of variety even for vegetarians.

Having read most reviews we looked forward to staying there on our way back from travelling all over Japan. We were given room 2609' which is 1st floor above lobby, firstly room so small both single beds together ,no gap for person by wall to get out, if you are a light sleeper avoid this floor as trains are just below you. General cleanliness was not great, carpet looked dirty, and coffee stains inside bathroom door and hairs in sink and to my horror a big black hair in the bed. !!! In each hotel we have made a point of having a drink at "Happy Hour" just an example Beer 1000yen (you can get it at any Resturant for 450 yen, but......happy hour it only went to 800yen. Which is only a tiny reduction, having stayed at the Marriott in Osaka that was the bees knees for everything, they did 2 drinks, cocktails you name it for 1000 yen and the place was packed. There was not a soul at this hotels "Happy Hour " And we didn't stay. Somehow just thought place was in need of face lift.

We stayed in a high floor, non-smoking room which had wonderful views over Tokyo. The room was quiet and comfortable for the little time we spent there. The bathroom was clean but not very contemporary and the toilet was exactly what you would expect in Japan; buttons and functions to suit every need! The staff were polite and from the lobby you could look out to the Tokyo tower. The location of the hotel was fantastic, just minutes away from the train and metro stations. We have already recommended this hotel to friends for a stay in Tokyo!

The rooms were pretty small but fine (compared to others we stayed at in Japan), the service was excellent, the location was convenient near Shinbashi and Shiodome train stations that provide easy access to the popular parts of Tokyo in roughly 30 min or so. The location is super convenient for walking to Tsukiji Fish Market (approx. 15 min walk). This is more of a business district location with lots of office buildings in the area. I would definitely stay in an area like Shinjuku or Shibuya is you're looking for better nightlife, restaurants, etc.

I love everything about The Park Hotel Tokyo. The staff is friendly & helpful, the rooms are clean & comfortable, the location in Shiodome is ideal. And the rates are reasonable, especially for the quality offered.

Size of the bed and bathroom not great, at list for European standards, maybe in Tokyo the reference is different.All the rest was very, very good.Excellent care of the customers and top-level concierge!

We stayed here October 15. Great Hotel, close to metro and clean. Staff were great and welcoming. Helped advise where to go and explained directions. My only negative would be the pillows , kept waking up as they didn't seem to keep their shape. Great views of the tower.

An excellent location - giving easy access to the trains and the main tourist attractions in Tokyo. Great views of the Tokyo Tower. Rooms are a good size for Japan and smart and comfortable. Staff are helpful with some English spoken.
user_name:
Jo B
North Yorkshire, United Kingdom

review_body: Stayed here for four nights in September. Arrived early, and they were very happy to hold our baggage until we returned for check in - in fact they took it up to the room for us which was a nice touch. Staff were always friendly, welcoming and helpful. Our "City Queen Room" had a great view out over Tokyo bay. Room wasn't huge but had everything we needed including like most Japanese hotels, robes, slippers, toiletries, toothbrushes etc etc. Good wifi. The location was great - at Shiodome which is really well connected to the Metro and Monorail. Close to Tsukiji fish market, the Detached Palace Gardens and easy access almost anywhere. Breakfast was really good - an excellent selection of Western and Japanese options. Finding it was a bit tricky - there is a subway direct from the Metro at Shimabshi, or you can use the walkways above street level. We would certainly stay here again.

The hotel is fantastic, floor 33 with great views over the city towards Mount Fuji which was covered in snow. Nice spacious room, beautifully clean and tidy. Interesting decor and The eu suite even had a heated toilet seat. All this and only a stones throw from the railway station.

Great hotel. The staff were fabulous! We had an amazing view over the city and could see right out to Odaiba. Location was really good with subway below it. Would definitely stay here again. Staff were very helpful and polite. Just a short walk to Ginza. The art work was very nice.

I am usually skeptical of Big City hotels. They usually are high priced and overrated versus value. Got a good deal on TA for two nights early October. We booked a small room for three, but were offered a King city tower view for a small charge. We accepted and were not disappointed. The view of the city and tower is simply to die for. You don't need the room to see it as it's available in the lobby, but there's something about laying in the bed while watching the mesmerizing view. Rooms are clean and well kept. A bit small, but standard for Tokyo. Staff was friendly and accommodating for our American needs. Subway/train station is connected to hotel so a plus when raining. Of note- the hotel is just a portion of the building (starting 25th floor). Not a big deal unless you don't like being up high!!

We stayed here for one night at the start of our 2-week trip to Japan. The room was more spacious than I had expected for a Japanese hotel, the bed and bathroom were great, and we appreciated the provided toiletries. The staff were friendly and eager to help, and the breakfast (which we paid extra for) was convenient, tasty, and interesting.

We stayed at the Park Hotel for four nights on vacation and could not be more pleased. We booked a room with the view of the Tokyo Tower and it was amazing. The room itself was very comfortable, and the bathroom had very nice amenities. We asked for extra pillows because the ones we had were on the flatter side. Staff were exceptionally polite and helpful. The hotel is within walking distance to the metro and JR stations (10 min) and quite convenient. Convenience stores and restaurants are very close by. And the rate was reasonable considering how nice it was. Highly recommend the Park Hotel!
user_name:
transcience
New York City, New York

review_body: My wife, 2yrs old son and I stayed for 5 days in this hotel in a queen sized Tokyo Tower view Artist room.Service was superb, the tower has direct basement access to the rail and metro, food was good, and all was in exchange of a very fair price.I would definitely stay in this hotel again.

Our hotel was located in one of the many business districts of Tokyo. The hotel was in a huge building which started on the 25th Floor so we already knew we were going to get a great view but we had no idea how great it would turn out to be. We booked a room with a view of the Tokyo tower and of course paid a little extra for this. However we booked months before our trip and got an amazing rate at almost 50% of their advertised rate. Our check-in time was 2pm but we arrived at our hotel a little after 12 but we were told our room was ready and could go up straight away. Our room was on the top floor and the view was truly amazing. For our first night in Tokyo we couldn't have chosen a better hotel. We were even more amazed the next morning when we awoke to a perfect blue sky and realised we could see Mt Fuji in the distance.The staff were incredibly helpful and friendly and could not do enough for us. We actually felt guilty that Japan has no a no tipping culture. The concierge was fantastic and was able to help us book a Mt Fuji tour the next day and arrange tickets for the robot restaurant a week later (review to follow). We were very sad to leave this hotel and wished that we had stayed here for our entire time in Tokyo. If you want a first class hotel without paying the price then this hotel is a must. Pay a little more and get the view of the Tokyo Tower we promise that you won't regret it.

This hotel certainly did not let us down in anyway. The front desk excellent/speedy arrival and departure, concierges excellent, waiter staff/restaurant excellent. Though we only had a couple of breakfasts inhouse, we found these also to a high standard. Room was of adequate size for two adults, bathroom well equiped and our views greatview from 33rd floor out to

The facilities of this hotel were lovely and quite luxurious, however the overall experience was dampened by the service. In particular during breakfast our waiter took my husband's tea twice when he was yet to finish it and replaced it with the incorrect tea each time then started clearing our table for the next patrons before we had even finished (while we were having a look at the buffet). Must say however that the porter that helped us to our room was friendly and provided all the information we needed for our stay. If the restaurant staff had been more helpful/understanding it would have improved our experience but overall we did enjoy the hotel and its convinient location.

My wife and I stayed at this hotel and thought it was very good. It is very close to 2 train stations, which by the way is the best way to get around Tokyo and Japan. The staff are very friendly and helpful. We asked directions for the rail system and they gave really clear instructions.The hotel is located in the Shiodome area and has easy to the elevated walkways. Clost to Shimbasi station which is a major subway that connects to the JR Line and others.The room we had was on the 34th floor, room was a little small with suit cases not being able to be stowed away. Beautiful views though. The hotel is walking distance to the local fish and normal markets which are something to see. Also the Hiru Riki garden. Entrance is 300yen per person, worth a look, then catch the ferry to Asacusa (1400yen) walk around the markets here and catch the subway home. This is better than trying to organise a bus tour, doing it yourself provides the freedom of doing things at your own pace.See if you can get breakfast included, if you can't don't go there, too expensive. There is other places around that offer cheaper alternatives.

We booked our stay at the Park Hotel Tokyo primarily based on location and price. The reviews looked phenomenal. Seemed pretty central and easy to access many places. And on top of that, this just looked like a hotel you would see in high rise Tokyo. This place was fantastic. It was really fancy as corny as that sounds. I guess for me when I am used to Hampton Inn's and that sort of hotel this seems like a whole different level. Honestly the food there was overpriced for our budgets. The juice was around 700-800 yen for a glass. We ended up eating elsewhere as there was a lot to see and do in a short walking distance. Just downstairs from the hotel was a little place called MOMI's and TOY's which was fabulous for a quick cheaper breakfast. Otherwise the subway and the Family Mart in the basement are always great quick stop spots. The rooms here are a bit condensed. But not to be unexpected. The views from every room are extraordinary. I loved looking out the window and when not raining, being able to see the sprawl of Tokyo. All of the rooms are the 26th floor or higher. I think up till 32. But not sure. They seemed to have really nice amenities in the bathroom and the hotel staff were exceptionally helpful. When you do go, be sure to go to the right hotel. There are two hotels right kitty corner from each other with pretty similar names. So be sure you are going to the Park Hotel Tokyo and not the other one. And while I'm at it. Just book it now! Totally worth it.
